text: I am here right now and I am signing up on Yelp for this. It is a cheap looking place, with no outstanding food yet soo overpriced. 4 stars?? You need to get out more! 2 stars for the shady way in pricing products and non existent service.

One of the VERY FEW places in Vegas where you're gonna find a piece of back east. Cugino's is phenominal. The food is authentic and tastes like you're sittin' back in Jersey or NYC. The service is like you're among family and the prices you cannot beat. You will fall in love with this place! I ordered a plain cheese pizza and some other heavenly things. After being overly disappointed time and time again with so many other pizza places out here I almost gave up and...FINALLY!!!! CUGINO'S!!! I  found my pizza place. no more searching out here. Walk inside the place and you'll find classic brands of pastas and sauces from when you were a kid. And *drum roll* they make THEE BEST tiramisu in town! I ain't kiddin! There are so many good things to say about this place. Gaahd, I love this place!

This place was pretty good and I do think I will come back. It doesn't deserve 5 stars because I feel like if a restaurant is going to get a 5 star rating then it should blow me away. This place is more of a good enough to go back, but not somewhere I'm going to go crazy about. I ordered the parmesan chicken and it was pretty good but it was kinda small. It was a bit pricy for the portion ($10) but I'll pay a little extra if that means I get a good meal. I'd only recommend this place if you're in the area, but not a place where I would go out of my way to get to.
Absolutely love it, authentic italian food, wish there was more of this kind in germany! As being a half italian myself i can tell you that the food is homemade and made with passion.

Have been coming here for years but Al Gore hadn't invented the Internet yet so I couldn't of even posted if I wanted to! It is funny to come into a place like this and watch men eat salads like the table next to me, I come here for the sandwiches  artery clogging meats and cholesterol increasing cheesecake. Keep your salads away from me you health nut!!! Got the Meatball Parmigiana, nothing healthy about it just pure unadulterated goodness. I managed to get here before the lunch rush which I'm glad I did because then your waiting for a table to open up.

I am going to start off with the good here. This place is family run and they really make you feel welcome. Mama is running around, sons are doing son things and it is very friendly. That being said, the food was abysmal. This was my first time there. I had the linguine and white clam sauce and my friend had the lasagna. The linguine was horrible. It had a smell reminiscent of a fish dock in the summer. The lasagna was a warmed over lump of congealed cheese and pasta with sauce. We ended up taking both items in a to go box and then disposing of them.  I am hoping that we hit there on a bad day. My friend wants me to try again.... I am not there... yet.

Fantastic traditional Italian style deli including a little of the attitude :). When we arrived the bread knots were just coming out of the over. 3 for $1 and unbelievable!! I wanted to try one of their sandwiches so I limited myself to 6. Sandwich was also fantastic.  Doesn't get better.
the best spot Italian Deli and Pizza in Las Vegas! hands down I been everywhere, even better than back home, love the chicken parm and the broccoli rob. Awesome!

Italian food doesn't get any better than this.   No matter what I have ordered, it has always been the best.  I have recommended this place to many of my friends. This is not from Harvey lol  It's from Eileen in Las vegas

As a former (reformed ) New Yorker myself, walking into Cugino's deli fills me with nostalgia for the way things use to be in NY delis in almost any neighborhood. I've been coming here for about four years, dine in and take out and I'm happy every time. Family owned and operated, the boys tend to run the front counter and are some of the nicest guys in the city. They recognize me by name and make me feel like part of the famiglia, cugino means cousin after all.   The food is unabashedly old school "red sauce New York" Italian, the kind of comfort food that grandmas pass down from generation to generation of Italian American families. Oft imitated, but rarely perfected, Cugino's delivers a hearty, soul warming meal that scratches that itch for a solid plate of parmigiana drenched in top quality mozzarella and a tangy home style red sauce. Then pizza is authentic too, owing to their Staten Island roots. It's not fancy, it's just what you need when you want a slice of NY pizza to make you long for the old days when your corner pizza joint was the place to go for a snack after work or school.   Their hot sandwiches are tops, try the Sausage and broccoli rabe with provolone, it's one of the best things on a roll in the whole city. They've started offering a Philly favorite too, the roast pork sandwich, which is a classic as well. You can't go wrong with their standard entrees either, the eggplant rollatini is basically cheese heaven with their homemade, creamy ricotta seasoned just right. Sausages made in house by the patriarch of the family, who is a butcher by trade, are top notch.   This is unpretentious, home style cooking, in a charming counter service deli with a few pizzeria style seating areas. Loads of cold cuts and Italian specialties line the walls for purchase, if you need a ton of food to satisfy the masses, they'll cater any event, nothing's too big or too small, they'll accommodate you!    Support these local business and keep Vegas a locals paradise. Thanks guys, for the years of yummy food and making me feel at home every time I come in!!!  Grazie mille!!

This spot is amazing! The staff is extremely knowledgable, friendly and kick butt at what they do! We ordered the Italiano #1, #2 and the Cugino's Special is to die for. EVERYTHING is made in house and fresh. The mozzarella is spectacular and Donnie gave us a hearty sample. The bread is crispy on the outside and melts in your mouth with the first bite. They have tons of great imports, meats, cheeses, olives, desserts and lavAzza coffee!  Thank you Cugino's! I'll be returning for more.

Off the hook....As new York as new York gets... These guys owned lennys pizzeria (Saturday night fever ) and a famous meat market called A and S in brooklyn..I was in the pizza business and I know good pizza and cuginos pizza is the best not only in Vegas but west of the Mississippi!!!!!  Hands down.. Try there Sicilian pizza nobody  makes it in Vegas like Cuginos!!!! I think they make the best pizza in Vegas bar none!!!! They make there sausage in house and there rice balls are to die for...everything is fresh and there restaurant is immaculate you could eat off the floor.......

This is our first time of following Yelp reviews and being disappointed. The food was ok, just ok. We ordered a cheese pizza, fresh tomato & basil (that came with approximately 8 small pieces of basil, but lots of garlic the garlic, the only nice surprise), cannoli (flavor was good, but it was unusually crunchy and we couldn't get over the texture) and a tiramisu which we haven't tried yet - we couldn't because we are in a hotel room (which they knew, they delivered it to us) and were not given any plates, napkins, a fork to eat the tiramisu with... Nothing.  Even with that, the BIGGER disappointment was how long it took. It was estimated at 45-60 minutes delivery through Eat24 and it took 90 minutes!!!!  At 80 minutes I used the check order status stating we still had no food and their reply was "We know you're hungry (we're hungry too!)".   What?!?!?  Really?!?!? Ok, but YOU didn't order the food 80 minutes ago!!!  It's NOT about YOU, it's about an unhappy customer who gave you an opportunity to explain the delay and when we could expect our food to arrive. We received ABSOLUTELY NO CUSTOMER SERVICE!  Not likely to order through this again. Not happy.  I wouldn't order delivery if you're actually hungry.
Food here was really really good, ordered from them on eat24 , they were ontime and it was truly delicious! Prices are great too

This place stole my heart!! I LOVE Italian food, I LOVE Italians cooking authentic Italian food.. lol. The chefs mother makes the homemade tiramisu.. must try :)   We heard about this place from my husbands client a few months ago.. since then we've been numerous times. When you walk in and look to the left you will see the wall lined with all the ingredients that they use in their kitchen.. which they also have for sale.. They have a little deli area where they also sell the meats & cheeses they use.  EVERYTHING IS FRESH.. their pizza dough, ingredients, etc. They also offer gluten free crust..  ok so not sure how many of you know how to test the crust of your pizza crust.. lol but you pick it up & hold it up.. if your piece of pizza stays extended out & can stay held up then the crust is perfect.. if your piece of pizza falls over & all your toppings fall off... thats bad pizza crust.. lol. So obviously my pepp pizza passed the test.. lol.   Their salads are amzing.. the knots are flavorful & perfect size. The sandwiches are HUGE and so good.. when you call to order to go ask about their sandwiches on special.. they come up with some pretty good combinations. the meat & cheeses are quality!
Food was great. Everything fresh. The garlic knots burst with flavor when you bite into them. Very happy we went

Cugino's catered a wedding for my husband and I this past March! Our guests are STILL inquiring where all the delicious food came from!   The food was very authentic and there is such a good variety of Italian dishes to choose from so there's literally something for everyone.   The best thing about this place is the service from the owners and the family! They are so welcoming and knowledgable about their business heritage, their menu and offerings, and very accommodating to what you are asking for. Planning a wedding is hard enough, especially when trying to place a $2000 food order for guests. Cugino's staff was very patient and available for all of our needs, and even delivered everything to the venue with supplies to keep the food warm.   I love this place! Truly a gem here in Las Vegas! I only wish they had a location that was closer to my house!

Absolutely loved it! The produce on their vegetarian pizza was so delicious, the crust was nice and crispy. The cannolis were the best my mom had ever had. Gotta get all that, a pack Dr. Brown soda and a box of pizzelles when I come through vegas again!
All that can be said is Amazing. Staten Island ol school Italian cooking. You may even get a peak at mom helping out on the back
Convenient, next to UNLV.  Great Calzones and Pizza.  Definitely will be back.

By FAR the best pizza I've had so far in Vegas. Most places will blame the water, humidity, altitude, the position of the moon for their pizza not being as good as back east. Obviously not true, this place has great pizza

The moment I walked into Cugino's I felt like I was back in New York and one step closer to finding the tastiest NY pizza in Las Vegas. The friendly staff had my pizza ready and waiting exactly on time (along with an order of garlic knots and canoli...because you can't forget the canoli).  I was also pleased to see they had a huge assortment of Italian specialties, especially fresh mozzarella, available.   Five stars for great crust, flavorful sauce, plenty of cheese and excellent service. And the canoli was beyond awesome. Rock on, Cugino's! As Arnold said, "I'll be back."
Feels like family feeding you.  Everything is fresh.  The pizza is wonderful and the sandwhiches are amazing. Go!!
Great quality and pizza by the slice available! Sandwiches look amazing also. Got the lunch special. 2 slices and a drink for $5.99.

Been going to Cugino's since 2004 and after all this time it is still my favorite Italian place in Vegas. A lot of people come here for their pizzas and pastas, which are all good. But what really puts this place over the top for me is their sandwiches. Any of their parmigianas are excellent. Do yourself a favor and get Donnie's Special sometime. In fact, almost anything they put in between bread is worth trying.   My top 5 sandwiches: 1. Donnie's Special 2. Philly Cheese Steak 3. Sausage, Peppers, and Eggs 4. Cugino's Special 5. Meatball Parmigiana  They also have a section next to the checkout counter where they sell quality stuff such as roast peppers, marinated mushrooms, marinated eggplant, grilled vegetables, sausage, and stromboli. They're all blackout good. Don't forget to try their garlic knots, seasoned fries, and Sicilian rice balls, all of which are also made in-house. They also have incredibly tasty sweets like cannolis and cheesecake, both of which rank among the best I've ever tried.   You'll need countless trips to this place just to try everything they have to offer, and chances are you won't anytime soon because you'll probably end up buying some of the same things over and over again. Vegas is very lucky to have a great deli such as this and I hope they'll stick around for many years to come.

I wish Seattle had more Italian delis like this . The Italian sub, i forgot if I got the #1 or #2 , was soooo good. One of the best cold subs I've ever had. I had to take it togo on my 3 hr flight back home and when I got home it was still In perfect shape and  delish!!! I also ordered these risotto rice balls stuffed with meat which was pretty good too. I will def come back. Next time I'll order a lot more Subs to go..
The worst place in las Vegas the owners are rude the food is terrible! The actual location is DIRTY!!!! Avoid this place

Great food and great service. Ordered takeout and they worked with me to get the food delivered to an address that Yelp didn't recognize as a place they could deliver to at the airport. Pizza was excellent, got the Melanzana and Margarita. Chicken parm and Eggplant parm were both exceptional. Fettuccine alfredo and Greek salads were also excellent. Born and raised in Jersey, good pizza and  Italian food is hard to find. This place meets the mark and I will be sure to get food from here next time I'm in Vegas, especially to enjoy for our flight home. Thanks to the guy from NY who worked with me on the phone.

Every time I come in Donny and his sons are always so attentive.  Pizza by the slice, zucchini fries and spumoni.... yum! Best part is it is across from UNLV so I can come on break and have some lunch! I love tge atmosphere of the deli too. My boyfriend said he felt like he was back in his hometown deli. (Boston)
Tough choice between the meatball parm and chicken parm. I went chicken parm sub and was very happy.
Awesome sicilian pizza. Best I have had since I left NY in 2002. Others have come close but this is the best.

I love Cugino's. I lived in Las Vegas for 2 years and I have to say that Cugino's was the best part about the whole city. I want to thank the Cugino's family for blessing me with their existence. If it weren't for them, I would have lived a fruitless life in Las Vegas. I found the courage to get out of bed every morning only because I knew that at some point in the day, I would be graced with the privilege of eating one of Cugino's sandwiches. The people that work at Cugino's are true humanitarians. If you go, get the Italian #2. Or if you are feeling frisky, ask Donny for his special sub, you wont regret it, and neither will he. Thats all I have to say.

EVERYTHING at Cuginos is good.  From the pizza (they ship in the water from NY to make the dough), to the sausage (try the chicken and provolone), to all of the sandwiches (the best, juiciest pastrami I've had in Vegas).  Everything is good.  Probably because they make everything themselves in house and cooking great Italian food runs in their family.  I am so happy that I discovered this place.  It has that cozy neighborhood NY style deli feel that is hard to find in Vegas.  Besides all of the Italian lunch and dinner items, they also have some of the best quality cured meats, cheeses, and other deli items that you would expect from a true Italian deli.  I live down the street from this place and I go there several times a week.  I have been lucky enough to get to know the family that owns the place.  They are all very nice and are so good at what they do.  When you eat at Cuginos you can tell that they know what they are doing.  And if you go in and you're not sure what to order, I have two words for you: Donnie Special.  It is chicken cutlets with roasted peppers, fresh home made mozzarella, and oil and vinegar served on a toasted roll.  I like to get it with a little extra oil and vinegar on the side for dipping.  It is one of the best creations I have ever had in my life.

Wow, after a week of over paying for food at several strip restaurants, and being underwhelmed ( read my Spago review ), a fantastic surprise. Our flight doesn't leave until 11:15 pm so we checked out of Planet Hollywood. We booked a room at a great very boutique feeling Fairfield inn on Paradise Rd instead of being miserable hanging around the airport and decided to order take-out. The lady at the desk recommended Cuginos. We ordered online and it came direct to our room. It was hot and absolutely delicious. We ordered for two and they delivered enough food for at least four hungry people. It also tasted like authentic Italian. I highly recommend this place. Great value and great food.

Really good, had the lobster ravioli and meat ball sub, super tastey. Also tried some olives, which were slightly salty in my opinion but still good. Also had a slice of cheese cake--that was delish, no toppings necessary. Its a little expensive, but great and friendly service, and good food make it worth it. But yes good food does take a little time fyi...

The food is good, but the delivery is terrible.  At 3:30pm on a Saturday they quoted me 50 minutes through eat24.  Since I am an 8 minute drive up a single street away from Cugino's that seemed like a long wait to me already.  I ended up getting my food after 1 hour and 15 minutes.  The driver then lied to me saying "NASCAR is in town, traffic is crazy".  I had just been out and there was no traffic, I looked on google maps and confirmed that there was no traffic.  Just own up to the fact that you messed up.

I don't often give 5 stars out but the food here deserves every one of them! We ordered the Cugino specialty pizza; the crust was crispy and cooked perfectly. The sauce is spectacular, and finally the cheese, oh the cheese, it was fresh and flavorful. I savored each bite and limited myself-two slices, I didn't want a belly ache but it was so hard I yearned for another slice. We also ordered the fried ravioli and cannoli, once again the cheese, oh the cheese was so flavorful. The cannoli was creamy and devilishly good. Great find for my neighborhood gym cause I'll need a double membership in order to work off all the calories that I will be consuming now that I have found the most AMAZING pizza.

This place is a must-try if you are in Las Vegas and have a car. I am sure anything you get here will be good, the decorations could use a little face-lift, but as far as food goes you will be happy here.
I'm not a fan when pizza restaurants reheat their pizza or when the slices are greasy, but I overlook those shortcomings because it's tasty, affordable, and close to my casa.  #HashtagsDontWorkOnYelp

Wow!!  I am Italian and living in Vegas it is hard to find good Italian subs. I am so glad I found this place! I love their cutlet sandwich with vinegar & oil. I also love their deli counter, and mini market with imported food from Italy. The whole staff seems like they are straight from New York, with their accent and all. It is a favorite in my book!! Just wish they had Italian Desserts. I didn't see any on the menu or behind the counter.

Affordable Italian food, not for real Italian food experts though. I had their eggplant rollatini (which in Italian doesn't mean anything, the real word would be INVOLTINI) with pasta and salad. Their food is ok but portions are too overwhelming and loaded with unnecessary calories...too much ricotta, too much pasta...just too much.  I guess that's the reason why it's always packed with students (their dorms are just on the other side of th road).  Their pizza didn't look that great so I haven't tried it and I also tried their rice fried balls...it tasted too much like milk...far away from the real Italian ARANCINI.  It's an OK place but I will not go back.

Got the sicilian with a #2 hoagie.  Good pizza still great hoagie not so friendly service.  Lady at the counter looked like I was from  mars........no hello.....just stared at me until I ordered.    I guess Yelp entitlement has finally set in.
Went 2 nights in a row.  Great pizza and a nice classic Caesar salad.  Bathroom was spotless and dining area nice and clean too.
This is my first review because I really loved this restaurant.  The food was exceptional! Going back soon!

First of all, I would like to start by saying I honestly do not know what any of these bad reviewers are talking about. From the second my husband and I walked in, we were greeted with a smile and amazing service(HE is from Minnesota, and was the one who ordered, so their politeness had nothing to do with the fact that the owners & myself are both from NY). I do not ever give 5 star reviews, but this place deserves it. Having just moved to Vegas from NYC, I expected to have to have my father Fed-Ex us pizza from our local pizza spot if I ever wanted to to eat good pizza again. Well, THANK GOD for Cugino's for making that unnecessary! I am Italian and normally make my own amazing-if-I-do-say-so-myself sauce. When I took a bite of their Sicilian pizza and their sauce tasted EXACTLY like mine(and my mother's, and my grandmother's), I knew I had found a piece of home here in Vegas. The crust had the perfect amount of thickness, and just enough cheese, but not too much, which is just the way I like it. My husband ordered a chicken cutlet hero with lettuce, tomato, and mayo; it was absolutely AMAZING. The sandwich had more than enough chicken to cover the bread, the cutlets were perfectly breaded, and the Italian bread it was on was just right for the perfect sandwich. The owner came over while we were eating to make sure everything was right with our food, and to ask us how we liked the place. This is definitely the best pizza & deli you are going to find in Vegas. P.S. I'd like to send a nice kick in the butt to all the people with negative comments about this place; you obviously do not know what good pizza tastes like, nor are accustomed to quality, home-made food. =)
NYC 's Little Italy in Las Vegas! Feels like home. All that's missing is the pinball machine in the corner!

I found out about this place via Yelp and I couldn't be happier. It's easy to find, just across the street from UNLV. I got the meatball parm sandwich special (comes with small drink) for $6.99 and my boyfriend got the spaghetti and meatball special (small drink again) for $8.99. As per the previous reviews on Yelp, we also got some garlic knots.  The garlic knots were fantastic- warm, crispy yet chewy, and covered in garlic butter with chunks of fresh garlic and parsley. The meatball sub had a bright tangy marinara sauce, fresh slabs of mozzarella and a soft yet crusty bread. The meatballs were amazing- very well seasoned with a fine texture. The same sauce and meatballs were in the spaghetti special. The pasta was perfectly al dente. This was our first meal after 4 hours of traveling on the road and it hit the spot completely.
I love pizza, and this is great FRESH pizza. If you like NY style, this is it. Nice sauce and cheese portion along with a great crunch like NY style should be. Will be going back very soon!

I love the cheese pizza, tastes just like the ones in New York. I have to add that the pizza is better than the other Popular Pizza place in town. I had to eat here 3x to confirm that decision! I also had the baked ziti which had a very good flavor to the dish. Can't wait to try their other items on the menu. The place is ran by the family who owns it and they are all extremely nice. It seems that the usual customers are known by name here. My second time back the owner remembered me. That says a lot!

Found this place through Yelp, read the reviews, decided to try it.  Good move!  Went there on 2011-04-18.  Walked in to what felt like an east coast Italian deli with a few small tables in the middle and a walk-up deli counter to order.  Nothing fancy...  Saw Veal Parm sandwich on the menu - just had to try it!  I haven't had a decent "veal on a bun" since living in Little Italy in Toronto... one bite and I was back 25 years to those days!  Beautiful crusty but soft bun, veal sauced just right, cheese, peppers... all freshly made!    I'll be back again before leaving Vegas... now I only have to find a way to relocate them to Phoenix...  Update:  Went back again on 2011-04-21.  Tried a few other items which changed my rating slightly from 5 stars to 4 stars.  I still like this place and need to try more items before settling on a final rating.   This trip, I tried the garlic knots; very garlic-y, but needs either a little salt or a marinara dip to complete it.  Also tried the Jamaican beef patty after reading about it on other reviews here, but was somewhat disappointed.  They're more dough-y than flaky, and the beef filling is a tinge bitter - not sure why.  I love beef patties, so I'm very picky - and what do you expect ordering a Jamaican item from an Italian deli?  (If anyone is in Toronto, Randy's beef patties is much better!)  Ordered the liverwurst sandwich for my other half; it was as good as could be expected for a loaded liverwurst sandwich.  Their home-made bread really makes the difference on their sandwiches!   To be fair, I ordered items outside of their mainline menu this trip, so that affected their rating.  I suspect if we stay with their mainline italian menu items, my ratings will go up again - but that's for another visit.  I'll definitely come back for another try!

A very charming place right across UNLV! I highly recommend trying their chicken wings (delicious!) or spaghetti with marinara sauce (in my opinion, a little better than their spaghetti with fresh tomato sauce as the dish has more balanced portion of sauce). The spaghetti come with an extra salad and are served with warmed bread.  - I would suggest that you: eat in rather than do a take out -- the take-out was not nearly as good; order chicken wings plain with a sauce on the side
I recently moved from the east coast to Las Vegas and was very happy to discover Cuginos.  It's a REAL east coast deli. Food is great and the family that runs it is very nice.

This place is delish. The pepperoni pizza is the closest you can get to NY style pizza, make sure you fold it! The garlic knots are so yummy and so are the neopolitan rice balls. Another yummy is the reuban and make sure you try their italian ice. I've gotten delivery from here a few times with my girlfriend and I find this place really addicting.

went to Cugino's looking to relive some great memories of fantastic east coast italian food.  well  - as las vegas goes the food at Cugino's is superb and it's probably as close as i have ever come to getting the same food anywhere on the west coast.  although the deli looked quite good it was the pizza, meatball sandwich and soup that got me.  not much else to say except the place is great.

I eat pizza maybe 3-4x a yr or so, but Cugino seems like it'll change that!!! In Vegas for a while and I went yesterday and ordered the the small white clam pizza to go and it was soooooo good! Just finished the last slice now for lunch and I want more! Heading back this evening to order  the large!  I also tried the garlic knots and it was really nice, and filling, cant beat $2.99 for 6 of them. Friendly atmosphere, and I was even offered a garlic knot while I waited, great service!  I have had pizza from the reg pizza spots and I have had Cugino's! Clear difference!

I read so many good reviews, that I have to think this was an off day. - My two slices of cheese pizza looked nothing like the pictures on the web, and was barely average tasting. - My Philly Cheese Steak was skimpy and the peppers and onions were not sauteed like I asked - Garlic knots - they were forgetful - Veal parm sub - it was forgetful  There were so many good reviews that I will definitely try this place again, but what a disappointment for the first time visit. The best thing about this place was all the Italians, it felt like home.

Went here a few times for a quick lunch after my classes at UNLV and WOW great food here. A bit pricey but you get huge portions of whatever you order. Staff is pretty friendly too. Great family run business! Will go back without a doubt!

I don't know about the rest of the menu, but spaghetti and meatballs, mediocre at best. Might as well go to  a chain restaurant . Should do better if your claiming east-coast. The bread was no better.  Doesn't anyone know how to cook?

This place is a hidden gem!.. Great family owned place, food was fresh and everything is made from scratch!!! Can't find a place like this in the bay area. Trust me we've looked. I would come to Vegas just to have lunch here again!!! We had a calzone, pizza, pasta and meat ball sandwich, everything was delicious!!!
This restaurant is wonderful.  The staff is very attentive and friendly.  The food is amazingly good. I wouldn't go anywhere else.

I came for some slices of pizza , but they were all out, and said it would be a 30 minute wait for slices.  I asked how long for a meatball sub.  Cool older guy who took my order pointed to the guy in the kitchen area and said not long he's not doing anything.  The meatball sandwich was excellent.  Very friendly and funny service.

Omg goodness this place is amazing I got the caprese salad and garden salad absolute fresh perfection! The garlic knots are the size they SHOULD BE and loaded with garlicy goodness!  The tomato and basil pizza is a must have! Thank u for delivering to me I'm far away, and I appreciate your food! Remember to tip yall
I ordered the Italian #1 sandwich.  It was good and loaded with meat.  I will have to go back and try their pizza or pasta.

Delicious!!!   Finally!  Where has this place been hiding?  I am from NY and have yet to find a decent Italian Deli in this town.  Best eggplant parm I have had in 8 years.  The Marina was just right and the Italian bread was just right.   As it turns out the owners are from my hometown in NY.  I will surely be headed back with my family to enjoy this hidden gem.   Highly recommend checking it out.
A MUST first stop for a great hero, slice and to-die-for garlic knots. Quality, quantity taste as well as presentation are Top Notch. Open 7 days a week. Stop in. You will be glad you did.
The best place in Vegas. Josh hooks it up as soon as you enter. Food is amazing and service is incredibly just as good. No gmos or preservatives; just great, bomb food with good vibes

This is a family owned and run business. The look is typical of an Italian Deli/Cafe. The atmosphere is warm as are the Owners/Freddie, Julianna, Donnie and Michael. My wife and I own a local bakery and were told about Cuginos by one of our customers. We have been devoted fans ever since!! The lasagna is the best we've ever had ANYWHERE, and the sandwiches are awesome. Only the finest ingredients are used as is reflected in the mozzerella and ricotta made in-house. Definitely a great find!

I've studied at the university for years and just now discovered this place. The staff is approachable. There's a deli for meats and cheeses. The food was delicious. I only had a meatball parm sandwich but I plan on coming back to this place to eat some more things on the menu.

Such a great lil lunch spot.  What it lacks in atmosphere it more than makes up for with the food and value.  I'm not a huge meatball person but i LOVE their meatball parm lunch special.  For $8, you get a HUGE meatball parm sub sandwich and a drink.  I always eat half the sandwich for lunch and save the other half for a later meal.  Delicioso.

Tony Soprano is in the back, salivating over the possibility that Don will let him have at the antipasto...  First of all, if you haven't been to Cugino's, you might've wasted most of your life until now...at least lunch hour.  This is the real thing, and in Las Vegas, that's saying something.  In Brooklyn, Cugino's would be found in the side of some brick building lacquered with 100 years of patina and the best sauce that Nona can make.  In Las Vegas, the closest thing to brick is 30-year old stucco, but inside, the feel is right and the smell is amazing.  Having eaten everything on the menu (literally, everything, from the Frutta di Mare to the Tuna Salad to the Don's Special), I have some favorites.  If you were to ask me about the last thing I'd eat on earth, it would be the Eggplant Rollatini and Penne ala Vodka.  These two dishes are my usuals for the past few years.  Why? Simplicity.  The Eggplant is sliced thin and breaded, fried and rolled around creamy, luscious ricotta and marinara filling, and then baked in marinara and mozzarella.  It is fork-tender, which is not the case with most eggplant, and about the only thing I've never gotten bored of eating.  Follow that up with a plate of Penne ala Vodka - the best Vodka sauce I've ever had...so good, in fact, I stopped making my own!  Other great things on, and off, of the menu include the Reuben on marble rye, the Don's Special, either Americano sandwich, and the Antipasto salad.  The sandwiches come with a drink, and the entrees come with a fresh salad and bread.  Another note, everything here is made in house, from the cheese to the salads to the sauces and desserts - one exception is the pasta, which is brought in from a maker in Brooklyn who, it was explained to me, makes it as good as can be made.  One final note, Cugino's is a deli and, as such, has meats and cheeses for sale, along with a large variety of imported Italian brand products, like tomatoes, cookies, oil, Arborio rice and Lavazza coffee.  I could go on, but that would mean writing a dissertation; it's better if you just go grab a cappuccino and a plate of macaroni (Also, why not support a great, local, family-owned business)...  Buon Appetito!

It's very difficult to find good Italian deli in Vegas. I got tired of buying Parmasan cheese from American stores and found this place on line. While there I got real Parm Reggiano, mortadella, Genoa salami, and bread. I also got an Italian hero #2, at first I was disappointed in the size, about 8", and I thought this wouldn't be enough. I was wrong! This hero was loaded with meat, cheese, lettuce tomato and the perfect amount of oil vinegar and oregano. Although somewhat of a drive I WILL RETURN!!

Wow, I walked in the door and soon realized I was no longer in Las Vegas. The staff was friendly and attentive. They brought our meal to our table after it was prepared. We had a green salad, a Chicken Parm sandwich and a couple orders of Garlic knots.  It felt like all the customers that streamed in (including a large family) were regulars - and I got the impression all the adults were from New York, and many were tattoo clad.  The cold sandwiches are large. The hot sandwiches were smaller than I thought they would be - but delicious none the less.  There was no music playing, which was a relief. I really hate music in restaurants. They had a couple TVs quietly playing a current sporting event.  Tons of stuff to catch your eye and genuine Deli atmosphere really made this an enjoyable lunch. I would go again in a heartbeat.

I cant say no to anything here! Pizza, pasta, subs, wings, you name it! haven't said no to one menu item here! the family is very nice as well! they treat you like family as well down there! Best italian deli/pizzeria in town!

The best chicken parm I've ever had!  The entree comes with a large portion of breaded fresh chicken breast(2 or 3 large pieces), pasta marinara, a salad, and two breadsticks!  More than enough for two people to split.  Very friendly family run business.

Get teleported to NY. This is a family run joint and it exceeds all expectations. Absolutely THE best Italian deli on the west coast easily. The pizza tastes just like back in NYC, the sandwiches are phenomenal, customer service is friendly and fast.

This time around I ate one of their sandwiches, the "Cugino's Special" with a side of macaroni salad.  Delicious!!!  My only reason for giving 4 stars versus 5 stars: my lunch, the sandwich and side cost $11.35 after taxes. No drink, just the sandwich and side.
Positive - Great cannolis! Delicious chicken park sandwich!  Negative - Out of the way. On campus. Small seating area.
Fantastic.  My best find of Italian food in Vegas.  If you work at or attend unlv, this place is a must.

Holy CRAP!!! The # 2 sandwich . I'm in love!!! So taste. Mouth-Gazim !!! Fast friend family style service. THANK YOU GUYS!!! I will be back.  So ppl if your visiting or live in Vegas. You must stop by & chow down.

Freshly made mozzarella cheese I've got today was so awesome! I just came to get pasta (bucatini is my fav), capers and tomato sauce (NINA is so tasty and thick), but ended up getting mozzarella, pinwheels (best that I've ever tasted), and 1LB of salami. The guy always offer me to taste something yummy which I always end up buying, and he usually gives me a good discount. Love this place!!! I live near summerlin but it's worth the drive :)

Best italian food I ever had! We stayed in Vegas for 4 days. Went to the Rio and Bellagio buffets and they are nothing compared to Cuginos!   We had the: Sicilian tripe soup- OMG!!! I'm craving as I type!  Garlic knots- yummy! My 5 yr old devoured it right away  Cheese pizza- best I've ever had!  Reuben melt- amazing! Lots of meat!   #1 italian sandwich- yummy!  Rice balls (meat and cheese)- yummy!! And the marinara sauce- OMG! Owner said they cool the sauce for 4 hrs.  Jamaican patty- it was good but overshadowed by the rest of the meal.  Frutti di mare- a-mazing! Lots of seafood! Yummy sauce!  What the place lacks in ambiance and presentation, the make up for the taste and quality of their food. And in the end, that's all that matters!
Nice little place near my university. I've always had a good experience here and I must commend them for making a wonderful cup of Lavazza cappuccino. They also sell it by the can too.

My family and I were visiting from Texas and stopped here after reading the reviews.  I am so glad we did!  We were very impressed with the food and service.  It was one of our favorite places.  We live in Dallas and get tired of chain restaurants with no heart.  We loved this place, family owned with a lot of pride.  It was obvious in the food.

The owners are racist and sexist. I had to endure horrible pro Trump, sexist talk and when I asked the owners to stop they basically said no and they didn't care about my business. I'd been eating here for a year. Don't eat here unless you want to support misogyny
We had a slice of pizza, chicken wings and a sausage, peppers and eggs sandwich all great. This is going to be one our main stops when Ro and I Are out and about.
OMG. I'm used to having great Italian food and  this is truly delicious. The lasagna was so tasty. The Sicilian combo pizza was spectacular. My daughter said she gives it a 10 out of 5 stars.

I'm from the east coast so coming to this place was very nostalgic for me. I like coming here for the pizza and sandwiches. I also love that they carry ITALIAN ICE. I grew up around that stuff so when I found it here I was super excited. I brought some of my east coast friends with me for lunch one day and they all agreed that they felt like they were back home :)

Went in because my girlfriend was next door getting her nails done next door and wanted to snack on something so happy I  did.  Definitely one of the top 5 Pizza places I've been to on the west with a lot of East coast flavor . A pizzeria is always defined by the basic pies Margherita and  pepperoni they definitely hit the nail on the head with these I was blown away. Definitely reminded me of living on the east coast and NY. So glad I walked in . Also lady behind was great chat . Service was quick and prompt .

I don't know if this place is good or not I ordered delivery and after an hour and a half of waiting I called and they said it would come at any time at that point and then 2 hours later I called and the place was closed

This place is the real deal when it comes to New York Italian. The spaghetti and meatballs are out of this world, and my wife, who is a lasagne connoisseur cannot get enough of this amazing old Sicilian recipe. An the wings....order them hot with extra buffalo sauce, and you'll be floored. Did I mention the garlic knots??? Okay, enough out of me....time for lunch for the third straight day at Cugino's.

Being an ex-New Yorker there are very few Italian Deli's here in the west which are a GREAT authentic New York Italian Deli. Let me tell you Cugino's is a diamond here in the Las Vegas desert. If your looking for a good Italian pastries/pies, Italian ice, Bronx Special Sandwich (fried eggplant,, red peppers, mozz, and sauce), or Pizza this is the place you gotta come too! ----Oh the homemade cannoli's yum!!  They even have a great grocery store with a ton of Italian cuisines (pastas, meats) you can only find at Cuginos.  The family that runs the place is very friendly and accommodating, so if you want something you had in New York they can most likey make it.  These people are straight from Italy via New York so you know you're gonna get some real great food. I highly recommend that if you come to Vegas or you're a local you should defiantly eat or shop at Cugino's over and over again.  I just wish it was closer to Sacramento!
Great service...very close to the strip..from scratch ranch dressing!...glad.we came here...very delicious pizza. ..
Small hole in wall deli. Great meatball sandwich!  Family owned and it shows. Definitely will come again on next visit to Vegas.

Best damn Italian food ever!! It's a deli style cuisine with fancy food. The pasta is amazing, sauce tastes homemade. Twists, breadsticks, and salad are perfect and fresh. The canolis are the best we have ever had. There's a little mini store.

We go there often, and Cugino's has another restaurant on the West side. We go to the Maryland pkwy. one often. If you want a pizza like back East, go to Cugino's. I'm from Rhode Island,. All I miss here in NV. is the N. Y. style hot weiners, made like Rhode Island..  Nice Italian family business. Very friendly, and their pizza, Meatball sandwich, Veal or eggplant dinners are super. The only problem is they are only open till 8:00 on weekends. But otherwise everything is good there, they also have a deli with meats, cheeses and various olives for sale. The Best!!

I cannot believe it has taken me this long to review this place when I ate there like three weeks ago!   I will admit, I am giving it four stars currently only because I need to go some more to really be sure that it is as good as it gets. I am an Italian lover and from an Italian family (by marriage) and I would like to try more of their foods before I give it a five.   This was the first time I have ever been, which is kind of dumb, considering I have been going to school and working at UNLV for the last four years, and only recently discovered an Italian place near by. How silly of me.   I like the way the place was set up. It had neat pictures and memorabilia stuff that made it feel really chill. It also had like a small grocery store like space where you could buy like 20 different types of noodles and other yummy Italian stuff to cook with. They also had this deli like set-up, displaying the enormous amount of meats they sell by themselves, or make a sub with! Pepperoni, Genoa salami, sausage of many flavors, just an abundance of eye-popping varieties.   So, now to what I ordered for my first meal at Cugino's. I had the Penne a la Vodka dish. OH MY GOODNESS! Amazing! I love vodka sauce and other then this pizza a la vodka I had in Portland from a food cart, I have not had good a la vodka pasta anywhere. Here though, it was delicious. The sauce was think, but not too thick, and thankfully it was not too creamy either. It was perfect to me. *Doing that kiss the fingers motion (hard to explain in words).   With the meal you get two bread sticks and a salad and it equaled $15. Which is pricey in a way, but that pasta was so good I did not care.   Now I am not sure if all their food is like that, but my first experience was fantastic and I hope to get back there soon!!!
I absolutely love this place! I come here all the time with my friends for lunch. Nice atmosphere and the food is great! Staff is nice and courteous.

I love this place. It's unpretentious, casual, deli and many home made items. We ordered 2 spaghetti meat balls(huge), chicken parmesan sandwich, knots (yummy), Italian II cold sandwich, capuccino, tiramisu..... ) yep, too much for 3 people.. but I don't live in Vegas and i just had to get all I wanted. I will definitely go back when I am in town.
Wow! Absolutely delicious!!  Stumbled on this place and its the best I've tasted from NY to Italy. You can smell the freshness as soon as you walk in the door.

I do so love a good sandwich.  The Italian #2 was the sandwich in question and was enough to last me through two meals.  The roll was perfect and the fillings were generous and tasty.  Too bad it's not in my neck of the woods, or I would definitely want to try more from the menu.

This place has the balls! Meatballs that is! And gravy! That's what Italians call "spaghetti sauce " those 2 items can tell you the quality of an Italian deli and who's in the kitchen! This place has it , great basic Italian food prepard like grandma made, good job pisan's ! Mangia !
Delicious. Even got delivery via the Yelp app. Great Italian hoagies, fried ravioli and the meatball sub was fantastic!

I went to this restaurant for the first time on Wednesday with a craving for pizza. A quaint mom and pop shop lined with Italian foodstuffs and a simple deli, I was disappointed to see that they had lunch specials at the last minute. I probably could have saved myself a few dollars ($12-something vs. $5.99 for two honking slices of pizza and an average sized beverage).  The money I spent was well paid. I really enjoyed my calamari (homemade marinara, please!) and my lone slice of cheese.  I will definitely be back to further explore their menu. Can you say, "vodka sauce?"

This is the type of old skool italian deli I'm used to finding out on the East Coast.  The people who own it come from the old country (Sicily) and know what they're doing.  Good, no frills service that's quick and efficient.    Now I have a caveat...although I've come here many times I've only ordered the meatball sub, cause it's the best in town. The meatballs are made the right way, covered with a good marinara and mozzarella, then toasted, giving the edges of the bread a crispy texture that juxtaposes well against the tender meatballs.   My only beef with this place is the price.  They used to be really cheap, closer to 5 bucks for lunch, now it's closer to 10.  But they make up for it once I bite into that sub.  A coworker gets the eyetalian sub and it's packed with so much meat he eats on it for 2 days.  But for me, Cugino's is all about the meatball sub.
So much for it being inexpensive, I spent 20$ on a pretty mediocre small plate of pasta with baby clams sauce. Fair to say that I feel robbed. Service was cool but The price doesn't make any sense

Stopped into Cugino's before the UNLV basketball game to meet friends, not even hungry, but then i looked at all the italian foods on the shelves,the goodies behind the deli counter and the food on the tables and Bam, i had to order something. Wow was i surprised. the food was fresh and delicious, i can't wait to go back and try some of there other items on the menu. Family owned and operated, i felt like i was in my mothers kitchen, waiting to get a slap for sticking my finger in the sauce.

Right off the bat, I would like to say the food at Cugino's is exceptional. By recommendation, I ordered the Donnie's Special Sandwich (chicken cutlets, fresh mozzarella, roasted peppers, balsamic vinegar and oil, and some shredded lettuce and onions). It was absolutely amazing - the delicious chicken cutlet is homemade and the peppers and dressing add a vinegary mouthwatering twist making the sandwich much more Italian-like than I expected.  I also got a few appetizers wanting to try as many dishes as possible on my first and only visit considering I am from out of state. I got a little bowl of assorted olives as I figured you can't go wrong with them (and I was right, they're supreme saltiness was on point), some delectable fried zucchini (served with mozzarella sauce on the side, delicious), and a few garlic knots (also superb).   The aura of Cugino's was refreshing, casual, and authentic. The man who took my order was friendly and helpful with my inquisitions. He was rather surprised I was not from the area, making it seem as though most of the customers are locals, however, he was extremely welcoming and excited to serve us Cugino's delicacies.   There are a plethora of reasons why I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at Cugino's; all in all I highly recommend this Italian restaurant to anyone looking for an authentic and memorable meal!!

We finally found a place that has New York style sandwiches! Red roast beef with lots of oil and vinegar! The quality of the meat and cheeses they use tastes like it does in New York! Garlic knots are the bomb! Pizza is really good too! Wish we had this place in California! Also the people who work here were very nice both times we came in. I noticed some people complaining about that in their reviews. Not true. Just because you don't smile or talk every second doesn't mean your un friendly. When they had time they came over laughed and talked with us and were really down to earth! I will definitely come back every time i go to Vegas!  It's a little off the strip across the street from UNLV. Glad we found u!! =)))
Food was great until we spent the next 3 hours on the toilet. When called to complain, got nasty.

Again, 5 stars! Why? The Cugino's came from Italy via The Bronx almost 2 decades ago. Mamma and Papa are humble and extremely accommodating whether ordering on or off the menu.  In the 7 years I've been a regular here they've never disappointed.  It's also a small Italian market if you need to grab the real deal ingredients for a perfect meal without any hassle. What? You're not sure about a recipe? Just ask Donnie or Christopher (the sons.) The entire family is happy to help.   Bottom line, from sandwiches to fine dining style pasta dishes, and easily some of Las Vegas' best pizza. Did i mention the scratch salads? Olive, artichoke hearts, potato, Mac, mushroom.  Wait, the fresh sausage and Mammas meatballs.  I guarantee you'll feel like you just visited the Bronx.  Go for it.

What's weird about this place is that you walk in and have that feeling you're in a legit Italian deli like in Chicago or New York. And a lot of people rave about how authentic it is. But for me it has always been hit and miss. The delivery combo(or whatever their supreme is) pizza was soggy and bland. Their spag and Italian sausage was really good but the Alfredo tasted closer to stuff I could get from a jar. It's at times really good and other times way over rated.  I wonder if the authentic feel over powers all other senses.
TRUTH.....The Best Italian Deli in Las Vegas. hands Down.......nowhere else compares,, just go here, no other joint matters........YOUR WELCOME

We came all the way from Phx, and it was worth it. We took home some thin cheese and parsley sausage which tasted just like home (LI). After we order like pigs and the food was served the own came over to se how everything was, simple perfect. Now I find out the he was the owner of the A&S pork store in Franklin Sq, I ate his sausage my whole life. We loved it and will be back again "just for the yoohoo"
I wish more Italian restaurants were like this. When it comes to homestyle cooking, this place is the real deal.

You want to step out of Vegas and into Little Italy for a second? Cugino's is the place to go! The atmosphere is something unique that you can't find anywhere else in the city. Busy displays but clean restaurant overall. The staff was approachable and seemed to be very patient as it was our first time in.   We tried the $10.99 spaghetti and meatballs lunch special, which comes with a drink, and a side order of $3.96 garlic knots to fill us up. The food was awesome! It's so much though, definitely enough to share with two people.   Overall, Cugino's made our dining experience painless and enjoyable. If you happen to be around the area and are looking to get a taste of Little Italy, we would highly recommend Cugino's!

We recently tried the Sicilian rice balls parmigiana which sent out of town visitors searching Seattle menus for these delicacies.  The parmigiana style rice ball even puts its cousin un-clad in sauce to shame.  Absolutely delicious.  I'm drooling knowing I have one serving still in my freezer awaiting its cryogenic awakening on my breakfast bar!

Hands down my favorite place in Vegas for Pizza, subs, and I don't even attempt to make my own marinara anymore. I just swing by Cugino's on my way home and buy a quart of marinara (which is so freaking delicious my kids will eat any veggies as long as it's topped with the gravy from Cugino's.) Awesomely friendly staff and the deli meats are $1 cheaper per pound than the grocery store chain up the street.  LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!!

Again, another time I am asked to leave a review to a place I already reviewed, so here it goes: I went there on a recommendation from a friend, so my expectations were high. Although you won't find similar authentic quality food and choice of delis in Vegas (run by actual Italian owners), but I have to say, I was a little disappointed. Apart from the decent choices of Italian meats and salads, and the freshness of the food, the taste kinda left a bit to be desired. Bread is a major factor when it comes to delis and pizzerias, and I have to say it was not as much as I was expecting; maybe because my friend's recommendation made my expectations too high. I ordered both a slice of pizza and a sandwich, and I found both their bread and dough about average. Still pretty good, compared to most places, but there is definitely room for improvement when it comes to their bread, especially when you use the word "Italian" in the name of the business, and that comes with big responsibilities....

I have been a cutomer here quite a long time. The food is good ( not the best in the valley by far), but today when I went to lunch, they lost my business. It was simpy a matter of being polite. I wasn't aware that using a debit card cost me an extra fee, when I questioned my total being higher than it should, the man behind the counter was incredibly rude. He asked if I read the sign on the counter, I said no because it's buried among many things. The man continued to be rude. I am not making a big deal about the dollar fee, it's the rock bottom, horrid customer service. I hope it was worth it to be so rude. They've lost a long time customer over a dollar and an extremely rude employee. So long Cuginos...

After an epic BSB-fangirling weekend with my friends, we stopped off at Cugino's for lunch before driving home.  My friend somehow found this place awhile back and has always bought several quarts of sauce (bolognese and something else) while in Vegas, and she raved about everything they had.  Calamari was ON POINT - so fresh, perfectly breaded and fried, and the marinara sauce was BOMB.  Like the best I've ever had.  Rigatoni bolognese was just okay - I've had better bolognese, but this was a really good portion size, and no one is really going to complain about pasta and meat sauce, right?  Really nice service, and it's close to the airport if you want to ever have a good final meal in Sin City.

Went to Cugino's Italian Deli for the first time last night...amazing!  Had the Cugino's sampler, garlic knots and a pepperoni pizza.  The sampler had fresh veggies, the mozzarella sticks you could tell were made from there fresh everyday cheese...heaven!  The pizza was what the best!  The crust is firm and crisp, served on a "bumpy" tray so it doesn't get soft from the heat, again the fresh mozzarella on top!  So good!  I'll be back!  I have to try the rice balls and deserts!!  Go here for the amazing pizza...

I read the reviews on this place and was so excited. Coming home with my hubby on a 23-hour trip and we were starving. Stopped by this place to grab a slice or two of pizza. We both got the Sicilian pizza and a drink. I thought that the pizza was pretty good, cheesy and hearty enough to fill up two starving travelers. Unfortunately, it wasn't anything spectacular and I noticed my husband didn't rave about it either. I would totally come back here though for their $5.99 two slices and soda deal.

Five stars just for the amazing aroma that hits you when you walk into this establishment! So fresh! I ordered the Italian #1, and the meats and cheese are so delicious! Incredible sandwich. My dad ordered the baked ziti, and it was absolutely incredible! The sauce was flavorful and the ricotta inside of it made it so heavenly! It may be a bit out of the way, but it's definitely worth the trip! We'll be back!
I had shared the Ruben melt and the Pastrami Melt along with the garlic Knots, reasonable, I'll be back.

They have solid pizza. It is NY Style, which I prefer, and the selection of toppings is good. I had sausage and cheese and it was good. Not too greasy and the crust is excellent. I would recommend as it is a good pizza and prices are really low. A great spot for all this students across the street (who I suspect dont realize its there).   I will head back in there and order some whole pizzas to try out the full spectrum of toppings I am able to jam onto a pie. Until next time.

One of my favorite places to eat in Las Vegas, hands down.   My Asian ass might not know a thing about being Italian, but I know enough to say that this place is legit-- the food to the service.  My boyfriend and I usually opt for the meatball and parm special. We always salivate over the stuff they have for sale behind the glass, and one day I will remember to bring a cold bag and blue ice to protect hunks of deli stuff all the way back to Los Angeles.  The last time we were there, we saw a girl that looked like a supermodel standing next to a gentleman that could've been the Papa Smurff of the business. They posed for photos and held up the order line for a minute, but none of the people waiting seemed to mind; they stopped drooling over the menu for a moment to take her in.  From the kitchen, we all hear, "'Ey, check yer blood presshr before you leave!"  Priceless.   The food's always consistent. Locals, you got a gem.

I'm so bummed out that my new place isn't within delivery range.  Previously, I would order from Cugino's at least once a week, exploring new dishes and savoring old favorites. I've been pleased with every single order. The food is amazing, from sandwiches to desserts.  A few of our favorites that I recommend to everyone:  -Neapolitan Rice Balls, basically fried balls of risotto. I've made meals out of these and nothing else. The Sicilian balls are really good too, but I prefer the meatless ones.  - Seasoned wedge fries. You get a huge amount for a couple dollars and they are the best I've had. Perfectly seasoned and always fresh.  -Homemade Hot Turkey sandwich. My boyfriend would eat it every day if he could. It's basically Thanksgiving on a roll and a little slice of happy.  -Ruben Melt, the best I've ever had. Oh man, now I want one.  -Cannoli. It's obviously freshly made and perfect if you want something lightly sweet and creamy.  -Cheesecake. I'll admit it's not the most amazing cheesecake I've ever had, but it's still damn good. I mostly want to point out that this is the best delivery cheesecake I've found. Most places have sad little prepackaged slices of mediocre cheesecake. But Cugino's has big, beautiful slices that don't appear to have been frozen or mass produced. 9/10, would nom again.  If I keep going, I'll end up listing the entire menu.  To top it off, the service is always excellent. We always got the same delivery woman and I adored her. Super sweet, very fast and professional. I can't recall a single order error and even on busy days, service was prompt and quality was through the roof.   Tl;dr this place is fabulous.

Fantastic! My husband's been coming here for awhile and finally brought me here. The pizza is amazing, their market looked great. I tried their Rice ball and sooooo delicious!  If I wasn't on a diet and needed to stay away from carbs I'd be here weekly. Definitely worth the cheat meal!  Pepperoni pizza and garlic knots are great too. They sell cheese pizza by the slice when you drop in. Not to mention great customer service by the guys that work here making sure we were happy and have everything we need. Impressed!

I just ordered pizza from Cugino's and it was good. Not just good, but amazing! I'm definitely a big pizza eater. My husband and I eat pizza at least once a week. We have a go to pizza shop in North Vegas called Lino's and Cugino's is just as delicious. I was worried we wouldn't be able to find a legit pizzeria near UNLV and boy was I wrong. I truly believe that you should only buy pizza from an Italian. All in all, if you're looking for a pizza shop then check out Cugino's.   Especially if you're a firm believer that Chicago style is an abomination and a total faux pas!

We were looking to pick up something fast and on the way to the UNLV tailgate. We agreed upon pizza and I wanted to try something different rather than dominos, pizza hut, papa johns. Found Cugino's on yelp and ordered 3 large pizza - vegetarian, meat lovers, and pepperoni. When we arrived I noticed it was the same place we picked up from a couple years ago.  Right on, as I remembered this place was awesome. All the pizzas were delcious and everyone was satisfied. I also ate a cannoli which was amazing, as we waited for the pizzas to come out.

"A-OK" -  That might be pushing it, as I was upset.    I ordered an $8.99 special - meatball sandwich and drink.  I asked how much for fries - was charged $1.99.  Order came to $13.something.  I asked why - and was told it was taxes. I asked to see the receipt and then was told it was also the credit card fee.  Whattttt - thank you for warning me.  She pointed to a sign on the table (buried with all the other hand written notes). I advised her that MasterCard/Vasa regulations prohibited charging a service fee on a debit card and you must have filed proper paperwork to let them know you will be charging a "checkout fee". She was not happy I was questioning them - so I asked "do you feel it is right to charge so much - especially college students, as you are on a campus" - she said "everyone does it" ... ummmm, no, most restaurants do not.  Claiming it cost them money - OK, I get that, but it is called "SERVICE"! Plus, you charged me OVER 10% fee ... you are charged - at most 3-3.5%?   Then she said "why do you think I asked if you wanted to pay cash or card" - I said "so you knew which button to push on your register", she said "no, so you would figure out there was a fee for the card".     You lost a new customer because of a stupid fee.  I hope you make enough off others, that you do not mind losing the ones you do for this.  Oh, and one more tip - to go orders, include a napkin please.  Thanks.   Oh - the 3 stars were because the meatball sandwich was OK - not the best - cut in half meatballs - but was tasty.

I am gonna make this short, sweet and OHHHHHH so easy!!!!    The BEST DELI SANDWICH IN LAS VEGAS!!!!!      Family owned, and on site this is like a trip back to Italy, from the pizza made fresh to order, plates of pasta served to order, the cans of Italian tomato sauce for sale, to the cold cuts made into a SIMPLY DELICIOUS Sandwich on a soft rolls that will keep you coming back,TRULY     Easy parking on site, friendly family & staff, across from UNLV perfect if going to an event like basketball, football or concert ~

this place is bad food quality anymore, was the best time ago, now its all about momey, not the food or us the guest. no more eat here or refer this place. we all can make better at home, no need to go out of your way spend money time effort to get third class product. just do as i do and say no no no, to poorly run business. soon they wake up when the rent is due and nobody is in the dining room.  this is vegas,

This is some authentic Italian food! Even the decoration and shop set up make you feel like you're in a little Italian market. The food is just as good as other Italian restaurants but its not as pricey. Today I had the meat ball parm sub and let me tell you, it's one of the best subs I've ever had! I'm all for small family owned restaurants and this place is one of the reasons why. It can look a little sketchy at first but I like to keep an open mind. Give this place a shot. The food is delicious and made to order and no, it doesn't take forever.

I would love to be able to give this place a 5 star rating....but.... Our driver was lost 2x and had to call us for directions both x. Pizza was cold. Mozzarella sticks were cold. We didnt get the garlic knots that are ordered, but they have us a salad that was pretty good.  Don't know if I want to spend the $$ to try them again since this fiasco cost us over 40$.

1st time here & not disappointed! Great food & great service.   I love family run businesses. You can see they put their heart & soul into the food.   If you haven't tried this place your missing out!!

Not very often you have a bad pizza.  I mean it's pizza!!! How can one mess that up?   Well this place found a way to do so.  The crust was very tough hard to bight through.  The Italian does not taste like Italian sausage at all, more like plain pork sausage.  The sauce is bland.

We found this using yelp recommendation. We ordered seven things off the menu and it was all very good with authentic Italian deli taste.was incredibly satisfied and encourage all to try. 5 stars!!!!!

I just don't get how this place has such high ratings.  The food is so insanely low quality that I just cannot wrap my head around the reviews.  My partner goes here every once in a while because he doesn't want to drive across town for pizza (and because he has admittedly low standards when it comes to food) and every time I give in and decide to get anything from here I'm surprised at how they get away with even selling it.  From several seriously gross prior experiences I knew not to eat the pizza (OLD slimy basil and garlic) or the noodles (basically grease soup), so I got some chicken vegetable soup this time. Not surprisingly, this was a sorry excuse for food just like everything I've ever had at this place.  There was a single piece of carrot, a few pieces of corn and maybe 3 small pieces of what was once clearly canned chicken.  The rest was orzo and salt. I don't like to leave bad reviews but when a place will charge you for scraps of substandard food I can't help but say something.  This place has no pride in the quality of its ingredients or what it is selling people.  Edit:  The cannolis are ok though :/
I am super picky about deli sandwiches,  omg! Awesome fresh indregidents and homemade bread. Highly recommend this place.

Amazing New York Italian food by actual NY Italians- their food is delicious and they are friendly, despite the gruff reputation New Yorkers usually get. You can't go wrong with the sandwiches, but always check out their specials.  SANDWICHES: Once had a sausage and broccoli rabe special here that blew every other sandwich I've ever had out of the way. It was that good. The #1 and #2 are both solid if you dig cold sandos, the Tony Soprano or Goodfellas are tasty hot options. Regardless which one you pick, they're all served on some of the best bread outside of Italy.  PIZZA, PASTA, & OTHER OPTIONS: Haven't tried a whole pie, but their Sicilian square slices are crispy, cheesy, and delicious. The rice balls are a good, cheap add-on to your meal. Neapolitan is not stuffed, but still delicious. It's basically risotto with a crispy exterior and a side of sauce for dipping. AKA, heaven.  I've mostly focused on sandwiches here, and you can't really go wrong with what you pick from that section. Go in with an appetite!

Update:  I was back in town and stopped by Cugino's.  I was only here a couple days so was limited on my meals but had one of my meals at Cugino's.  I had the pastrami sandwich on marble rye again and was not disappointed!  It was as good if not better than I remembered.  Can't wait to go back there again!

I used to come down here more frequently when my sister and I went to school together, and I had a craving for pasta, and I thought I should see if this place was still running. What do ya know...?!  Score!  I used the Eat24 thingy majig to order food ahead of time 'cause I only had an hour dinner from work, walking to and from campus. All good 'cause I only waited like 5 minutes after my pick-up time for the food.  Dudes... I could smell the goodness, and it was bagged up.  Open my food up in the Staff Lounge, and there's this nice bit of steam coming from the top of my Rigatoni Bolognese. The bread was warm, and my salad was all fresh. Oh my gah... I was never let down then, and I wasn't let down tonight.  Same family running it, and they're still one of the friendliest people around =D
Best pizza in vegas. Old school deli. Italian family biz. Love this place the pasta is old school wt gravy, not sauce. If u are near unlv then u must try this food.

By far the best italian food I have ever had. We tried stuffed shells in the vodka sauce (they said no one had ever ordered them with vodka sauce) and eggplant parmesan. Their marinara sauce really steals the shows. Delicious. We also got the tiramisu and it was better than most other places, but not the best!. Felt like it had been frozen, because I got a couple of ice crystals. I will most certainly go there if I am ever in Vegas again, and highly recommend it to anyone.
Authentic. Authentic. Authentic. Excellent pizza. Crisp. Not rubbery like most other places where you left it up and all the cheese falls off. Old school. Loved it.

Best deli in Vegas.  Best deli maybe in the county.  I'm in Vegas 4 times a year mostly for work or trade shows and this place is a MUST.  It is family owned and what a wonderful service and quality oriented family they are!  They make their own cheese. They make 100% authentic Italian food. Their bread is OUT of this world. Their food is DELICIOUS.  If you really want a nice comfy hometown spot to sit and enjoy a great sandwich, this is the place to come.  I'm there end of November and can't wait to order sandwiches and salad from here!

Eyyyyyy, It's a Canoli!!!  Right across from campus and  reasonably priced. Old-school, homey, east coast feel, family-owned and FANTASTIC food.  You can't go wrong.  Had the Italian #2, it was a great size and delicious, if I wasn't so full I would have had another! The garlic cheese bread was great and the marinara was the BEST I've ever had- don't tell my grandmother on my Italian side.  Can't wait to try the Meatball Parm and the Sausage and Pepper sandwiches- mmm, I'm drooling thinking about it.  Definitely going to be going as often as the skinny wallet will allow (it's such a pleasant change from my usual packed lunches that I bring to campus)  I always knew about this place but I wish I tried it sooner!

We visited this afternoon for a quick lunch - we ended up sitting and chatting with the owner and 2 regulars - all of us former NY-ers comparing notes and sharing stories of "home".  As good as the conversation was, the food was even better. Both of our sandwiches (the Godfather for me - eggplant, fresh HOMEMADE mozzarella and roasted red peppers, and Donnie's special for my husband - Chicken cutlets, fresh mozzarella, roasted red peppers and balsamic and oil). We enjoyed 2 cannoli's for dessert and learned they are made with homemade ricotta cheese - which explains why they were so light and creamy.   This is a true family owned and operated small business that I am happy to support, and I look forward to trying more of their homemade deliciousness!
Literally the best pizza and AUTHENTIC Italian food I've ever had ... Def going back again !

This place has the feeling of a true New York Italian style deli.   I had two slices of the cheese pizza and added toppings to it.   My total bill with drink rang up to $13.  It wasn't the best pizza I've ever had but it was a very cool experience.

When I walked in and saw the huge Boar's Head sign I figured this place might not be so bad. I was right. So I ordered a pastrami sandwich and they put a good amount of pastrami in it and the bread was good. I will stop by on a lunch break when in the area now that I know about this place. I saw they had some Dr. Brown's Black Cherry so I got one of those to have with my sandwich. I heard about it from my fellow OC yelper buddy, Rohlin so I had to try it! Very good!  You can get oil, noodles, sauce, and more here. I noticed in the case they had homemade sausages (I will be trying these eventually) and a variety of olives. I was going to get a cannoli until I noticed them in the case filled. I prefer when the cannoli gets filled after you order it.   They deliver.
Love this place!!!!!! Has the best food the vibe in there feels at home,  and it's super clean! I just recently went to new york and this was a little slice of new york right here in Vegas!

Wow great awesome authentic! Helpful and courteous service. Everything in the cabinet looks great! Rice balls so tasty, large has meat inside yum. Garlic bread and fried zucchini were great. The house salad that comes with the meal so big and fresh. Spaghetti with meat ball fantastic. Meat tortellini with vodka sauce yum and lots of it. Baked Ziti sicilian style fantastic. Gnocchi with meat sauce wow  Patrons are so funny and friendly! WILL  come back again &  again....I would be a regular if I lived here!

This is by far the best Italian deli I've been to in Vegas. It's family owned and operated. The people in there are friendly and treat you like family. The food is out of this world. I ordered the hot pastrami and the meat was piled high (great value) it came with thinly sliced red onion and spicy mustard on a marble rye homemade bread. Truly one of the best sandwiches in town. I will definitely return and bring some friends.
Old school Italian deli, no frills just good home made from scratch grub! I've found my new Ruben sandwich. Wife got the lasagna and even the pasta was homemade! Garlic knots are great

The food was very reasonably priced. We had garlic knots, pizza, and fried gnocchi which were all very good.  The lattes are also very good. The staff is friendly and the place is an authentic NYC style Italian deli.
I have also experienced racists and sexist remarks. I don't suport a bussiness with no respect for its customers

I'm so glad my co-worker convinced me to join him for lunch at this Italian Deli. I ordered a spinach calzone and it was big enough to feed me for days. Everything was made fresh and was wonderful. I suggest going here if you're really hungry because of the portions or share with someone. Definitely going back!

Real authentic Italian food. The Italian #1 is large enough to share with a friend although you may not want to. The daily specials of chicken tenders/fries and pizza are low on cost but not low on quality or quantity. You're given two larges slices of hand tossed cheese pizza piping hot from the over or a plate full of fries covered in 5-6 pieces of crunchy chicken tenders. I've tried the Italian #1 & #2, the meatball sub, the pastrami melt, philly and garlic knots and haven't been disappointed yet. Even my kids love their food. Cugino's is a definate must visit.
Awesome family owned restaurant. Doesn't get any more authentic then this place. Exactly what you expect from an Italian American deli.
The service was very friendly and the food was great. I got the pastrami sandwich and riceball both tasted great and the sizes where very big. For sure will be back to try more!

Had a pie delivered to our hotel. It was pseudo warm and very short on flavor. More than that, it smelled kind of stale.  If I didn't know any better I'd swear this pizza was made yesterday. And this frakking pizza wasn't cheap!!  I learned my lesson.  When in Vegas never order delivery pizza ever again.  Ever.  And, oh yeah, the garlic knots were just meh.
We had three Different sandwiches and were all perfect. Their special is off the hook.
old school - the owner is most often there. It's a funny place close to UNLV - lot's of students - but solid ministroni and other dishes. Also great and big sandwiches.

Typical New York attitude, not friendly at all. There was no eye contact, no smile, and no suggestions. It was like we were bothering them.  We asked about pizza, and they failed to tell us about the specials. We saw the sign afterwards.  The large white clam pizza($17) was ok, the dough was on the dry side, no flavor at all and it was not raised properly. The pizza did come with a lot of chopped clam. But the large amount of clam made the pizza fishy. Also there was a good amount of cheese, which I think was not necessary.  Personally, I think pizza should be about the dough. Without a good dough, you are just trying to cover incompetence with lots of toppings.  This place is definitely overrated and overpriced.
This place has very good pizza. There is a large selection and the workers were courteous.
I love their pizza! It is the closest to Brooklyn that I have ever had. The only problem is they are too far from where I live.

Visit Vegas for family a few times a year. We recently were in the mood for pizza and wanted something close. Tried Cugino's and it was great. Great pizza ( we had the white pizza) and nice people. Converted my brother in law  - it is his go to pizza now.

Subs.  Heroes.  Hoagies.  Whatever you call them, every city needs a deli that makes them right.  Cugino's does.  Most important element in a proper sub?  It's the bread.  I wanted to like Captiotti's, but their bread is no good.  Cugino's has that proper blend of crispy outside, chewy inside that makes it so great.  Service was quick and friendly; interior is nice and clean with ample seating.  There are also a few tables out front for days when it is not too hot or cold.  I will definitely return to try the pizza, but I can see how if you don't get a slice from a fresh pie, it might not be so great.  A full report will be forthcoming.  But in any case, if you want a great Italian hoagie, Cugion's is the place to get it.
