These jerks cancelled our order without warning. The only reason I found out is because I looked at the order tracker after the expected delivery time.  "Cancelled" was in small print.

My heart is in New York, my home, but when I'm in Vegas this is the only place outside New York I've ever been to that truly makes my stomachs happy. Fresh everything. Oh, and the people that work there? Phenomenal. I can never recommend this place enough. If you're debating on coming here, go. Enough said, just go.

A lot of meat but that's the only good thing! It was prepared by the same person handling the money with dirty nails. He had been smoking and he reeked. I was expecting pickles or peppers on the side with a pastrami sandwich but nothing! I am totally disappointed. I ordered the wedding soup too but received chicken noodles instead. A waste of $16.00 and I tossed it all in the trash!!

Best Italian deli in Las Vegas. Pizza is awesome, sandwiches are bomb! Homemade sauce, meatballs, sausage, everything. This place is the real deal. I eat here anytime I'm near it. Fantastic meats, salads, Italian specialties.

Ordered from them, never having been there and never tasting it before.  OH MY It was wonderful and plentiful.  Enjoyed every bite and will definitely order from them again.  Try it,  you won't be sorry, it is delicious.  Also, the salad dressing was the best I ever had.

Wow, stuck inside during the crazy floods, and so happy to find this gem on Yelp that delivers!!!  We did a half-and-half pizza and also a pastrami sandwich, wow, NYC authentic!  I wish we would've found this before our last night here,  but we will definitely go back on our next trip here!

Very good food- authentic and large portions for the price.  My 4 year old devoured the garlic knots and her cheese pizza.  We shared the chicken wings (hot) and eggplant rollatini....yummy!!  We are here for the week and plan on eating there again before we leave.
It took an hour and a half for delivery and they didn't brink my drink maybe they had an off day

The greatest family owned Italian deli I've ever eaten at. The food is delicious and the atmosphere is amazing. I felt like I was at home while eating here. The pizza and the pastas are worth every second of the anticipated wait!

Place looks just like a pizza shop eatery from once you walk in there were good seating everywhere and on the right there's a more classy dinner setting. Eatery looked like they sell Italian goodies as well from drinks to snacks.    For an appetizer I suggest to try the garlic knots. It's a little stuffed bread full of flavor and Italian spices that makes you never want to stop.  Of course my meal will always be a supreme pizza from Italian food, and ugh just delish!

Delicious hole in the wall Italian deli and hot food spot! Totally reminds me of small shops in other cities. They also sell delicious Canolis! Love the mom and pop feel here and the Sicilian pizza lunch special :)

Cugino's is hands down THEE BEST authentic Italian Deli in Las Vegas.  The second you walk in the door you immediately feel like you are in an old east coast Italian neighborhood at the corner deli.  This is a family owned business and they are all transplants from New York which makes your experience even better.  They have been in Vegas for 11 years and have been serving real Italian hot and cold deli goodness to the masses ever since.  From the father making fresh mozzarella, the mother creating fresh canolis from scratch with real ricotta cheese, to the son creating killer sandwiches oozing with tons of flavor...this place is THE REAL DEAL.  The food was soo fresh and delicious I had to pick up some fresh meats and mozzarella to go.  They also carry hard to find real Italian market products on their shelves.  WOW WOW WOW... I'm going back tomorrow.

Okay...so I haven't been there in awhile....  had picked up the most DELICIOUS potato salad and macaroni salad!  Are you kidding me? !  In addtion ....a St. Joseph's pastry that was to DIE FOR along with a homemade cannoli!  OMG!!!!!!!  Yes to DIE FOR!  So friggin delicious!  My mom stopped me from eating more..so she could finish it when I wasn't around (Grrr!)   Love this place!

Half Italian grocery store half deli. I only had the spaghetti with meatballs. The meatballs are beef only, plenty for the meal, red sauce is kinda soupy but tasty. The bread sticks are yummy though. It's like lil French breads, small like the kind at Olive Garden but like French bread. The salad was tasty too. I'd go back for sure. Pricing is good too.

I've been living in vegas for several years and it's amazing that with all the food options and all the  small operators here you can't find good take out pizza.  And I still haven't found it... I'll probably go back and try their pasta but so far I'm not impressed by this place.  First, the smell.  Any good italian deli and/or pizza place has a tasty smell when you walk in.  This place didn't have it and if I was blindfolded walking in I probably couldn't tell it from any other place. Not terrible, but nothing special.  Service was pretty mediocre.  There were at least 6 people behind the counter doing their own thing.  Looked like one of those 'kitchen nightmare' episodes.  I'm standing for the longest time waiting for the guy at the register to stop talking to the two ladies in front.  Then the guy gets my pizza and he asks this other guy 3 times what the total was, 3 times, $22.78 (a bit pricy).  What's my change?  1.22  Okay fine, some places charge extra for take out so whatever.  Granted the pizza was cold by the time I got home but still it wasn't that good.  The crust was soggy and the sauce tasted somewhat like pappa john's.  The sauce killed it for me.  I got the special and the sausage and pepperoni and cheese didn't seem very fresh and the dough was nothing special.  Not the worst pizza I've had but not that great.   I don't get the high reviews here.   I've had better pizza at costco.

Great find. Sandwiches are excellent as are the specialty sausages. The owning family is all in. If you are from back East you will love it. It's a true deli. The are generous with the portions and have great commitment to the customer. Hey try the sandwich named after Donny.

After a day of driving, we ended up having dinner at Cugino's.  We shared a #2 Italian Sub, a small rice ball, and garlic knots.  The knots aren't as amazing as everyone said, but the sandwich was great. Lots of meat and not too messy. We'd come back next time!

Cugino's is a fabulous Italian deli with delicious pizza and garlic knots. I found this place on yelp and I'm happy we tried it. The service is friendly and it gives you a real Italian feel.  Everything smells absolutely amazing.  I will definitely come and visit when I'm in town again. Highly recommended.

All I can say is that this place is AWESOME.  Great affordable food, down to earth owners/workers, etc..  The portions are big and tasty!  The positive reviews are true.  Walk into the restaurant and it looks like one of those Italian restaurants in New York on TV.  You have all the food products like Tomato sauce with fancy Italian makers versus del monte, pre go, etc..  They have a deli display with fancy cheeses, cold cuts, etc..  These guys are the REAL DEAL!  The only problem is that the parking lot is getting redone, so parking on the street may be hard.

Amazing Sicilian pizza, mozzarella sticks and TO DIE FOR garlic knots! Also a delicatessen where you can buy drinks, deli meats, and countless (pasta, sauces, desserts) other amazing things!  Off the strip and in a relaxing less hectic environment which is a BIG PLUS!!
i was hungry for true old school italian..... and...   i got true old school italian!!! thanks guys, it hit the spot!!!

Honestly, it doesn't get much more authentic NY than Cugino's.  Having lived in NY for 21 years before moving to Vegas it's easy to find a piece of home in their incredible pizza (thin! and crunchy) and eggplant / sausage parm's.  The pasta dishes are excellent as are any of the sandwiches from the menu.    Also, the family who runs the deli are some of the nicest people you will meet in this crazy city.  They care about their food and they care about their customers.  It's the best all around.  Great food, good prices, and excellent service.

We moved to Vegas last Fall and somehow ended up at Cugino's. Every visit is the same as the first, great service, great food, great atmosphere. It is owned and operated by an Italian family, I believe at least three generations.  They have some awesome specials that you'd expect to find at a pizza place, and there are also some outstanding Italian dishes. Inside you also find an Italian style deli and shop. This place reminds me of a bodega.   I often go in for the fresh, homemade mozzarella, canned DOP tomatoes, fresh made Italian breadcrumbs, and pasta imported from Italy. The deli has amazing desserts, like cheesecake, cannolis, wedding cookies and even icees. This place is very authentic, with better quality items than you'd find at the local grocer.   They even do delivery through one of those services; we watched the whole process while we were waiting on our own meal and they were really nice to the older delivery woman.   We've tried everything from the wings and pizza, pasta, and even a chicken parmesan sub. Everything is made fresh to order. Whether you are going for hot food or authentic groceries, I'd highly recommend Cugino's.

I've been to Cugino's a whole lot and here are my thoughts.  The pizza there is absolutely the best NYC style pizza in town, hands down. Not only is the pizza excellent, but its consistently excellent. Some places wander in terms of quality, but Cugino's pizza has been great every time. The other food on the menu is real good as well, (I particularly like the chicken parm hero), but it's the pizza that is the big draw.   The other real strong point about Cugino's is the deli.  They have a wide variety of products like Italian cold cuts, fresh cheese, and other on the shelf products that are not easily found elsewhere in the valley.   Cugino's is a fantastic place to drop by for lunch or a quick dinner and always recommend it to anyone who will listen.

When you walk in you find plastic salamis and piggy hams...... pretty cheesy What bothers me is he have some person taxing you if you're paying by credit card giving a discount if you pay by cash; not ringing it The cash register ....hummmm?  Order a couple sausages my fingers were bigger than these things for $10 Back to the point I can't support people that are blatantly try to collect cash for what reason ?  Can you say somebody needs to report these people to IRS

Have been going to this place for years! We drive all the way across town just for it! My husband is from NY and this is the only place in town he says is close to home! Everything here is good! A must try!

Me and my boys came here on a suggestion from my girlfriend. And to say the least we were not disappointed. We walked in and instantly felt like we were in Italy.   I got the chicken parm sandwich while my boys got the pizza. We shared it all of course because it was all great. We got appetizers as well, the garlic knots and the garlic cheese bread. Both delicious, but I give my edge to the cheese bread. Good atmosphere and quick service combo'd with the food makes this a must while you're in Vegas.
Very good. First time here. I had a tasty meatball sub for lunch. A little on the small side but top quality meat and sauce. I would recommend this to others.

Customer service 1/5 - they are pretty rude on the phone and when I tried to ask some questions about the menu, the guy was clearly irritated and acted like I was an idiot for not knowing the difference between certain pasta dishes. I also called back less than 5 min later to switch part of the order and they would not let me because "we already started making it".   Food 3/5. The Food is alright. The only thing I loved was the bolognese sauce. Their marinara sauce is lacking flavor and tastes like it's made from tomato paste from a can. I definitely recommend the garlic knots over the garlic bread. The bread has these half melted slices of cheese on top of it and was gross. But their garlic knots are delicious-just make sure you like garlic because they are very garlicky! The chicken parm was alright, I've had better and once again I wasn't impressed with the marinara sauce on it.   Oh, and if you order take out or delivery, make sure to ask for a side of parmesan cheese because they don't give you any and you'll want some to add some flavor to the bland sauce.   I gave this place 3/5 because I still have hope the pizza and sandwiches will be as good as the bolognese sauce & garlic knots. This place has potential but they need to work on customer service.

Delicious doesn't even cut it. Mouth watering gets a little closer to the truth. Deli to die for is even closer. If you are looking for a GENUINE Italian Mom and Pop joint in Vegas this is it. We will eat here over and over again. Absolutely incredible.

I really can't say that it's my favorite deli in Las Vegas because it's that and a whole lot more. Everything on the menus is really good. From the pastrami or meatball sandwiches, to the calamari or cannoli's you will not be disappointed. I just ordered the Penne a La Vodka with shrimp and let me tell you, it's so delicious.  Heed my warning, you experience Cugino's once, and you will immediately become addicted.

Hi! I came in to Las Vegas to visit my mom an stopped at a couple family favorites that happen to be closed. Or you needed to be 21..  I Wanted some authentic Italian food an ended up here!! Absolutely amazing family run authentic Italian food, sandwiches , pizza an appetizers etc.  My kids had some pizza an cheese sticks,  I tried one of the favorite Recomended  sandwiches, my mom tried the meatball an my other kids had pizza as well as the anti-pasta ,Excellent stuff, homemade sausage an much more. Deserts as well!! "Nando" was very friendly and helpful:)

By far the best chicken parmesan sub I have ever had in my life! Also the pizza, Italian sub, and rice balls are super good as well! I have been to this place 4 times in the last month and it has always been a great experience!

I really like this family owned restaurant  for a quick lunch at work. Their menu is great and portion sizes are enough to have lunch and dinner! I shop at their deli for items that I cannot find at the grocery store. The cannolis are great but nobody will ever make better Struffoli than my Dad. I did appreciate the fact that they had some ready made at Christmas time! All in all a great Italian experience.
Real Italian! The best in Vegas. I come here for the best sandwiches. Pasta, pizza and wings are amazing. If you are hungry and want real food, this is your spot. It's family owned and always fresh.

The food was very good. I had a cannoli, Ruben sandwich and a white pizza. All delicious. The delivery service was poor. I'm in a hotel. Don't make me come downstairs and out to the parking lot to get my food. That negatively affected the tip.

Always excited when I drop in at Cugino's! I get my favorite sandwich, which I don't believe is even on the menu. The Donny Special...you can't go wrong. It's a secret so shhhh. Of course they get it right with their pizza. This place is authentic which is tough to find in Vegas. Frank, Donny and Company are awesome! Thanks for the great food.

I read a lot of good reviews about this place I figured I'd come try it out. Really nice little deli close to the college. Absolutely the best pastrami sandwich in the whole city. I will be coming back frequently to check the rest of the stuff on the menu great job guys.

I love this deli! It reminds me of home and my uncle's deli in South Jersey. I always try to stop by before visiting my mom and bring her some bread, cheese and meats like we always used to do back in Jersey. The frozen bread is well worth the four dollars - especially if you miss the bread from back East, because it's from back East!!! Heat it up and be ready to be gloriously stuffed with the best carbs around. And don't forget to top it off with fresh mozzarella or slices of Prosciutto. The family who owns it are Mets fans but that's alright, I can still love my Phillies and I won't hold it against them because the food is so damn good. I can always go in there for a good heckle and trip down East coast Italian American memory lane. They carry lots of Italian brand sauce and tomatoes, and of course - Wise chips!!! Lot's of awesome memorabilia on the walls and great energy.

Their two slices of New York style cheese pizza with a soda is such  a great deal. Best cheese pizza I've ever had. First time trying rice balls and they were also excellent. Wish I had tried the rice balls the last time I was at Cugino's. If only there was a place like Cugino's in my home town.
This is my go to itallian store. Everything is incredible and the staff are incredible. Try the donnies special sandwich.

I have never written a Yelp review, but found it highly necessary to write one for Cugino's Italian Deli & Pizzeria. For starters, growing up in NY and living there about 25 years, I have been fortunate enough to experience a lot of good food in my life, not to mention some great Italian food. Well, I found Cugino's by chance, or in my case, maybe it was the luck of the Irish! So, Cugino's is tucked away in a strip mall across the street from UNLV, maybe a couple of miles from the strip. This truly is a hidden gem. It is the epitome of a family owned east coast Italian deli. In the three days that I was in Las Vegas, I had lunch there twice!  The owners/employees (all family) are extremely courteous and very friendly.  Checking on me during my meal to see how my food was. Everything is made fresh on site and is truly to die for. It's hard to make recommendations because I had the same sandwich, the Donnie Special (with my own little tweak going back to how I got the sandwich in NY), during my two visits. My GF had the large rice ball the first time, prepared by Donnie, parmigan style, and on our second visit, she had a side of meatballs and a side of their homemade sausage. Cugino's "gravies" (marinara or meat sauce) were both amazing. I  actually had Donnie freeze some of the marinara for me to pick up when i was going to leave Vegas and head back to SoCal. If you happen to be out and about or even out anywhere near Las Vegas, do yourself and your stomachs a favor and go enjoy this special family owned treasure. I will definitely be back!

I showed up at this place shortly after landing in Vegas on my way to Zion.  I told the owner I heard good things about this place and he immediately mentioned "Yelp", perhaps all the reviews are an "inside job".  Ordered the fried ravioli and they were blah, definitely something I would pass on the next time. I also ordered the antipasto which was a disappointment as it was iceburg lettuce, a couple blocks of cheese and slices of deli meat - I didn't even touch it since it looked so uninspired.    Then came the Eggplant Parmigian sub which was good, especially the sauce.  The bottom line...its worth a visit if you are a local but I would not go out of my way for it.
Excellent, had the lasagna and a slice and both were excellent. Plenty of parking.  Friendly staff.  TV's to watch sports. Very clean.
Good pizza and great service. I ordered to my hotel and it arrived quickly and hot. Real good pizza for the money.

A real NY Italian Deli!  It's off of Maryland Parkway directly in the plaza across the street from UNLV's student center (behind the Chipotle).   Pros: -The New York/Italian accents -The fresh Italian ingredients available for purchase -NY style pizza, garlic knots -The rice ball...yum! -My friend really liked his hot pastrami -My sis in law said the cannoli was excellent  Cons: -It's so far from where I live!  I have not found anything like this here on the west coast.  I'm an east coast girl at heart and this restaurant made me feel "home".  Nothing fancy about it...pretty straightforward.  Clean, fast, fresh, and inexpensive.  Can't ask for much more than that!
This is the best NY pizza in the city.  They make their own cheese and sausage and they have great Sicilian style pizza, arancini, and cannoli as well.

Probably the best meal I had in Vegas last weekend.  My brother and I stopped by after flying in. We split the Italian Sandwich and a Meatball parm. The food is great and the people there are really nice. Do yourself a favor and drive out here.

I hosted a get together in a hotel suite and ordered pizzas from Cugino's with delivery by BiteSquad.com.  The pizzas were tasty, fresh and delivered perfectly on time.  My favorite was the meat lovers pizza!
AMAZING!!! FRIENDLY!!! DELICIOUS!!!! We had the pastrami and phili cheese steak sandwiches.  Everything was perfect.

This little hole in the wall joint is awesome!  It is very similar to other Italian pizza and sandwich shops in town, but their sandwiches are beyond tasty!  I would suggest the Cugino's special.  The combination of roasted red peppers, fresh mozzarella, balsamic vinegar and prosciutto is heavenly!  The guys at the counter are also very friendly, which is always a plus!

God, this place is good. To me, this is the best italian deli in the city. it's beyond the fact that it's run by an Italian family, and even beyond the fact they sell Stella Door almond toast cookies. The Sicilian deep dish is spot on, the sandwiches are original creations, the bread is not too soft and not too hard. I haven't eaten a bad thing here ever. They actually cook the noodles correctly. What a no BS place with simply great food.
Had the meatball parmigiano sub and my wife had the antipasto salad. It was amazing. Definitely the best.
Everything I've had there has been excellent especially the pizza.  Probably the best pizza in Vegas.  Makes me feel like I'm back home in NY.

Sorry, guys, I'm just not getting it.  I've been here twice and tried the meatball sub and the lasagna bolognese.  Both were just so bland.  No real flavor to the meatballs that I could discern.  The lasagna noodles were super chewy and doughy.  If the mozzarella on top of the lasagna was supposed to be fresh made, I didn't see it.    I'll just chalk it up to the fact that I like my Italian food spicy and/or with a strong basil flavor.  Maybe I just tried the wrong things.  I won't complain about the Olive Garden generation.

This place is amazing!!! Had "the Donnie" sandwich by recommendation of the owner, consisting of chicken cutlet that changed my life and mozzarella that he later told me he makes in house. The owner and his family were amazing, genuine people that I'd give my business even if the food wasn't as amazing as it was. Go out of your way to get to this place.
Couldn't get past the braying jackass at the counter to find out about the food.  The owner was disrespectful to customers and unprofessional.

I've been coming here for over a decade, so this review is long overdue but necessary and deserved. Las Vegas should be lucky to have this local place because it's still the best overall Italian eatery in the city.   Everything they do here is quality that's consistent every time. Their fries, cannolis, meatballs, rice balls, mozz cheese, garlic knots, and cheesecake are all standouts. Their sauces are excellent and are made in-house.  They have good standard Italian fare such as pizza and pasta, but it's the sandwiches that are their star items, both hot and cold ones. I was even floored by the quality of the non-Italian sandwiches such as the Reuben and the Philly cheese steak. Try them all!  Cugino's is run by a hardworking family who just get it done. After all my years of going, they're still going strong in doing what they do best. The food is still as great and of the same quality as it was a decade ago and I still eat here to this day, which I can't say for most places here!

Coming from NY I am used to really good italian spots. I'd rate this on a lower scale in NY and wouldn't return. But in Las Vegas I guess it is satisfactory for delivery. I'd rather hit a spot on the strip and pay more.
Old school Italian deli.  Good meatball parmesan sandwich - yummy meatballs, melty cheese, and a generous amount of overflowing sauce.  Deliciously messy.

I needed some pizzas for a large event with my UNLV student club. Not only did they take the order in only a day's notice, they gave us a student discount and delivered right to the UNLV parking lot. Very appreciative of this place.  The pizza was great, too!

Wow! I got the Italian sub (the $7.99 "Italian no. 1" with mortadella) to go and I couldn't resist eating the entire thing before leaving the store. Deliciously built, and very generously portioned! Easily more than triple the meat that say, Subway puts on their footlong. Beautiful, crusty-chewy-soft Italian hero sub roll, too.  While I saw my sub being made, I went out on a limb and asked for "extra hots" (what I call hot giardiniera) but got a confused look. Instead, I was offered a "spicy spread" for a $1 upcharge, which in hindsight I probably should've taken them up on so I could try it, but then he offered me jalapenos for free - which worked out great.  Be prepared for New York style, no-BS, deli counter rapport. Know what you want (or at least pretend you know what you want?) or else step back and let the next customer go at it. An efficient (albeit slightly intimidating) system.  Always fun to find a new spot in your hometown - especially if it's a good one!

I know I am going to get some yelper heat for this one, but I was not all that impressed with Cugino's. I thought about it and it's probably because I don't have some emotional connection to the place. The food was good, but it wasn't like I had a cool college memory attached to my slice of pizza. Sometimes food tastes better when you eat it during a special time in your life-- I get it. But for me, it was just pizza.   The food was good-- the quality is what really made this place stand out. Just walking through the door you can tell that this is a REAL Italian joint. The deli was stocked and they had a pretty extensive grocery section where you can buy all the Italian cookies and treats you've been looking for.   Lasagna-- It was very homemade and the ingredients were fresh. You could tell that this was not a lasagna that came out of the freezer. My portion was a little on the wimpy side that night. Kind of looked like it was the last slice in the pan and they had to scrape the sides to fill out its lopsided shape. The lasagna came with a garden salad, again nothing fancy.   Pep & sausage pizza-- Ordered a small aka a personal pan. It was very simple. The toppings were of good quality, but it wasn't all that impressive.  Chicken wings-- Great flavor, but not something that I would order again. The wings were small and not really a meal (even though it was a meal and it came with fries).   Would I come back? Yes. It was good enough to come back, but not a place that I could get excited about. I love to support local, small businesses so this place will always have my money over Pizza hut.   Plus, I am very curious about those rice balls and the cannolis.

I had the $8.99 spaghetti & meatballs with soda special. Hubby had philly cheese steak. The spaghetti & meatballs came with delicious breadstick. It was good for $8.99. The noodles were ok but sauce & meatballs were pretty good. Im not sure of we will return since it is so far from us and it has to be pretty spectacular for us to make the drive. We finished with some Italian ice, orange cream: not so good and lemon: pretty good. If you are in the area and have a craving for homestyle italian with fair pricing I do recommend.

This deli is legit- as in super authentic. Last time I was here I heard a customer ask about the Tiramisu and the guy behind the counter responded about how his mom made it that morning. They are friendly and have the atmosphere of a hole-in-the-wall place run by a close family. Sometimes I get the strange feeling I am in a movie. It is set-up like how a director would imagine an Italian deli in New York would be. I have tried their sandwiches, salads, spaghetti, lasagna, pizza, and most importantly their garlic knots! I could eat their garlic knots everyday, they blow any other Italian place out of the water. DO NOT LEAVE WITHOUT TRYING THEIR GARLIC KNOTS. I would reccommend everything I have tried here - nothing has been less than excellent.

Best Italian deli!  Fresh made motzerella and imported prociutto sandwich is a favorite of mine. I've heard from friends that the pizza and chicken parmesean is great but it's hard to try anything else!! Pretty reasonable in price but the sandwiches can get pretty pricey once you upgrade to imported prociutto but totally worth it!!

I ate here yesterday after a couple of years of driving past and hearing good things.  I am sorry I waited.  It is a little family run deli with a friendly family staff and several products for sale.  Meats, homemade cheese, pastas, etc all are available, in addition to a wide menu.  I had a sandwich with breaded chicken cutlet, roasted red peppers, homemade mozzarella, balsamic vinegar, lettuce and onions.  Good Lord.  It was one of the best sandwiches I have ever eaten.  The cheese was excellent with a delicious flavor and fresh moistness.  The bread was tasty and overall, all the ingredients just worked together perfectly.  I also had some tasty garlic knots and an arancini.  Now, the arancini did not blow me away as others have said, but it was still good.  I just was too wowed by the sandwich.  Overall, a nice friendly place with a good menu filled with other delicious looking items that I must start burning through.

Really good pastrami and I had the meatball sandwich. The family who runs this place is really nice as others have said and that goes a long way with me at least when it comes to customer service. I am looking forward to trying the pizza since so many have said how good it is. The fact that I say that is a good indication of how good the food is.

Who knew in a little strip mall right across from UNLV I'd find an awesome place like Cugino's. And I thought I've tried everything in this strip mall already. Right in the back from Chipotle and the laundry place everyone probably have used at least once. It's a market/deli/restaurant. You can buy east coast products, pickup some Boar's Head deli meat, and enjoy some hot pasta or pizza.  Check out their lunch specials all reasonably priced. Try either the Reuben or Pastrami sandwiches very delicious, made from excellent products. They are a must here. The meatballs and parm sandwich was alright, messy and feel apart on me. They also have pizzas, Italian ice, canolis, etc which I haven't tried yet. Lots of cans of Napoli tomato sauce. They get busy during lunch and there's tables inside and out. Their fountain drinks are refillable so don't worry if you run out of drink since they give a lot of ice. Excellent service, fast and friendly.  I found my new favorite lunch spot, would've been a 5 if I only kept trying the Reuben. Who am I kidding I'm more than a fan 4.5 star.
Rueben melt was fabulous. Definitely more than I needed. Will definitely make this a stop every time I visit Las Vegas.

I have been here three or four times for lunch. It's pretty close to my work, so it's very convenient.  I have had the meatball parm and sausage parm sandwiches. Both were very good. My friend has tried the chicken parm sandwich and liked that as well.  I've also tried the garlic knots, and while I liked them not sure if I'd order them again. Not because they're "knot" good, but because the sandwich fills me up and I wasn't able to finish them. Maybe I'd get them and share.  I haven't tried the pizza yet...maybe next time.

Four of us visited for the first time. We found it thru Yelp--thanks! They close at 8 and we arrived after 7--out of garlic knots. Everything is made fresh so we missed out. Tried garlic cheese bread instead. Good, especially the marinara sauce! Capress salad was good. Spicy Italian sausage sandwich was almost too spicy for me. Should have known with a name like Raging Bull. Also tried the Donnie. It was very good as others have yelped, really worth giving it a try. Chicken parm and cheese tortellini meals rounded out our selections. We all ate everything and are now stuffed. In our defense it was great. Sorry, no room for dessert--so no report on that. Met the owner and his wife--delightful family owned and operated. Highly recommend--they've been in business almost ten years.

I have been going in there for years, outstanding food. I bring several people every time & tip well. Went in, ordered our usual pizza & wings plus other items.  Charged usual price, wings never came. I asked they said I never ordered them. So I asked why I was charged so much & they said that's our usual price!  $70.  I pointed out the prices on their marquee & they said you were charged correctly! If you eat there demand a itemized receipt! I will never return!

The online menu says a veggie pizza is $9.99. Doesn't say what size, so when the clerk saked "a large?" I said, sure.  When I went to pick it up.... $21 bucks?! I don't understand. D:  I probably should have said something, but it was near closing time, so, whatevs.  When I got it home, at least two of the vegetables listed on the menu weren't on the pizza. The ones I was most interested in. Arghghhh

A must visit. Come hungry and willing to wait, take in the people (everyone from UNLV kids to wannabe-wiseguys), the staff, it's all enjoyable and plucked right from Arthur Avenue in the Bronx. Want an off-the-menu broccoli rabe and sausage rigatoni? You got it. Eggplant parm hero? Perfectly gooey rice balls while you wait for your food? (the big ones have meat inside and are amaze-balls) A jar of Galeffi Effervescente for the next time you overeat at home? Delicious espresso? Some sweet pickled peppers with advice from Mama Leone on how Sinatra liked his pork chops with vinegar peppers? Where ya goin??

Brooklynites, your search for real pizza in Las Vegas is over.  I probably could just shut up there, but I'll write more, for those of you who require specifics.  I actually almost shed a tear of relief discovering this place today. I've lived in Las Vegas for about 2 years, and I'd just given up on the hope of real Brooklyn pizza. Settebello pizza is good for what it is, more like the pizza you get in Italy. Nothing wrong with that. But when I've had a taste for NY pizza I've always been disappointed. Metro Pizza was suggested to me once by a friend, and after trying it I immediately punched him in the face. Don't worry, he's fine now.   The owners/staff of Cugino's are all Italian from Brooklyn. The place is a deli and italian grocery, so you can buy all the best meats, Italian canned goods, homemade raviolis, manicotti, stuffed shells, as well as marinated salads and mozzarella that they make there DAILY.  The sandwiches are just flawless. Even the little things I've missed like coffee soda they had there.  Honestly I wasn't even planning on trying the pizza. I'd had enough disappointments  on that front already.  But as proud italians and proud New Yorkers, they insisted. And I'm SO glad they did.
Best pizza! Best cannoli!! They can go toe to toe with any pizza I've eaten in NYC or Italy. Get off the strip and eat here now!

I don't ever write reviews but I feel obligated since I can't get enough of this place.  I am from Buffalo, NY and this place makes me feel write at home.  This is authentic as it gets from the employees to the patrons.  Definitely brings me back to my Grandparents cooking!  I just discovered Cuginos 2 weeks ago and have already been there 6 times, that should tell you something.

It's a family owned business & it's conveniently located right across the UNLV campus. The food is good  overall & they serve big portions. If you're on a budget & in a rush, this place is the best choice.

Best Garlic Knots I've ever tried. It had the right amount of garlic and came with a marinara dipping sauce. Other items we tried were delicious too, especially the Fried Gnocchi. We came here to try the White Pizza to try in comparison to Secret Pizza however this place isn't a top contender. Don't get me wrong, the food is still delicious here. It was also my first time trying cannolis here as well I liked it enough to try this locally to me. I can't always travel to Vegas for the food :p

We come this place regularly and the food and service is wonderful! The pizza is delicious and the daily specials will leave full as a tick. The rice balls are great too! You won't be disappointed if you try this place!!!

NOM. NOM. NOM.  My fave is Donnie's Special: big roll, chicken cutlet, peppers and some type of flavoring I am guessing is apple cider vinegar... best part: the freshhhh mozzarella.... My mouth is watering reading this. I miss Vegas.  The owners are a family, and they are all friendly and welcoming. They make fresh mozzarella daily, along with other items. They also sell Italian grocery / cooking items in their store.  Try their garlic knots - YUM. Everything is good.  Oh wait, their Baked Ziti - FAB.U.LOUS.  I can't write anymore (craving them), except TRY IT! you will NOT be disappointed!  Tell Fred and Julia and Donnie hi!

I just had the Donnie's Special for $8.99.  Breaded chicken cutlet, mozzarella, roasted red peppers, lettuce, onions, oil and vinegar.  It was really really good.  My boyfriend got the Cuginos special sandwich, also pretty good.  The sandwiches are big too, you get a lot for what you pay. i started feeling full just from one half.  So if youre not looking for a big meal, split one or just save the leftovers for later.  We got it delivered to the Excalibur Hotel.  They do not personally deliver to hotels but you can call the road runner food delivery service (roadrunnerfood.com i think) and they will do it for you.  It will cost a little more but the food shows up hot and ready to go.  I will probably stop by there later to try the fried raviolis and rice balls   Highly recommend this place  ___________  edit: raviolis and rice ball was blah.  But i will still come back here every time for those bomb ass sandwiches.

The food was decent, but the service was terrible.  I ordered online to pickup.  I got a call 10 minutes later that they were out of garlic knots.  No problem.  Take them off.  When I get there I find out that there is a $5 charge to order online even if you pickup and it's no more to deliver it.  Well OK I guess, but that stinks a bit.  I get home and the item that I was most excited about, the tiramisu, was not there!  I call them and it is a rather lengthy call and no one wants to deliver it to me even though I paid for a delivery.  No one knows how to refund it either so I guess they are going to credit me back in the morning.  It is only 6:45 pm now, why can't I get credit now?  Why is this call taking so long - my food is getting cold.  Holy smokes I better check my credit card statement to see that I am not quadruple charged for this.  What a bunch of hassle.  I think I'll save a gray hair and just order from somewhere else.  Ugggg.

I've should've written this review years ago when I first got introduced to cuginos. That don't matter, the food speaks for itself. I lost hope in finding real brooklyn pizza when I moved here from NY.. but once I found this place vegas got a little better .. If you've never been to NY this is the place to have real ny pizza, or anything else they serve. It's all amazing

I have lived out here in Vegas for so long, about 20 years. I'm originally from Jersey City so I know how good a pizza pie should be. I'm so glad I finally found THEE pizza. Tastes just like home in NY and NJ, the pizza that I grew up with. Not only is their pizza the best but there deli sandwiches, homemade tiramisu, and most importantly their sauce is extremely legit. I highly recommend this place. Again, so glad I found them.

This place is on point. Feels like a legit Italian dive. The rigattoni bolognese is incredible. The meat sauce is tangy and flavorful. Pasta dishes come with breadsticks and salad. The portions are generous.  The pizza was out of this world.  The cheese was so gooey and fresh.  When you grab a slice,  the cheese stretches like on commercials.  The ingredients are high quality and well blended.  Got the eggplant one and the garlic and basil were incredible. Oh and don't forget to get a cannoli. They are fabulous.  Best I've had in the states.   All in all, this place is a gem. Worth an Uber if you're visiting the city.

Ok... when their cheese pizza is everything you hope to taste in a pizza.... you know it's legit! This place is a mom and pop shop, with awesome dishes.   But let me talk about their cheese pizza... not the Sicilian style, but NY style...  They get it right!!! Thin crust, but the crust is CRISPY underneath all the delicious cheese! It seems that's hard for many Vegas pizzerias... maybe cuz I normally order meat lovers. But their pizza crust was perfectly toasted. Even the flipping Parmesan cheese made their slice fire!!! And the sauce was sweet. And a slice is $2.50. I've had the Sicilian slice, but I prefer NY style pizza all the way.   With that said, my husband loves the sandwiches. My daughter got some chicken soup and I could swear there is an Italian grandmother in the back who cooked that soup up!!!   My husband, who is a NY a native, describes this place as a "gold mine."
Absolutely delicious!!! Taste like it was straight from Italy... perfect amount of cheese, pepperoni, and thin crust.

Had lunch here while in the area and was really surprised how authentic and delicious the food was. I wish I had a place like this where I live.  We had meatball and chicken parm subs. Packed with meat and yummy sauce, perfectly crisp roll. We also had a slice of cheese and garlic knots. I wanna go back and try all the pastas. This place is a gem!
This is a lunch staple in this neighborhood. Lots of options hot and cold. Old school neighborhood type Italian deli, like east coast style - but in Vegas. Lots of charm and great great fresh food

Great pizza, one of the best Margarita pizzas I've eaten. Outstanding cannoli and cheese cake. Friendly service. Garlic knots were great, the sauce was wonderful. Plan on eating here again when we visit Las Vegas.
when you want pizza! this a great place to go. nice friendly staff, good food. lots food items to chose from. great specials too. what more can you ask for?

Cool atmosphere, great food!  The garlic knots were awesome, as was the stuffed pizza.  I love the small mom and pop type of restaurants and this is exactly what it felt like eating here.  I will def. be back.

Finding a place for a family of 8 in Vegas isn't easy, but at Cugino's we felt right at home. Not only is the food absolutely amazing, the staff is exemplary. We enjoyed Margarita Pizza, Shrimp Alfredo, Garlic knots and cannoli's our table, all were homemade and fresh. Highly recommend the short drive to this gem.
I could go nuts in here!  Everything looks so good, I only ordered a salad, but got a hero for my husband so we'll see what he thinks!
Good to find  a true Italian deli. Actual meat on the sandwich and tasty at that. Grazie.

By far the best authentic east coast style Italian deli in Vegas. You can come here to dine in, take out, or get specific Italian meats and cheeses. My personal favorites are the buffalo mozzarella, ricotta salata, and the pecorino Romano. If I'm dining, I switch it up between the spaghetti Bolognese, cheese raviolis, or sausage & pepper sandwich. And I NEVER ever leave without a fresh hand made cannoli, or an assortment of Italian butter cookies. If you're ordering for a holiday, call it in! They get very busy. Family owned and operated. Good people, great food. It truly reminds me of my grandmas cooking!
Delicious! Highly recommend if you are in the area. Wonders are nice. Good taste home made. Authentic Italian products are sold in the store. Will visit again when in Vegas.

Love this place. The pizza comes in huge foldable slices. The garlic knots are small, but pack a big punch of flavor. The fried gnocchi might be my favorite thing of all though. They're tender and full of flavor. The marinara is the perfect dipping sauce for them. Been here a couple of times and everything is always great.

Decided to drop by for lunch since it is near my office.  Never been here before.  Glad I stopped by.  They had stuffed cherry peppers!  Oh my goodness......so good.  Will return and try their pie next time.

Solid. I had the Italian slice, and Sicilian alongside a side order of a CANOLI. I've actually never had a CANOLI before, it was really, really, sweet and delicious and probably super unhealthy, but who cares, when you're here, your family, and not calorie counting, right!  The deli section was impressive, and straight up a little italy in Las Vegas.   Oh yeah LAS VEGAS PIZZA is greater than LOS ANGELES.

This is a great place! I can't believe  how  many times I passed this place and never noticed it. I decided  to try it and got an authentic new York feeling (never been to NY but I imagine they know a thing or two about a then tic new York food). So I decided to try the pastrami melt and fell in love with it and I would  only order that sandwich on several occasions, nothing  else. So a few nights back my wife was going to order pizza from a place I'm not fond of , I suggested she order from cuiginos  and she picked up a  ny deep dish.i had never tasted a sauce so original  it was amazing .I'm so used to pizza chains that I had not expected  the pizza to be that good but it was great. Last night we decided  to get a another pepperoni pizza and wings but not deep dish (pan tossed I think) it was even better .the people who work there and give a real authentic  family vibe and positive  service. I can't wait to try more things on their menu. Good job cuginos and I will continue  to recommended them to everyone  I can.

If people ever ask me what ethnicity I am, they usually say something like..."What are you?  Italian?"  I guess it has to do with how I look and the fact that my name is Vince.  Turns out, I am not Italian, but for 45 minutes last Saturday...I felt Italian.  Cugino's is exactly what I look for in an Italian deli.  Pasta and cans of tomatoes on the shelves, a nice selection of meats, cheeses, olives, and sausage, and a couple old school guys behind the counter with white shirts and white aprons.  I walk up to the counter to the appropriate greeting of "How ya doin?"  I respond to that question with the appropriate answer (which happens to be the same question) "How ya doin?"  The guy behind the counter then asks, "Whaduya havin'?  We ordered the Italian Combo#2 and the Meatball Parm sandwiches, a couple bags of chips, and drinks.  The total came to around $20 and we both left stuffed.   The Italian sandwich came loaded with salami, capicola (gabbagool), provolone, and I asked to add some pepperocinis.  Don't forget about the bread, which is the key to the success of this sandwich.  We will be heading back in our next Vegas trip for sure.  This is a nice lunch option and break from the smoke filled and overpriced casinos.

Love this place. Pizza by the slice are a surprising large slice. The antipasto salad ingredients were fresh with an awesome house dressing. Definitely would recommend this little gem before leaving Las Vegas.

Cuginos is my favorite deli on the East side of Las Vegas. I have tried their pepperoni, pastrami and capocolla deli meat and it's delicious. Their products are always fresh and cut thin just how I like it. I'll always come back for more. I highly recommend cuginos to everyone.

This place screams authentic Italian from the  minute you step inside. Was in a hurry so I just grabbed a ready made slice of pizza and some garlic knots. Pizza was good, but was just a boring old slice of cheese. Garlic knots were legit and my kiddo, who's the pickiest eater ever, gobbled them up and requested another order.   Sat next to a couple who ordered an entire white pizza and it looked amazing and smelled even better. There was some big Italian dude there who is friends with the owner, and he was more than happy to rave about his favorites on the menu. He swears the Donnie sandwich is the 'best you'll ever have.' Can't wait to get back and try everything on the menu.
Excellent!!  Great pasta and sandwiches. We will visit again when we come back to Vegas. Robert R

Favorite unassuming place for Italian food. Great Reubun sandwich w/ no shortage boar head deli meat. Also the spaghetti and meatballs was right on point. It will remind you of a family run Italian restaurant in NYC.  Highly recommend.

Been coming to Cuginos for about 4 years now and I'm never disappointed. I keep it simple and I'm always happy. Either the Italian #1 or #2 add the spicy giardiniera Best sandwich in town. Girlfriend loves the rice balls and the cannoli. Sweet and simple but oh so good and why I come to Cubinos 3-4 times a month.

Came to Vegas with my wife for a business trip and we planned to eat off the strip to 1-save money but mainly because we enjoy eating at smaller places away from all the entertainment areas.  Authentic italian and the Italian 2 sandwich was so good.  My wife had a meatball sub that she enjoyed.  This is an authentic place ran by authentic people.

We really enjoyed this place! My husband loves green olives and so we tried those and we were not disappointed. I'm from St. Louis so I was very interested in their fried ravioli and WAS NOT disappointed there either! Tried the cheese pizza (good), tried the spaghetti with meatballs (good), garlic knots (good), and pastrami sandwich (really good). Everything we tried was good and we would totally come back.
This place is amazing! I'm from New York and this place would thrive even there.  They fly in frozen loafs made by hand back east.  You just can not beat that!

This place is awesome!!  We have been going here for years and always bring our out of town guests for their amazing food.  We have tried most things on the menu and they are all great.  The cannoli's are the best in town.  Pizza, sandwiches and pasta dishes are all outstanding.  Highly recommend.

We order delivery from them at least once a week through Eat24. So yummy. And their ranch is seriously yummo along with the rest of their food. Have had chicken fingers, wedge fries, eggplant parm, veal parm, chicken milanese, a few different flavors of Italian Ice, tiramisu, linguine with clams(white & red), alfredo, chef salad, Italian #2, hot turkey sammie and more. I would order each again and well, we already have!
Great pizza, nice staff and affordable. Great for a quick slice by UNLV. I had the garlic knots and a slice of cheese pizza.

Best Italian Deli in Las Vegas, HANDS DOWN! These guys are straight from Staten Island and they treat you like "La Familia" High Quality ingredients are the key here! Everything is made in house from scratch.

I really do like this place, the staff is pretty friendly. The only problem that I have is, they are way over priced. Their ravioli that they fly in from Brooklyn, NY which is very good, however, they charge I believe $12 for a box of what I believe to be a pound of ravioli. Then, when they ring you up, they have a calculator next to the cash register. Instead of ringing you up, they doodle the prices on the calculator. I worry that they are ripping me off, I don't like that at all. Other than the few criticisms, I like this place.
how can i simply put this?? cugino's is the best deli and pizza place in las vegas!!! that is all.

this place is awesome!  my wife and i had the pastrami sandwich and the fried gnocchi.  the fried gnocchi was out of this world.  our sandwiches were huge we could have split one and been full.  we also got cannolis which were delicious. the guys behind the counter were very friendly.

The taste and feel of N.Y., need I say more!!! Upon entering the deli I immediately felt like I was in NY, ordering a pizza I put the place to the test. The crust was thin and I could hear it crack as I folded it in half....mmmm that's the way it's suppose to be, I took a bite and knew I finally found my favorite pizza place after 22 years in this town! Upon my second trip here I decided to try the Cugino Special sandwich...prosciutto, roasted red peppers, fresh mozzarella, and balsamic vinegar, with red onions added on...perfection, I closed my eyes for the first taste and I do believe along with the angels singing I could here the traffic, subways, and steeet vendors! I highly recommend this deli if you are looking for an  authentic NY Italian deli!

Today my girlfriend and I decided to try this place based on the reviews. Let me tell you it did not dissapoint us a bit. They were really busy at lunch time but the food came out quickly and was very tasty. We got the Cugino's special sandwich and the spaghetti with meatballs. The sandwich has real fresh motzarella cheese and good quality meat the bread was crusty and soft and fresh all at the same time. The spaghetti was excellent pasta cooked perfectly and to order. The meatballs were not bland had really good flavor. If I only lived. Closer to this place I would eat here probably 2-3 times a week.

Went here yesterday after a day at the pool and had plenty of drunk friends me. After reading previous reviews we decided to try this place out. WORTH EVERY STAR!  We tried about 7 different dishes and we're not disappointed in one of them.   The wings and pizza combo is worth the drive over. Best wings I've ever had. They are crispy yet tangy.   Pizza was amazing. Great crust and sauce.   Meatballs will make a vegetarian cross over.   Even the breadsticks were on point.   We will be grabbing some of the wings for the drive home and will be back every time we are in Vegas.

From past experience, it seems like every Italian deli I happen to go to always seems to have good eats whether it's pizza, sandwiches or pasta not to mention the selling of good products like deli meats, olives, cheeses, and of course bread!  Cugino's fits this criteria. As you come in you see all the deli meats (Boar's Head is what they are representing), pizza and garlic knots behind the glass case, and Italian groceries lined along the walls.  I came for lunch so something hot was what I was looking for. On their menu I see all sorts of hot sandwiches from meatball and pastrami to Italian sausage and several aptly named sandwiches (which I am more than happy to check out the next 20 visits or so!)  I went with my all time favorite, Philly Cheesesteak with all the fixins'. It is I would say about 8 inches in length cut in half. From my pic you can see the melted mozzarella on top of grilled, thinly slice peppered meat mixed with green peppers and onions. Man, my mouth is watering just typing this. As for the bread, WOW! Crispy on the outside, soft and warm on the inside. One bite and I knew this bread was freshly baked here because I could probably eat the bread by itself.  Service was great from beginning to end. I came in, ordered, sat down, and they brought my sandwich out to me. From that point on, I didn't get up until I finished my sandwich.   The atmosphere has that New York/Italian feel to it. On the walls are posters of New York teams like the Mets, Yankees, Knicks, Jets, and Giants. This place is exactly what you find on the corner of just about any street in New York.  Overall, I cant wait to come back and try everything else. These guys are kind of hidden in this plaza towards the back. Once you find it, you will definitely remember where they are from now on.

I have been converted. I am usually a Chicago style pizza lover, but Cugino's has made me go to the other side. Upon drooling over the deli case, I wanted to try everything, but I had to talk myself down to 3 items, I can always come back. I chose the meat Arancini (rice ball) and a stuffed pepper and one slice of cheese pizza. The stuffed pepper was so delicious I wanted to go back for more, but I restrained myself. The Arancini was delicious, and my pizza was perfect, one of the first times in my life I didn't want ranch to dip it in. The crust had a perfect amount of crunch to it, and the slice had a perfect folding diameter, you may need to blot the cheese a couple times, it was a little oily. For dessert I took a box of pizzelle's home with me. It was like Xmas in June. I can't wait to go back and order an entire tomato basil pie to eat, errr I mean share.
Best authentic NY pizza in Vegas, hands down. Garlic knots are phenomenal, fresh, and soft. Pizza made fresh on the spot. Delicious; no doubt a winner for Vegas' best Italian!!

I've been going to Cuginos for years now.  I'm from New York and I think I've told just about everyone I know from there this place.  The pizza is the best you can find her in Vegas, but all of the other food is just as good.  I've been buying his meat sauce for a while now, it blows any of the bottle stuff you find in the grocery stores here.  I could not even begin to tell anyone what my favorite dish is because I haven't have anything that is not good.  Go and enjoy.........

The Donnie Special is one of my favorite sandwiches in all of Vegas. Love the feel of this place. Reminds me of the delis back east where I grew up. I've never gotten something here that I don't enjoy. Really good fries, great chicken parm sandwich, salads, and pizza of course. Everything on the sandwiches are fresh. Cannolis are great, small or large.

Let's just say it 3 Guys you have nothing on Cugino's. OMG my son has told me about this place and I have been dying to go here for some time. It is a very popular place for many of the UNLV students and there is good reason. The storefront is like walking into little Italy, it is a very happy and an open atmosphere. Right from the start it smells like those old fashion deli's that use to be here in SF. I knew right there I was in heaven. The counter has many delicious salads and of course desserts like this delicious silky cheese cake which I ordered. They also have many delicious cookies and Italian food which gets shipped from New Jersey. The family who runs this business are very sweet and welcoming. They welcome you with a warm smile and it's like being on the East Coast when you hear their accent it is absolutely charming.  Now let's talk about the food, I finally had like a real calzone and I mean it was so delicious and bigggggggggggg. The sauce was so amazing and it was fresh so you don't get heartburn like you would from business that use canned products, this sauce was made fresh and from scratch.  I barely could finish it and Timmy had this Italian sub and my brother also had the same thing as him. The sandwich was a true Italian sub and again since it is all made fresh you don't experience any heartburn.   We also bought these delicious Italian cookies. So I encourage all who go to Vegas stop by this shop, the prices are cheap compared to what you would pay in the Bay or on the strip and again you have real Italians from the East making this food and a REAL CALZONE! Next time I am going to go for their famous pizza which they are known for all over Vegas as having the best pizza. I am not going to lie though I am going to have that cheese cake because I haven't had one that tasted that good since the Elk's club and again that was made by Masonaries :} from the EAST COAST. :}

Five stars! Ten stars! One million stars for this place!  I'm Italian and love to try different Italian restaurants whenever we go somewhere new. I can honestly say I have never had better Italian food stateside. It's THAT good! I took my family here after finding the yelp reviews and I am so happy we did. Every single thing was homemade. The homemade ricotta is the creamiest, best, melt-in-your-mouth cheese I've ever had. The sauce is making my mouth water thinking about it. All the bread was fresh from the oven. I would seriously eat there every damn day if we lived in Vegas.   I begged them to open one in San Diego. Ill run it for them and eat all the profits.   Bellisimo!

Ordered through Bite Squad.  Got my order just as I ordered online.    Ordered Sicilian Slice, Sicilian Rice Ball  Parmigiana and Cannoli.    The Slice was very good.  Came hot and was a square about 6" x 6".  Very crisp thick crust good amount of cheese and sauce.  I like thinner crust but it tasted very very good   The rice ball.  OMG.  Let's start with the sauce.  First of all it was like Momma made.  Rich fresh ingredients tasted like fresh tomato and basil little hint of sweetness.  I could have eaten spoonfuls alone.  The rice ball was tender and full of goodness.  It's a meal alone.  The ricotta was fresh and just enough.  Unbelievably good.  A must try!!!  The cannoli was cold (most of the time you get these delivered and they are warm).  It was crisp the center was creamy and there was just the right hint of cinnamon on the crust.  Amazing.    All in all it was delicious!!   I will be ordering again and again!!!

I've ordered pizza here online. I ordered right before they closed. I didn't know it at the time. An hour later I called wondering if my order went through and boy I got an ear full from the older Italian woman who answered. Lol I swear it was like listening to one of my aunt's going off about how I should know better. I found it uncalled for but amusing at the same time. I guess it's an Italian thing. 5 minutes later my pizza and rice balls arrived. The pizza soooo good tastes home made. The Rice Balls were ok. My aunt's are better. But anyways real Italians know real Italian food and this is it for pizza!  I can't wait to go in and get some deli!
Fresh and delicious food! We visited Vegas and came across this Italian gem. So glad we did. Love love love places like this. You can tell the food is all homemade and fresh!

New Yorkers living in Vegas... I have been ordering pizza from Cugino's on Maryland for about 4.5 years. These guus are the best, they are all from Brooklyn and they know how to make a great New York Pizza. Today I deviated from pizza and got a deli sandwich... I am blown away! It reminds me of being back in NY... I strongly suggest you check them out!   http://cuginositalian.com/mobile.html their. Website is pretty bad but the food is amazing!

YO, DAT CANNOLI THO  Seriously. Their spaghetti and meatballs were meh. I bet their pizza is great, I bet a bunch of their other items are amazing.  But I took ONE BITE of that goddamn cannoli and it knocked my socks off.  Cannoli are done...so bad...like...wow. No one knows how to make a proper one, except this place.  Sooooo, I bought a dozen as gifts for friends. And one more giant one for myself. Because reasons.

I'm a pretty picky eater, especially when it comes to pizza.  I don't like it real fancy or real saucy.  So I am always hesitant to try new places.  But let me say, this place did NOT disappoint!  The pizza was delicious!  My son also said his buffalo chicken pizza was the best he had ever had! We will definitely be back next time we are in Vegas!  The staff was also very friendly!

I went there a few days ago, and had the Rigatoni Bolognese (sp?). It was most excellent. The sauce was to die for. The serving was quite generous, and the price very reasonable. No atmosphere, but, in my case, really good Italian pasta.

My sandwich was delicious and definitely worth waiting for during the busy lunch hour. I also ordered the fried gnocchi. I love gnocchi so I was excited to try. They were okay, but I was definitely hoping they'd be better, especially for the price. Stick with the sandwiches. (The pizza looked good--maybe next time!)

Finest traditional Italian food in Las Vegas!! Great service, and friendly faces. Family owned and operated. Atmosphere reminds me of little Italy. It's like having a meal at an Italian friend family home. A must have ever time you visit Vegas. Lots of Parking and seating. Easy to locate on any mobile navigation app.

This place taste like Italian food. Simple menu, delicious deli no crazy Americanized dishes, simple good ingredients. Tried the spaghetti and meatballs lunch special. Huge plate with a soda for 9.99. Atmosphere is cool not noisy, decorations are nice and the place is clean. Try it out.

Love Cugino's!  They're the sweetest, and the food is so good.  Donnie Special is my go-to, but sometimes I get a side of meatballs.  They're too good to pass up.  Oh and have a cannoli too, if you go!  The entire experience from beginning to end is home.  :)

Italian #2 Perfect amount of oil/vinegar, good portion meat + cheese, AWESOME bread. Downside = Boars Head Meats.. What a shame nitrate infested garbage meats. Ordered fired zucchini wow maybe a few steps better than carls jr. Prob pre frozen etc.. Were not good @ all very disappointing in such an authentic style place Overall - Great sandwich just too bad they use crap meats with nitrates. I would go back and buy some bread then get some non nitrate meats to put on their breads maybe ill buy cheese from them to give them a little extra business..
You want to feel your like in New York than this deli is for you! The pizza is great and the pasta is awesome as well!

This place was a really good find. Combo mini Italian market/deli and restaurant. I had the chicken parm sandwich which came on a hoagie roll and it was super good and fresh. Perhaps a little pricey at just under $10 but it was really good. If you're looking for a lunch place that serves good, fresh food; has some character and that isn't the same 'ole sandwich shop, this could be your place.

Walking into Cugino's it's like you walked into a deli somewhere in NYC. I'm a sucker for authentic Italian food, and Cugino's is where it's at. Reasonably priced in my opinion, great quality food, and friendly service. Their meatballs are to die for and their canolis are delicious! Definitely a must try, and it's so convenient being right across the street from UNLV!

Had the baked ziti. I asked the dude what it was and he told me it was meat sauce, penne, and cheese baked. It ended up being some weird pink sauce. ( not vodka sauce ) and was mixed with ricotta and had absolutely no flavor. How disappointing.

Absolutely the best deli west of the Mississippi! I really hate to give Cugino's an awesome rating because then it will become too crowded and I won't get a table when I am in town. Without a doubt the best Italian deli food in Vegas. In a town with thousands of restaurants, that is saying something. And, the service is tremendous. Everything is done with class and lots of love...you really feel it. Go and taste what all the students at UNLV already know. I can't wait until October when I am back in Vegas.

Yelp comes through again.  I was craving some pizza--east coast/NY style.  Thanks to Peter A.'s pictures/review of Cugino's, I decided to talk the fiancee into picking up a pie.  Half plain, half pepperoni.  In the three years of living in Vegas, this is pretty darn close to being an authentic NY style pizza.  The dough was thin, foldable, and slightly crispy.  The sauce was not overpowering, thin, but had enough flavor to compliment all of the other ingredients.  Gosh, I hate when I buy a pizza and it has clumps of tomato--I didn't order a salad!  The cheese...was perfect, ratio, flavor, etc.  When the fiancee got the pizza home, I even noticed a beautiful grease spot on one of the corners of the box (love)!  I know I've been praising the pizza forever now but, I just want to mention the fiancee's Easter Pie.  While he was waiting on the pie to be done, he asked the owner what the "thing" in the case was.  He said it was Easter Pie.  The owner cut off a slice for him to try, for free!  Todd tried it and the rest is history.  Needless to say, he bought a huge slice for himself.    I did mention in the 3rd sentence of this review, I sent Todd out for a pie (one, singular, uno item).  Well, as you know up until this point that he comes home with the pie and the Easter Pie.  He also bought a meatball sub.  Give 'em (men) an inch, they take a yard.  He said it was good but, too much sauce.  Thank you Cugino's for keeping it east coast, and Peter A. for your helpful review and pics!  Cugino's we are fans and will continue to drive from the opposite side of town to inhale your food!

I love this place for everything BUT their cheese steak sandwich. I ordered one to go, was quoted 10 min but ended up 30 min....but whatever, it was lunch rush etc.  My issue was with the sandwich itself. The meat had no flavor, so probably wasn't seasoned. The onions were caramelized, which gave the sandwich a sweet taste. This wouldn't be such a problem had they properly seasoned the beef, which would have balanced the sweetness of the onions. Next issue was the cheese. They just melted some on top and didn't actually incorporate it into the meat, which caused the beef grease to saturate the bread making parts of the sandwich inedible.   I give 3 stars, because everything else I've had has been on point. But if you want a good cheese steak, go somewhere else.
What a fun, throw-back Italian deli. I had a great meatball sandwich. I want to go back and try the pizza.

Finally got to try this place out.  Garlic knots were just as everyone says.  Very good but the styrofoam plate they served it on had a microwave hole in it. I thought they say you shouldn't microwave styrofoam bc it releases unhealthy chemicals or something. Maybe I'll just get some to go and throw them in my toaster oven.  We also ordered the large rice ball (which has meat where as the little one don't)  with the upgraded Parmesan cheese and tomato sauce .  It was interesting but the taste was dominated the rice and tomato sauce. One thing peculiar was that portions of the rice ball was still cold.  The reason for the low stars is my gf and I got pretty stomachache and spent a better part of the day running to the bathroom. We're guessing it was the rice ball. Maybe they weren't thawed correctly or were a little old.  The place had a NY deli feel. I will go and try the NY pizza slice but after some time to forget today's stomachache.

Where to start? This place is absolutely amazing. It's really convenient for students since it is just across the street from UNLV. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu, to be honest. I usually get the Italian-2 cold sandwich, but I'm trying to cut meat out of my diet and I was pleasantly surprised that this joint has vegetarian options! The eggplant parmigiana sandwich was extremely delicious, as well as their rice balls and garlic knots. It's a very homey feel here; service is always spectacular and friendly. Always will be coming back!
Authentic, hot and fresh! Great whole in the wall with great food. Friendly staff. Try the godfather if you are a fan of eggplant. It was very tasty.

Being from the east coast- north jersey. I expected more. The cheesesteak was nasty and tasteless- and the service seemed worse. Like I was bothering them. Second time here/ first time so- so. I won't be back

Omg I've been looking for NYC style pizza for so long and I finally found it in Cuginos!!!!  You don't understand how happy it makes me feel!  The crust, the sauce, the amount of cheese, just perfection!!   I ordered through postmates since I am 2 miles out of their own delivery zone.  I ordered a slice, a penne ala vodka, side salad and a cannoli along with an Italian icee.  Omg, the icee brought me back to my childhood in the hot and humid NYC weather.  It was beautiful!  The pasta was cooked to perfection and it was a HUGE bowl, it took me 2 days to finish it.  The cannoli was kinda tiny for 1.75 but it was totally worth it.    I am so happy someone told me about this place!  I'm gonna order a whole pie next time :)

Cugino's is the real deal.  Its like I was transported into Queens when I stepped in the place.  Hard to believe that such an awesome little Italian Deli & Market can exist a stone's throw from UNLV in a non-descript mini-mall.    The sandwiches could lay claim to the best in Las Vegas.  I'm not quite ready to make that claim 100% but give me a couple weeks and I might be able to.  The meats and cheeses are freshly sliced Boars Head products and the bread is crisp yet soft.  No I know a lot of you're are probably saying "A lot of places use Boars Head, thats nothing special."  Well you're right in one regards but the mixture of ingredients, the freshness of the produce and care put in assembly make this sandwich truly magnificent.  Personally, Im a fan of the #2 Italian with capicolla.    Not a sandwich fan?  No problem, the pasta and pizza is just as good.  The pasta tastes as if some old Italian mama is in the back making it for her son and his mafioso pals.  Al dente and always the perfect blend of meat, cheese and sauce.  The pizza is phenomenal for Las Vegas.  In New York it would be above average, but with a dearth of good joints out here, this pizza is noteworthy.    I must make time to also acknowledge the garlic knots.  A great appetizer and just loaded with flavor and grease....a worthy combination, especially when I need a break from studying over at the UNLV library.    Cugino's also has a number of pastas, salamis, sauces and other Italian specialty products for sale besides their prepared foods.  There are a small number of tables if you wish to dine in, but service is at the counter.  I love the causal ethos of the place.  The staff is helpful and you get the feeling they are East Coast to the bone.    People are starting to discover Cugino's but it still amazes me that the Chipotle in front is always busy and people don't realize there is this gem 100 feet behind it.

So disappointed. I ordered a 10-inch margarita, which arrived cold. The mozzarella was melted into one big blob instead of those big, still fresh balls a true margarita has. The sauce tasted like unseasoned tomato paste out of a can. The crust was burnt. The pieces were sloppily cut with some huge and some slivers. Too be honest, it seemed like a pie you get out of a microwave at the airport. With the $5 delivery charge and tip, the barely edible pizza cost me $20 -- not worth it at all. They were also out of garlic knots. The only good thing I can say about them is the delivery lady was nice.

Ta DIE for!   Once found - we were daily visitors during our stay and managed to get a few others hooked on this place. I want to go back to Vegas just to eat here again. The chicken in the chicken salad was moist, fresh and SO flavorful and the "house" dressing was really special. Overall, our family sampled every type of offering available and no one was disappointed - everyone RAVED over their food.

The four of us really enjoyed our lunch at this outstanding little deli, and I'm looking forward to coming back soon. I had the Italian #2 cold sandwich featuring capacolla, Genoa salami, and beautiful fresh provolone cheese with fixin's on incredible deli-made bread. My son had the meatball sub, and we shared a Sicilian rice ball. One friend had a Sicilian rice ball served parmigiana style and the other ordered garlic bread with a side order of meatballs - a great combination, as it turned out. There's a nice assortment of imported foodstuffs for sale, too.

This place is fast becoming my favorite italian joint ever. It's rare that Las Vegas connects traditional italian, laid back deli, and 10/10 taste.   Here's a recommendation I sent to a  friend visiting from Chicago:   "You're from chi town so I bet you have great Italian, but there is this hole in the wall place called Cugino's that has incredible Italian food. It's 4.5 stars and Yelp, and 5 stars on Trip Advisor. If you want a laid back Italian fix that won't break the bank, check it out!"   I stand by my message. This place is great!

A little over-rated IMO but definitely has its following from locals and UNLV students.  I had the Sicilian Tripe Soup which was rich in flavor but the taste of the tripe was more pungent.  I personally liked it but it can be more of an acquired taste for others.  I let 2 other people sample it and they said it tasted like ass.  To each their own.    The pastas were pretty decent.  We ordered the Penne ala Vodka with Shrimp.  The pasta was well cooked al dente but the shrimp were frozen and small.  For the price, there are other Italian Deli's like Roma, Rocco's Deli, and Rocco's Pizzeria that are much better.  The Rigatoni Bolognese I sampled from my friend was much better.  As for the pizza, I was not impressed.  I read many reviews that raved about it but it was greasy but I still downed it.  I prefer Rocco's Pizzeria and Rocco's Deli but this place is alright if you're on this side of town.

I wanted to like this place, I'd heard from my parents and friends to just drop in for a quick bite and I did just that. I am disappointed to say my experience didn't live up to my high expectations. I ordered a 2 pepperoni pizza slices and a cannoli and I watched them take the cheese pizza that had been sitting out, put pepperoni on it and put it back in the oven. I'm no pizza expert but I have never seen that done before, and it came out very dry and greasy. The saving grace is the authentic Italian deli atmosphere and thankfully the cannoli was right on par with with I expected out of an authentic Italian deli. I will certainly come back to try some different menu items, but the pizza I'm gonna steer clear from.

Wow. Their sandwiches are awesome.Their pizza is amazing too. $4.99 for 2 mega huge slices of cheese pizza and a drink. The slices were so big they packed it in a medium pizza box haha. I was SO full from the first slice.  It was just perfect everything.

This place is easy to overlook, but you'll want to go back after you try it.   If you're in the mood for something light, go with the chicken caesar salad. If you want something that's going to fill you up, order the sausage, green pepper, and onion sandwich, or their chicken parmigiana sandwich with garlic fries. They're both spectacular, and even better when paired with a garlic knot (or a full order of three).   Hands down this is the best family-owned and operated restaurant in walking distance from UNLV.
The best sandwiches, pizza, pasta and soup. Amazing food everything I tried is fresh from  scratch.  This family that's has amazing family secret recipes.

Also awesome homemade sausage including cheese and parsley sausage. they even make the cheese and parsley sausage with chicken instead of pork. Like going to a NY pork store WITH awesome pizza and food !!!

By far the best New York style pizza place in Vegas.  I used to think it was Metro, but Cugino's is better and for half the price.  Also had the #1 and #2 sandwich which were both, again, the best I've had in Vegas.

Yum!  I am so excited to have found this place on Yelp.  I ordered the Cugino's Special sandwich and found the price reasonable and the ingredients to be very fresh and flavorful.  The staff were all very nice and you can tell the food is authentic.  I know where my favorite place to get lunch around campus is now!  I can't wait to go back and see what other treats they have to offer.
True Italian food, everything made fresh from scratch. Can't beat it. First time here and definitely not the last.
