Recently new to Las Vegas from New York, I was dying for an authentic NY style deli. This is the exact place I'd been looking for! It is extremely authentic and reminds me so much of home. The Italian 1 & Italian 2 sandwiches are incredible, with the typical fixings of Capicola, provolone, salami. The sandwich is a good size for the price and the bread is to die for. I plan to come here often just so I can get a little piece of NY, with NY accents and all. Next time I definitely plan to go for the hot subs and even maybe a cannoli.

My neighbor ordered some takeout food from this place and shared a slice of pizza and a small portion of lasagna with me.I found each of them to be absolutely delicious.I can't wait  to actually go there and sample their offerings in person.As a former New Yorker of Italian American ancestry,I am always impressed by good quality Italian food.I don't find too much of it here in Las Vegas,but in all fairness I should mention that I don't go out of my way to look for it either.I am more partial to Chinese food and I rarely,if ever,find Italian food which I would put on a par with the great food that my mother from Italy cooked for me.She spoiled me greatly that way.Anyway,to make a long story short,I can't wait to visit this place.Highly recommended based on the small amount of their food that I ate and enjoyed so much.

First time visit based on Yelp review.  Absolutely awesome!!!  This is a small family owned Italian deli/restaurant with incredible food. We ordered the Cugino's Special Pizza.  Thin, crispy crust with very flavorful tomato sauce, nice chunks of sausage, onions and mushrooms (we omitted the green peppers).  My husband must have said "this is really good pizza" at least 5 times while eating.  Well, it WAS xcellent!  To top off dinner, we finished with Chocolate Italian Ice.  Yum!  The owner came by to see how we liked the pizza ... he was very friendly and chatted a few minutes.  Very warm and friendly environment.  If we lived in Vegas, Cugino's would be our #1 choice!
Well, I found a new favorite for pizza. We had the Special pizza and a canolli. Best in Vegas so far.

Awesome!! I come here for the food not for the smiles. If you want a fake cheery smile don't come here.. You're gunna get true east coast feel and the food is reasonably price and delicious! The pizza is good.. I recommend the Donny Special.. you can thank me later

Cugino's is my favorite Italian deli in town. Especially for the price. High quality food all around. I highly recommend the Cugino's Special (a sandwich made with prosciutto, fresh mozzarella, and marinated red bell peppers. And if you are still hungry, a rice ball or two.

When it comes to Las Vegas these days it is easy to find flaws...of course being the epitome of perfection as Rex is...it is easy.  Times have hit this city hard. The days of wine, roses and cheap gas for huffing are over. These are the tough times. The rough times. The decline of western civilization times. The times for poorly written and cliched observations.  Rex gets it. Times are tough for all of us. Rex can relate...a few nights ago he did the unthinkable...he ate at Panda Express.  Rex rarely feels shame but he does now. Rex knows that it is awful. Unthinkable. Rex will admit something else. A few days ago Rex huffed diesel insteal of premium unleaded.  Rex has hit bottom...Rex even considered going to the Circus Circus. Rex wept in shame.  Days went by...Rex could barely endure the horror. He ate at Roccos and plummeted further into a depression. None of the usual things made him feel better. Mocking Andre Agassi's hairline...no joy.  Circling cellulite in Star magazine...no joy. Licking the ground in front of Dairy Queen...no joy. Having sexual intercourse with himself...okay...that wasn't bad. Still...it wasn't the screaming ecstasy that Rex has come to expect.    Rex began to wonder...you know what will cheer Rex up...college coeds. Sexy college chicks. So he visited the strip clubs...and was rudely told that you must wear pants to enter. Rex doesn't wear pants for strip club. Rex called them fascists. Rex was beaten savagely by these pituitary cases...these rejects from the CFL.  Rex woke up in a dumpster near the college...his favorite way to awaken. He smelled good food. He walked. He hoped. He put on pants. He smelled again. He rubbed his eyes. He scratched his crotch vigorously. He wrote on a note pad to look for a used antibiotics bottle during one of his "treasure" hunts.  He went inside...he wept.  Cuginos. Cugino's Italian Deli. More beautiful words were never spoken...except the time I said "please don't wake up Jessica Biel." (She didn't.)  Finding this gem in the desert was a shocking turn events for this depressed cow poke...(that was Rex's nickname...Rex "Cow Poke" Marvin...don't ask).  Rex was often told that there is NO INTELLIGENCE AT ALL to be found anywhere near UNLV.  After witnessing an after hours party, and scoring with an 18 year old chick who thought i was Brad Pitt's brother, Stu. Stu Pitt.  I thought they were right....but there are all only 99.9% correct.  The owner and operators of Cuginos are BRILLIANT! They are food genius's.    Great sandwiches. Check. Great ingredients. Check. Willing to serve a crying man with no pants. No check...the one strike against them.  Everything Rex has ever had there is brilliant.  Rex must recommend a few things...because that is what Rex does so perfectly.  Donnie's Special is a great sandwich. Chicken is perfectly cooked and seasoned. The fresh mozzarella is the best...more on that in the next paragraph. The Cuginos special is a great cold sandwich...if only slightly under seasoned.  The penne a la vodka is great.  Everything is great. if I had one complaint it would be that most dishes are so delicately seasoned they boarder on under seasoned.   Rex promised to save the best for last...much like Rex in bed. They make their own Mozzerella and it is the best in the city by far and away. New York curds made into pefect cheese...and extremely reasonably priced. Rex always buys some when he is there and chews on it like biting into bread. Just eats it raw.   Rex understands perfection. He lives it. Rarely can you describe anything in the food business as perfect, and not just for these crumbling times in Las Vegas...but for anywhere any time.   Every other deli in the city should look at Cuginos as the blueprint on how to succeed. Reasonably priced. Great food and uncompromising ingredients.   Rex is your perfect love. You are his perfect fool. Rex will be back to Cuginos. Rex will be back for you...and you will love him for it. Rex will leave...and you will love him more for it. Rex will love the cash he took from your purse.

In Las Vegas we don't have many actual Italian delis. We have Italian restaurants but no actually delis. This is my go to spot for everything italain.  It makes you feel like I'm back in Brooklyn getting a slice and the atmosphere makes you feel back home. The family that owns it are funny real nice guys. The father wife and sons run it. You can buy calimari, rice balls, macaroni salad. They have Italian ices and the best canolis hands down. If you want a real authentic Italian deli feel or just great italian food, then I promise you this is the spot!!!!!!!

the absolute best italian deli in  nevada.   i lived in new york all my life..   these guys used to live in new york also...   they do things the old school way.....  they brought new york here with them when they opened up this treasure.    this is true italian food..  not make believe..  anything you eat in this place is 100% authentic italian..  i would highly recommend to anyone that loves great italian food....you won't be disappointed.....mangia.....

Fresh Basil and Tomato Pizza from Cugino's should have a star on the Pizza Walk of Fame. 5 Star pie all the way.   The shopping center it's hiding in holds years of memories to me. I use to chain smoke Cloves at Cafe Copio when I was in my teens and consume large quantities of cheap beer listening to the Beastie Boys at Tom n Jerry's when I was barely 21. The days when I had less bills and belly fat. My Doc Martens and I ruled the world. Great memories were had here. This made picking up this pizza that much better. On to the pizza.  When I walked into Cugino's for the first time I was overwhelmed with all of the authentic cheeses, meats, breads, pastas. This was the moment I realized I am not just a foodie, but a gigantic food pervert. This is Food Pervert Heaven!!! Just walk in and you will know what I mean.  Fresh Tomato and Basil Pizza- Large for $16.99. Do not make any changes to it. Everything about this dime piece is bangin just the way she is. If you don't like garlic than this isn't the Za for you and we are not friends. I happen to LOVE garlic and this sexy pie is packed with it. Then they throw fresh, earthy basil and firm tommies to the mix and walla. The perfect pie. Don't even get me started on the crust. Let's just say every great painting starts with a fine canvas. I love this pizza.  It's simple and simply phenomenal and everyone I shared it with agreed.   When I was driving home with the pie I felt like I had the hottest date in my car. Seriously, the aroma gently traveling from that box to my nostrils made me high and I couldn't stop smiling from ear to ear.  I can't wait to do this dance again only next time I will be rockin out to Violent Femmes remembering the good ole days in my hometown.  Kudos to Yelp (Rex's review) for leading me to Cugino's. Nacho C. and his birds would have loved this food. Mad props to Cugino's for making an incredible pie. All the other pie shops can sleep with the fishes.

Second best deli in town for me. The pastrami on rye is gigantic!! Must be at least a pound of meat in there!! You can't go wrong with any sandwich here, but I always get the pastrami. Can't be beat. The garlic knots are garlicky, buttery, soft pillows of dough. Melt in your mouth. Really like this place. It's a close second to Carnegie deli.

Bomb sandwiches.  I got the Italian#2 on the way up to Zion and then three days later got the rueben on the way home from Zion (and another #2 for my wife). It was the only good I thought about while in Zion.  Best food in Vegas by far!
Tried so many item from here pizza with olives and sausage, mild wings, garlic knots, and canoli, all was delicious. Will be back again.

Sweet Mother of homemade Mozzarella, this place is the bomb! Last night of working in Vegas and my buddy wants Italian. For whatever reason, a little voice in my head whispers "Cugino's". Now, I've never heard nor seen this place, so I found it pretty serendipitous that it was first on the list when I looked up Italian joints. Intuition, I thank you. Although small and unassuming, this humble joint served me some of the best lasagna I've had in years. Simple, yet elegant. Messy, yet comforting. Their espresso was genuine, as were the owners who served us. We were treated to samples of their homemade cheeses and conversations of home, fighting, and naps. It was a refreshing lil slice of New York charm and know how hidden in this bustling desert. If you claim to love traditional Italian cuisine and you pass up the chance to come by this jewel, shame on you. Finally, in the land of glitz and glam, augmented attitudes and body parts, I've found a place I can feel at home.
This place is a hidden gem.  Great food and great family-owned atmosphere.  I had the spaghetti and meatballs and it was fantastic!

Amazing Italian food! I moved out here from Connecticut about 9 months ago and I've been searching for great Italian food that reminds me of home...this place is the real deal! I'll be back again and again!  P.S. I had the Donnie Special sandwich...fantastic!

Great example of a good Italian deli!  I ordered the rigatoni with bolognese sauce... I could only get through half of it!  The service was great and made me think of old school Italians!  Two thumbs up!!

I have been here several times since the first time I tried it. Originally I was looking for deli meats and olives and found their business card on a closed deli's door that I had frequented often. It was close by so I went. I have been back OVER AND OVER since.   PROS:  *Marinated Olives *Deli Meats *Easter Pie (made for special holidays; its a thick pie of pizza doe mixed with cheese, eggs and italian deli meats. Serve warm. *Stromboli - thin dough rolled with various Italian meats and cheese. Sliced and served warm. *Eggplant Parmasen- Large portion of thinly sliced lighted breaded eggplant and mozzarella cheese covered in their amazing homemade sauce. Served with a salad and pasta. Bigger than a restaurant portion. *The Godfather Sandwich - Fried Eggplant, Mozzarella, Roasted Pepper and balsamic vinegar. *Donnie's Special Sandwich - Chicken Cutlets (thin), fresh mozzarella, roasted pepper, balsamic vinegar and oil. *HOMEMADE on premises mozzarella cheese. The best I have had in Las Vegas. Firm and lightly salted. EXCELLENT.

Very yummy food! So cute too, a little mom and pop store with I am assuming mainly repeat customers.   I ordered the gnocci and I am a huge fan so I was a big critic and I would say I am a fan, next time I do plan to order the pizza next time.  The service could use some work but granted I was a college student with a group so maybe they didn't think too much of me?   Either way yummy food that was decently priced

I'd give them 10 stars if  I could!! Donnie you're the man...  some of the best people in the valley run this place. Best deli hands down in Las Vegas. Best pizza, best sandwiches and best homemade sausage. Best homemade mozzarella too. Do yourself a favor and go eat here. Thank you to the Cugino family for being as great as you are and making me fatter through the years!!
I'm completely in love with their Spaghetti and Meatballs! I highly recommend them, especially since it's not a bad price for the proportions they give you.

Solid all around. Might be one of the closest places you'll go to get an authentic NY slice of pizza. For $6 you can get 2 pieces of pizza and a drink. That's a solid deal for Vegas. The pizza selection isn't great, where they only make cheese, but you can add toppings for like 40 cents. The meatball sandwich and the chicken park looked good as well.   I'll be back to have a few slices in the future. It's not the best piece of pizza ever (props to you NY) but it's pretty close substitute for the area.

I love Cugino's but they did disappoint me the last two times that I was there with guests. The clam linguini was too dry and had no flavor and the pizza was average. They were missing that Cugino's touch! I'll give it a try once more and see...
Great food! Pizza is on point and pasta is deliciouso. I will be back on my next trip to the strip.

Place is not good. I am from Staten Island and the food tastes Mediocre at best. Plus they're a super ripoff. I got a chicken cutlet hero with fresh mozz and roasted peppers, a snapple and a bag of chips and it was $17. Who charges $14 for a hero?! I guess you can when LV has no good italian pork stores including this one.

Food was okay, but not spectacular.  I have been spoiled by very good Italian food.  Especially the Italian sandwiches.  These sandwiches were okay, but a bit blander than I am used to.  The pizza was also bland.  If you are looking for this type of items, go out of your way to Spaghetty Western off southern highlands parkway in Las Vegas.  They have an incredible Italian sandwich and make their own pasta.

I kinda envy the students at UNLV.  It's not because their school is typically rated in the top 50 for hottest studies bodies, or the fact the Strip is so accessible to them, but it's because they can go to places like Cugino's whenever they want!  This is that Italian deli, or any deli really, that you wish was right by your school or work.  It's about 2 miles from the Strip, so you can either take a brief drive down E. Tropicana Ave and turn down Maryland, or walk that way for about 40 minutes. It's obviously more authentic than options on the Strip, and better yet, at cheaper prices.  Once you enter it, you can tell it's locally-owned, as is has that mom and pop shop type look and feel. Check out some of the photos others posted, as you'll see it's not just a counter to order food at and chairs to sit on.  They have lots of foods on display packaged up that you can order or grab, like meats, salads, and breads.  I was afraid to look too closely as I would have spent way more than I planned.  For $9.99, I went with the basic spaghetti and meatballs with included 2 breadsticks and a sizable salad.   If you're visiting Vegas and have your own car, consider heading over here. If you're a student at UNLV and have a break during lunch, just walk on over here. Over, and over.
Love their spaghetti & meat balls ! Their four cheese raviole is also good. I also tried their Philly cheesesteak. All good!

I LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!!  As a NY Italian I have been trying to find authentic Italian food (I'm not talking Olive Garden people, I mean REAL Italian food) ever since I moved to Vegas almost 12 years ago and I found it at Cugino's.  I have never had anything off the menu that I didn't like but my two favorites are their Pene A la Vodka and the Goodfella (roasted veggies with roasted red peppers, homemade mozz on a toasted roll with a little olive oil and balsamic) sandwich.  Oh and their pizza is the bomb too!  Everything they make is homemade... the sauce, the cheese (ricotta and mozz), the meatballs, the soup, the sausage, the.. well you get the picture and it makes such a difference in the taste of the food.  The prices are great and the people are friendly.  If you decide to go for lunch during the week when UNLV is in session, get there early because its not uncommon to see a line to the door.

Great food and very reasonable prices. These same plates fancied up at a strip hotel would have cost me another $10/plate - easily!   My husband was craving a great pastrami and they definitely satisfied his craving!  My only disappointment was I came about 40min after they had opened and the garlic knots I wanted wouldn't be available for another 30min...unfortunate.

I just love this place! Super friendly staff. & Super yummy food. The garlic knots are to die for. Pizza is excellent. Wide menu range. I've been happy with every order I've received, dine in, carry out or delivery. (:

The BEST Italian Sub in the West and for sure the best in Vegas. The wedding soup is also top notch. The whole place is like stepping into a machine that takes you to NYC when you step in the door.  I don't care for the rice balls.They tasted a little bit rancid. But everything else is top notch stuff. This is real Italian deli food!
We really liked the pizza and the garlic knots were delicious. Perfect, laid back New York deli style.

Every review has been on the restaurant but i am going to review on the groceries.  I went in today for marscapone, ricotta, sausage, mozzarella, and parmeasan.  The gentleman that helped ke was super awesome and my cheeses and sausages were amazing and made my recipes even better!  Will definitely be foing there a lot more often.  Thank you!
Clearly a solid hole in the wall establishment! Great service, food was delish. Highly suggest the rice balls and pasta w/ fresh tomatoes and basil.
The best Pizza place ever. I thought Pizza Hut was good, but nothing compares to Cuginos. Employees are the best. They treated us like family. Best pizza in the world that I've tasted!!

Authentic Italian food! Best meal my husband and I had in Vegas. I had the  lasagna and it came with a side salad and two pieces of bread. My husband had the Italian sausage. We both enjoyed our food but the lasagna had the most flavor from the two. We also tried the garlic knots and they were delicious. This is place will not disappoint.

Cugino's is a really nice Italian Deli and Pizzaria that is nestled in a cozy spot across from UNLV. The staff is very nice and will recommend specials of the day if you have never been before. I've gotten the Spaghetti and meatballs and pizza twice now, and let me tell you the portions DEFINITELY fill you up!

Another bookmark bites the dust! I actually bookmarked this place a long time ago after seeing someone post a picture of a yummy looking pastrami sandwich, which I knew my husband would love trying. When we walked in and I saw they had pizza and other stuff on the menu I was excited to give this place a try. They had the typical "pizza by the slice" sitting out on the counter as well the same thing with the garlic knots. I don't mind when pizza is sitting there and gets re-heated, if it is good pizza it can handle it. What I don't like is when it has actually been sitting there for hours. With this place being located across the street from UNLV, I would figure if good pizza is put out here, it wouldn't last long with a college crowd around. I love trying garlic knots from different places, but just couldn't do it here since they looked greasy and like they had been sitting there for a long time. Bummer.  I just asked for a regular slice of cheese ($2.25 each) and a Sicilian slice ($2.50 each) to-go. The regular cheese slice was almost not edible. The slice had too much cheese on it weighing it down and when I picked up the slice it immediately flopped. No folding with that slice! It just lacked any "wow" flavor for me. The Sicilian slice however was perfect. The crust was crisp and chewy where it needed to be and I enjoyed every bite. I'm really glad I tried both because just trying the regular slice wouldn't have me wanting to come back. I don't usually see places that sell Sicilian by the slice so that is a bonus plus the fact that it tastes legit.   They have Boar's Head lunch meat for sale and a variety of sides. Inside appeared clean and there are tables or booths inside and tables outside. Catering is offered. Delivery is offered.

Very nice! Cugino's is one of the few true Italian delis in town, and they have a good assortment of what people from back East are used finding.  Yes, there are plenty of popular favorites that we all know: pizza, meatball subs, chicken parmigiana, etc., and there are also some traditional Italian foods you might not be familiar with.  I have an "old world" Italian heritage thanks to my mom. Every St. Joseph's day, she made arancini, and every Easter she made a pizzagiana. When I first found Cugino's I was floored! Arancini readily available! Mortadella in the deli case! Checkerboard cookies by the dozen! Frozen sfogliatelli to take home and bake!  If you've been looking for food like Nonna used to make, or you're feeling a little adventurous, or you just want some good pizza by the slice, head to the University district and give Cugino's a try.

Another Yelp find thanks to fellow Yelpers.  We decided against any buffets while in Vegas because we know there are good eats out there and we did find them.  We tried the Sicilian tripe soup. Didn't know Italians like tripe but I guess they do. Think of this soup as minestrone with pieces of tripe that are easy to chew because sometimes it could seem like you are chewing on rubber.  I recommend going for the hot sandwiches instead of the  cold ones since they seem to have more flavor.

In Vegas for a show and always use Yelp to find different places. I type in New York Deli and Cugino's comes up.  Check them out online and I was on my way. When I walked in the aroma WOW!  Walk up to the counter and I see  Sicilian Pizza, Rice Balls, Fresh Mozzarella, Italian Ice, Sfogliatelli from Italy, Cannolis... I was in my glory. Great prices and family run business. If you live in Vegas you must give this place a try.

Expensive and not that good. Friend got a eggplant parm and I got a sausage parm, neither that satisfying nor were the portions that great for $9. Girlfriend got a bolognese and came out extremely oily asked to get something else without even touching the pasta and they refuse and finally exchange it was 2 slices of plain cheese pizza which wasn't spectacular either. $13 for $4 worth of pizza. Beware of this place, I don't understand the other review here, doesn't add up to me. I could go to subway and get a better meatball sub then this place or go to metro pizza down the block and get better tasting pizza!

Ordered the meatball sandwhich and this was delish!  I also ordered a slice of cheese pizza.  This pizza was also good.  The establishment is clean.  I went for lunch break and the establishment was packed but yet I got my food pretty quickly.  I will be back for more!

I have been looking for a place like this on the East side of town for quite some time. Thanks to Yelp i have found this little gem hidden away by UNLV. I ordered the Special with Prosciutto, roasted red peppers, mozzarella and balsamic. I also wanted to build my own with mortadella, prosciutto and mozzarella. I mave have confused the guy but i got all this on one..WOW what a snadwhich!! My wife and i split it and it was so filling. The hard roll really made the sandwhich. I also tried the bruscetta. It was on a pizza dough and was ok. I like my bruschetta on a crust piece of bread. I will definately be back soon. There were Italian favorites all over the store hot, cold and frozen. The staff was also very friendly.

Originally, our plan was to hit up The Lunchbox, but at the time, we did not know he was closed on the weekends!  No worries, Plan B was Cugino's Deli  in the strip mall next door. We shared an Arancini, some Garlic Knots, The Sicilian Pizza Special, and whats probably the tastiest Meatball Parm I've had in a very long while!  Looking forward to returning to try other Italian specialities....ALOHA!!!

When I was in the area today, I remembered reading the favorable reviews for Cugino's. It is a cute Italian deli with self order counter, large selection of bottled beverages, grocery items and deli meats/cheeses. I eagerly ordered the Eggplant Parm Sandwich and oh, so disappointed! I was expecting so much more from the great reviews.  First of all, I believe the joy in eating eggplant parm is that creamy texture of the eggplant and the crispy fried breading.  Both fell short.  The eggplant was sliced so thin that there was no texture expect for the stringy skin and the the breading soggy like it had been fried and left sitting.  Come on now, the pictures for the deli sandwiches were nice and meaty. Eggplant is a lot cheaper than deli meat!  For $8 I was expecting a better looking and tasting sandwich, I left there hungry!  The sandwich had 3 limpy strips of eggplant with some marinara only on the top with cheese served with two pepperoncini's on the side. I also thought it was odd that the eggplant was cut into long strips?  Why not preserve the natural oval shape of the eggplant and be generous with your eggplant, let it hang out of  the bread a little.  At least your customers would perceive it to be a better value by their first impression.   By the looks of the reviews and what was coming out of the kitchen, pizza must be there top seller. I will never know.  This isn't a place I'd drive from Summerlin to try again.

Love love! Pizza one of the best!  Garlic knots is simply the best - all gone before I get home. Service is great - very helpful,  layed back n always happy.  Covered outside seating.  The deli products look amazing - must be folks in front of order meats / cheese. .

With no little Italy in Vegas we were happy to find this place. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The pizza was awesome fresh sliced toppings as you watch. Hand breaded mozzarella sticks. I can't compliment it enough. I loved it. Even the cheese is grated fresh. I will return again.

This was our second time visiting Cugino's and it was just as great as first visit.  The sandwiches were delicious.  The chicken cutlet sandwich was tender and moist.  The homemade bread was made just perfect.  We especially liked the Easter Pie which is a seasonal offering.  It reminded my husband of his Italian aunts who used to make it every Easter.  The owners /staff were very hospitable and gracious.  We will come back again on our next visit to Vegas.

I have been going here for a few months now and have tried every specialty sandwich they make.  After enjoying this place for awhile, I felt it was time to write a review.  This is a small family run deli and from what I know from talking with the folks that run it, they are making just about everything from scratch. As I mentioned, I have had every specialty sandwich and while I like most very much, the Donnie Special might be my favorite (by a small margin).  I would also recommend anything they serve with their marinara sauce, it is delicious and has a fresh bright taste.  The mozzarella cheese is made in house and better than any high end mozzarella that I have every bought or tasted.  I love coming here for lunch and of course no meal is every complete without a delicious, filled to order canoli.
Amazing sooooo yummy come here if u love food try it u will love the meatballs sandwich

This place is the real deal. Caprese salad, garlic bread, spaghetti and meatballs, salad, and veal parmigiana were all authentic and homemade in flavor. Nothing was too rich or greasy in flavor. It may look like a simple, plain eatery, but it has a very warm feel to it and you can also eat outside. We ordered so much we had leftovers, but that was the least of our worries because I looked forward to eating those delicious leftovers later.  I like to eat on the Strip for convenience but don't be afraid to venture out a little bit to this place. The espresso was excellent, I must recommend!

Get two slices of pizza and a drink for $5.99 or just the pizza for $4.99. It's an easy walk from UNLV. The garlic knots are greasy and aromatic. Some of my friends eat pizza AND knots AND the mini box of assorted cookies for lunch.

Viva Italia! Fantastic and Authentic. Pastas, Pizzas, Salads, Subs and much, much more. They offer deli meats, desserts, and a variety of other shopping items to make great cuisine at home.  I am a local to LV and travel from Summerlin often to eat and shop here. Absolutely worth it!

Having been raised on the best Italian sub sandwiches and pizzas in the New York/New Jersey/Philadelphia area, I have been on a quest for the same quality and flavor on the West Coast for years.  That search is now over.  Not much to say other than its real, tasty and genuine. The family is so nice - Nando specifically.  Do yourself a favor- you won't be sorry.
Just Go!  The food is good, Italian cookies are wonderful. Crunchy hot sandwiches make your mouth water.  Great place.

THE BEST ITALIAN EATERY IN VEGAS! (and it's affordable too!!!)  This mom n pop shop makes in on our must go places when we're in town.   -Linguini with clams in red sauce!!!! -Garlic knots!!! -Even their Coke tastes better!!! Lol

Rainy day in LAS so decided I needed some down home Italian food items. Thanks yelp for directing me here! Ah - ma - zing! Went for late lunch and asked the guy at the register what I should have - he said chicken parm entree (w/ salad & pasta) & I was not disappointed! Chicken was tender and delish - and sauce (home made) was so tasty. Can't wait to go back and try some of their home made sausages & cheese. Also, peeps who work there are super nice and friendly - always a major plus!
outstanding place, authentic highly recommend the Rubin sandwich!!!!!

so it's a deli, dinner and a mom and pop shop feel. we go here for authentic ny style pizza. we normally order rice balls (the small ones, they don't have meat or peas like the big ones) and a large cheese and we add red peppers and garlic.
Love the caprese sandwich, calzone, and pizza!

We were on a family vacation and wanted to get off the strip. Thank god we found Cugino's. Best food in Vegas hands down. We have made sure every trip back we eat here at least twice. Food is amazing!!!! Wish they would deliver to Ventura, Ca. Everything on the menu is to die for.

2/23/2016  I stopped in and had a Ruben sandwich and my sister had a Turkey sandwich and both were delicious.  Service was friendly and food came out within a reasonable time.  I would return and try other dishes as this is what I think of when Italian Deli comes to mind.

Absolutely the best and most enjoyable lunch we had during our 5 day stay in Vegas.  Hubby had a mortadella and swiss sandwich and I had the pastrami melt.  If you're Italian (we are) or have ever been to a genuine Italian deli, you will love this place.  Ah, the aromas.  Delicious quality food.  Friendly service. So glad that we left The Strip to try Cugino's.

Very nice small family operated Deli. Great tasting food. The staff were all friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed our food. Had Calzones and Spaghetti the first visit and Sandwiches the second time. The homemade tiramisu was amazing.  Definitely a great place and a must try when in Vegas. We will always come back when in the city.

Food is excellent! Must get balls...Rice balls I meant!  Placed a lunch order online, it was so easy with just a few clicks. The delivery charge was only $5 additional, very reasonable considering gas prices are so high, this is a steal!   The delivery lady was 3 min early and the food was very fresh still. Ordered the Godfather sandwich $10, side salad $4, Rice ball $2.50, Cannoli and the Cugino Sampler. The sandwich was huge - loaded with lots of meat, and very tasty. My favorite has to be the rice ball, can't fault a girl for loving balls! The Cugino sampler contains 2-3 of the mozzarella sticks, chicken wings, and fried zucchini. The salad was meh, just some veggies with pre-packaged salad dressing.   Probably will try their pizza next time.

I love this place. It's very 'mom and pop', the same family has been running this place for years. Has the requisite deli market inside, get your canned tomatoes, pastas, etc to go. But don't come here for that, come here for the food and ambiance. Check out there daily specials, always a good deal, always good and you get a large portion here. I can speak for their chicken fingers, nice large planks, cooked crispy and sauce on the side. Their Italian sub is fantastic, layered nicely with the typical Italian meats and cheeses. The reuben sandwich is also great, piled high with corned beef. Making myself hungry just writing about it!
Like always this place does not disappoint, food is great doesn't take too long to get your food either, I always eat here when ever I want some Italian food

Very authentic New York Italian.  The Cheese pizza is perfectly New York Style.  Appetizer combo was good.  Tiramisu and Canneloni was great.    Comfortable environment .  It's also a store and sandwich deli.   Definitely worth trying
Came here because the tiramisu and cannolis were rated so high, and was not disappointed. easily the best in town. loved the charm of the old style italian deli.

Cugino's has become 'must visit' for me whenever I go to Vegas. Their Chicken Parm sandwich is as good as I've had anywhere, and as an added bonus they have Italian water ice! The service is friendly and fast. For such a huge menu, everything I've ever ordered there has been amazing.

Authentic Italian deli in the UNLV area. What to expect!- good food served with a slight attitude at a so so price.  Had the spaghetti and meat balls which were very tasty but only 2 small meatballs for 9.99 at a hole in the wall in the hood? That was surprising. Would still recommend for a long lunch but not a date atmosphere

We were hungry for Italian, it was amazing.  The rigatoni bolognese was fabulous.  The meat balls were firm and not spicy and the Gallic knots were the best. We hope you try them and have a great meal.

Not 5 star pizza, but over and above 5 stars for service. My friend was in town and we were going back to her hotel room for pizza and wine (and if you must know, Britney Spears on the X-factor). We had stopped earlier for wine, but like doofuses we did not think about getting the wine open. They let us use their corkscrew to open up our wine and we returned it and went on our merry way. They could have told us to screw off, but instead they let us borrow it and were nice about it, too.  As for the pizza, I was not as impressed as I expected to be. It was flavorful and the toppings were fresh, but the crust didn't have the crusty-qualities that I look for in a pizza. However, I would be willing to try it again because it is a straight-up deli with olives, pasta salad, sandwiches, various other deliciousness. Plus they were just such nice people that I want to patronize their establishment again!

Wow!! My wife and I had a pedicure next door after flying in. I was starving and came in intending to get some pizza. Instead, I had a sandwich. First, it's like walking into an Italian neighborhood family restaurant. Second, the food is great!! I loved to watch some older Italian guys come in and greet the employees. I highly recommend to stop by!!

So I ordered garlic knots and the Sicilian two slice special. Unfortunately the garlic knots were hard as a rock and the pizza was hard as if it was sitting out all day then just thrown in the oven to get it hot. I've seen the other reviews and maybe next time I can get the pizza right out of the oven to do a proper review on the taste.

My lunch appointment was canceled today, so I decided to head to Cugino's and try their Pizza and Cappicolo/Salami/Provolone Italian Sandwich (#2 on the menu).  Their Pizza is a traditional NY Thin Crust Pizza (see pics).....very good!  Easy to fold...(like it's suppose to be)....Fuggetta-bout-it!  I had a slice of Cheese Pizza to get the lunch started while I waited for my sandwich.  The sandwich came out and was the perfect portion, not too large, not too small.  They use Boar's Head deli meat, which is one of my favorites.  The bread is good and there's just the right amount of oil/vinegar...not too overwhelming like some other sandwich joints.  What a great lunch.  Will I return?  What's the mattah you!....of course!
Fast delivery. Very delicious pizza and wings. Also tried the Gino's special sandwich sooo Good

Wow, a huge disappointment based on the other reviews I read. Maybe it's good if you go to their restaurant, but our delivery was terrible, first they must not read the "special instructions" section on the order page. Since they completely ignored the delivery instructions our order arrived, delivered by "Rose" completely cold, and basically thrown at us with complete discussed on her part. The pizza was worse than Dominos, but to be fair the Greek salad was very good. I don't like to post negative comments but know it's important for both others as well as management if they want to improve.

Just walked in asked for two slices of cheese. Just one dried up pieces. He said they did not have any made. Idiot let me walk out without offering anything else. Guess they don't need the business...

I love Cuginos. Discovered it on accident while a friend was eating at Chipotle and wanted a slice of pizza. I bought two slices intending to bring a piece to my fianc when he got out of class at UNLV... oops. I ended up eating both, because they were SO good!  Fast forward a few years and we pick up pizza there whenever we are nearby. We live across the city and we don't get to eat there very often, but every once in a while I'll mention Cugino's to a friend and I have yet to talk to someone about it who doesn't know the place and love it!  The pizza is great, the garlic knots and deep fried gnocchi are also good. I haven't tried anything else on the menu because I literally cannot get out of there without a slice of pizza.

I don't feel qualified to write an in depth review, I only ordered a Sicilian Rice ball. However, if the rest of the food is anything close, I'm impressed. The rice ball was filled with meat, cheese, rice, and then breaded/fried. It came with a cup of sauce on the side. The sauce was absolutely wonderful. Just the right amount of sweetness and garlic. The price was okay, and the customer service lacked just a bit. You can tell this is a family run restaurant and that they don't mess around about their food. Overall, I will definitely come here again and try other items. The inside reminds me of a Bodega in NYC where you can find good Italian made pizza. There are shelves with Italian products and treats and some tables and chairs inside if you'd like to eat there.

Great little place.... landed in Vegas and wanted to find a deli of some sort so we checked yelp, of coarse. So glad I did!! Found this place and stopped in for a  quick lunch, got Pizza, Meatball Sandwich, and fried Zucchini. It was so good that I forgot to take a picture of the food :) .. Would go back while in Vegas.

Wow, another winning restaurant in Vegas, and as usual, it's not even on the Strip.  Seriously, the next time I return, I'm not even going to BOTHER with the Strip at all, because all the good stuff is on the outskirts.  Cugino's is such a place.    This is sort of a combination restaurant/pizza shop/Italian goods store - it reminds me a LOT of Trinacria at home (which most Baltimoreans adore).  There's a deli where you can get specialty meats and cheeses, pastas, and other goodness.  My husband and I came here to eat, though, and eat we did!  My husband got the Donnie sandwich, while I tried a pastrami melt.  Let me tell you, folks, that Donnie is something ELSE, okay?  The mozzarella, meat and vinegar combined into one huge taste explosion that I will quite probably remember for the rest of my days.  It was THAT good.  And the pastrami melt.... wow.  Huge, juicy, delicious.  I have never had any sandwich in my life that I liked more.    We ordered two cannolis for dessert and they went down perfectly with the meal.  Really, really good stuff.  Definitely rivals Trinacria here, my Baltimore friends, so you have GOT to come over to this place to eat when you visit Vegas.  If we lived here, this would be our go-to shop for Italian staples.  We didn't try the pizza, but we overheard our neighbors-in-food raving about it - something about how they haven't had decent New York pizza since they left New York but they finally found it here.    So now you KNOW it's good.  This is definitely worth a revisit when we come back to the area.  Don't miss this place.  The Yelp reviews are on target here.

This deli was so great that we went back the next day. We started out wanting sandwiches but when we saw the rest of the menu we couldn't pass up all of the pastas.  Ended up with meat raviolis, lobster raviolis, lasagna and tortellini with vodka sauce. All were great but the lobster ravioli were incredible. Thanks for the great food. We will return.
We did enjoy the pizzas. The meatball was excellent and offered a wonderful addition to the cheese
Ordered pizza for delivery and it got here much faster than I thought it would.  The pizza was hot, huge for two,  and was amazing.  I'll definitely order again for a game night.
Place was ok.  Tried the porchetta and broccoli rabe sub.  Meh.  Bought some cannoli to take home.  Meh.   Market looked tempting and will definitely go back to check it out

Food: sandwiches are about $9 each and took about 15 minutes to come out.  We ordered the meatball parm sandwich and chicken parm sandwich which were very good quality sandwiches.   Meatball one was super moist and the bread had the right amount of crunch.  The sauce didn't make the bread soggy which was to my surprise.   The chicken was Katsu style which I did not find to go well inside a sandwich. The Katsu got pretty soggy after being inside the sandwich so I had to remove it as I was eating.    They do have some free samples on the cashier counter for small chips and what not.

Im really a big fan of Italian delis. This places is a really good find here in Las Vegas its across from the university and not far from the strip. The place is clean has a good amount of seating and the food is good. The people that run this deli where friendly and service was good. Here's what I ordered was the Italian sausage sandwich and the garlic knots, the garlic knots where really good and the sandwich was good as well. Like any other Italian deli they raviolis ,pizza ,cheese ,Italian sausages ,salami ,cheese and much more. This place also has Italian ice cream. I would order any of their sandwich here off their menu they all looked good. I will be back next time I'm in town.

To be honest, I've been here countless times and the only thing I ever had was their meat ball spaghetti. It is just the best spaghetti I've ever had. I have had meatball spaghetti in so many places and Cugino's is just so delicious that I am already addicted to it like crazyyyyy. The entree comes with a dish of fresh Salad and two italian bread sticks. The salad is always fresh and tasty and the bread is just unbelievably good.    Not gonna lie that I am not a picky person and I always give 5 stars review everywhere I go, but 100 some people give this place a 4 or 5 stars. You just can't go wrong with CUGINO!  CUGINO CUGINO CUGINO.  MEATBALL SPAGHETTI  MEATBALL SPAGHETTI MEATBALL SPAGHETTI

I met two friends here yesterday for lunch.  We wanted to try several things but some of the normal crew couldn't make it.  After a bit of confusion on our part about what to order and the idea of mixing sauces on one pizza-spearate for each half, we got our order in and then had a seat.  This is a no frills, small spot.  My one photo basically shows all the seating except for some not seen on the right.  You get your own plastic ware and napkins from a table to the left of the deli case and there are salt and pepper shakers there and some hot peppers and other spices you might want with Italian food.  We first got fried gnocchi which were OK.  The marinara dipping sauce was good.  Two of us shared a fried rice ball with some tomato sauce and lots of cheese.  It was good.  Next, we had two pizzas.  Yes, three people eating two pizzas.  We got a thin style white pizza and a Sicilian style Margherita pizza.  Needless to say, one of left Cugino's with some leftovers--me.  Andrea enjoyed the pizza tonight.  The pizzas were both good.  I'm spoiled by a white truffle pizza I'm used to getting so this white pizza was a little lacking.  The Margherita was good with a rich sauce and lots of melted cheese.  We also had an order of garlic knots with their good marinara dipping sauce.  For me, this was the star of lunch.  They had good garlic flavor that wasn't lost when dipped in the marinara.  For dessert, we each had a cannoli.  Thank you M.  This is a great lunch place for students because it's right across the street from UNLV's student center.    I think I'll stop in and try some of their deli salads.  That would be my reason for returning.  The rest was good but pretty standard Italian fare.

This place holds up to the reviews, except it deserves 5+ stars. The pizza is delicious! And the ranch dressing needs to be sold by the gallon. The pasta is so, so good. We ate everything we ordered and still wanted more! We will be back EVERY time we come to town!!

This is now our favorite Italian deli. The food is spot on. I had the meatball parm sandwich, and my wife had the Rigatoni Bolognese. The sauce for her meal was honestly incredible! We also had garlic knots. All the food was delicious. If you come at lunch, there may be a bit of a line because this place is so popular with locals--always a good sign. The owners and servers are East coast Italian, which adds to the experience. Know what you want to order before you get to the counter or you may get a little New York attitude.

The first time I had eggplant on pizza was outside the Vatican in Rome and this is just as delicious. Cugino's is my go to lunch when I'm having a bad day at the office or just feel like delicious pizza and the smell of garlic knots lifts my spirits every time!!

Came here with my wife on a rainy afternoon. Been craving Italian food for a while, and the last place we tried that was similar was Rocco's. That establishment was outstanding so I was kind of using it as a benchmark.  Cugino's is located in a strip mall near UNLV. It was totally packed inside. Everyone was wedged in their like sardines. But it was lunch, so it was to be expected. The line moved quickly and the service was fast and friendly enough.  I first noticed the pizza they had sitting out looked old and pretty dry. A little disappointing to say the least, especially since pizza is what my wife originally wanted. We opted for the meatball parmigiana sub and a riceball.  The riceball was good, but nothing special. The meatball sub was pretty good. The meatballs were flavorful, and the marinara sauce was decent.  The bread was toasted and fresh. If there was any cheese it was very little. I guess this was the disappointment. The sandwich was tiny!!!. Not at all like i'm used to getting at an Italian Deli. Most deli's your so stuffed when your done, you roll out like a beach ball. No such luck here.  Overall I'd give this Deli 2.5 stars. Service is friendly. Food is good, but i've had way better, portions are small, and the dining area is small and crowded. Much better options in Vegas.

Hidden Gem is right! The red sauce is really good, fresh.  We had the sausage sub. They make their own sausage! And take the Cannoli! The cream is nice and smooth, no starchy texture. Going back next time we are in Vegas to try the pizza. :)

Once again, a big thanks to fellow Yelpers for this Gem!  It's not far from the Strip and even if it was, it would be well worth the trip.  My wife and son loved the pepperoni pizza and I had the Italian #2 with the spicy ham (my mouth is watering just writing about it).  After my son polished off his pizza I gave him a bite of my sandwich and he immediately offered to eat the rest of it for me...no way!  But I did feel guilty about not sharing so I let him have a few more bites (but that's all).  The service was fast and really friendly.  We were on a mini vacation to Vegas and the next time we are in town, we are definitely making another pit-stop here, plus I want to try their Italian Ice as well.
Great shop, great guys. Love the food and helped me with so.e candles for my brothers birthday. Small touches like that on top of awesome food.
All hail Cuginos Deli!! Absolutely authentic NY/NJ delicatessen with fresh homemade Mozz says it all! Wish I could have this back in So Cal.
Nice pastrami sandwich... NY style pizza was Nic also... Service was nice to the table... Across from UNLV campus atmosphere...

Wow! wait wait wait.....Wow! Entering the dining room its kind of just what you expect in a strip mall across the street from your local college. Its really a no non sense straight forward deli, order at the counter that has a few tasty items to look over inside of it, racks of some of the authentic product (and some not so authentic) that is used by the joint to create your tasty grub, and an old tube tv in the corner with the Italian soccer league playing for the fans (i am) of the soccer as well as the spot. I met a friend here for lunch this time visiting and ordered two sandwiches a meatball parm and a pastrami that both came with drinks for the price of $6.99 (meatball) and 7.99 (pastrami). Both came out within 5 minutes and good god i was surprised how much meat was on the pastrami sandwich. We traded halves so we can enjoy both and ill start with the meatball and just say this bread is heavenly soft and tasty, with a gravy that i honestly could put in a cup and drink its so tasty. The meatballs were straight forward, i didnt take any special blend of spices or savory flavor additionally as even if there was it was going to be masked by the lovely sauce and bread combo i was thoroughly enjoying topped off with generous servings motz cheese. The pastrami was served on a marble rye as it should be and as you can see from the other pictures provided is at least 1.5" thick with just meat and its very juicy and flavorful. Deli mustard, onions and again generous portions of melted cheese round out this well crafted sandwich. The service is straight forward and welcoming, almost like a family ran atmosphere and the food is served quick, hot and good so that i have experienced. Best advice my review can offer you is TRY IT, and enjoy the tasty goodness of Cugino's.
This place is awesome! Will now be my Go-To for my authentic Italian deli needs and comfort food!
Pretty good cheese ravioli. I think it couldve been better if there was more salt. Wish they could make the food faster. Not a big fan of patient. Overall, i was happy with the food.  :)

I was looking for something different during lunch and realized that the UNLV area was surprisingly close. Cue a visit to one of my older bookmarks in the area...  Cugino's Italian Deli is in one of those plazas across Maryland Parkway from UNLV. Despite its location, I saw few college-age customers in the dining area and none behind the counter. Even without the New York faux license plates and sports teams pennants on the wall, you could get some of the straightforward no-nonsense attitude from the employees.  You can also get pastas, sauces, deli meats, cheeses, and other Italian foodstuffs both packaged and fresh. I was more interests in the ready-made foods, which as you might expect include sandwiches, pizzas, and pastas.  I wasn't feeling up for a lunch special on my first visit (basically several normally priced items plus a free fountain drink) so I went with the eggplant parmesan sandwich ($9.99). It's not a super huge portion, but it has pretty decent bread, savory eggplant, delicious red sauce, and really gooey cheese. The banana pepper really went well with this sandwich too. It was probably a bit of a mistake to skip the meatballs though, and I wasn't getting that really deep satisfaction that I have from other sandwiches. I wouldn't say it was worth over ten minutes' wait.  I went back a couple of days later for that meatball parmesan sub ($8.99). I was hoping for a really mind-blowing meatball, but I got pretty good ones that are still unfortunately not the best that I've had out of a small Italian deli. Same cheese and red sauce didn't quite carry the day.  My favorite part about the second visit was the cannolis. They come both large ($3.75) and small ($1.75). After one bite, I felt regret at not getting the large one. Crispy crust, cold but not too sweet filling, and just enough chocolate. I would possibly come back for those. I haven't had a lot of cannolis, so this isn't saying too much, but they're the best I've had.  Cugino's is a decent lunch spot if you're in the area. I would give 3.5 stars in an ideal world (or an ideal rating system), but I was just was too underwhelmed in my two visits. I would come back to try some pizza or cold cut sandwiches if a friend invited me, but there are far superior hot sandwiches in town.

This place is amazing! So glad we came. I had the Tony Soprano and the bread and the flavors authenic....this place is a family friendly place and there was people speaking Italian here. The bread on my sandwich was amazing.

You have no idea why good pizza is until you eat here. I've at pizza all around the world and this is one of the best. Simple. Greasy. Pizza. Just perfect if you ask me. Plus, the crust has a slight crisp to it making it that much better.   On a side note, if you thought jersey shore are super Italian, you haven't been here! But that's the best part, the guys who work here are suuuppper nice and make you feel welcomed.   I'm telling you, if you want the experience with a side of grease and a cannoli to top it off, come here. Not next week, not tomorrow...NOW!

Just wow. Being right across the street from UNLV is just so convenient. I came into this deli being really full but my friend offered me some Gelato, so I gave it a try. It was amazing one of the best Gelato I have ever had. I can't wait to come back and try their sandwiches.

My boyfriend always buys the frozen raviolis for me to make him for dinner.  They are phenomenal!  I never knew ravioli's could taste like this.  I swear they are like eating pillows or clouds that have been touched by a cheese-fairy.  We also purchase the Stromboli a lot.  My boyfriend enjoys the stuffed peppers but I don't enjoy them as much.  Prices here are super low and it is as authentic an Italian deli as I have found in Las Vegas.
Authentic Brooklyn Italian family run deli & pizzeria in Vegas. So good. Highly recommend.  Coming back for the Italian ice next time! TIP: UNLV students with ID discount
I love Cugino's I've tried a lot of their stuff but this last time we ordered a whole Sicilian pizza and it was phenomenal. Awesome mom and pop shop kinda feel.

So happy that we decided to check out this wonderful business. From the selection of specialty meats and cheeses, to the menu of food available to order, everything was fabulous.   We ordered a delicious antipasto salad that was topped with incredibly tasty salami and cheese. This salad totally set the tone for the treat we were in for. Our pizza came out, and my group devoured it. The crust was perfection. It was sturdy, with the perfect chewy yet crispy crunchy texture. It reminded me of my favorite pizza from my childhood. The meats used are for sure above average. The pepperoni was super flavorful, and delicious.   We indulged in Cannolis, and a slice of their homemade bread pudding. Where to begin? The cannoli was by far the best cannoli I've ever tasted. I did not want it to end. The filling is made in house, and let me tell you- it's heavenly. I was tempted to order a couple more to take home.   The bread pudding was surprisingly scrumptious. We ordered it on a whim after hearing them talk about their Mom just made it. I'm not typically one for bread pudding, and I never think to order it. In fact, my friend was the one that added it the order. Boy, am I glad she did. We sat there and savored each bite. Any time they have the bread pudding on special... order it. Trust me. It's Devine.   I will be back, probably this weekend with my entire family. I want to share this spot with everyone. Such a great experience!

I have been here two times since I started working at UNLV.   The first time I went after work to get some spaghetti and meatballs for dinner. It was wonderful! A huge portion that really filled me up and left me with extra to enjoy the next day.   The second time I went, a friend met me for lunch and we each had a slice of Sicilian and the NY style. Two solid pieces of pizza. They were very efficient at getting the people through the line and they were fun people to talk to. Good atmosphere.

Love this place! Been coming here since my Freshman year of college? Which was in 2012~ I enjoy all their foods from their pasta to their Cannoli.  My favorites are the Lobster Ravioli, which can be a bit pricy but you are paying for Lobster, and the Cugino's Special Pizza.  The Pizza you can get the small size and be able to feed 2 people. Their Cugino's Special Pizza is probably one of my favorite pizzas, highly recommend~!
Had the Donny sandwich, chicken parm sandwich and NY style cheese pizza!!! Wow fantastic is what I gotta say...!!!

NY Italian deli feel. Family working the counter- not the friendliest. The sandwiches were nothing special. The bread was good, but the rest of it was pretty disappointing.   Maybe I should have ordered the garlic knots, spaghetti or pizza like everyone else said to. My fault for ordering the sandwich.

This is the real deal for traditional Italian delies. Fresh homemade mozzarella, the best srsncini ice ever had, and a wonderful selection of imported items that are hard to find. Just love this place!

We visit Vegas maybe once a year, if that.  When we were there last June, we sought out this little place, off the strip, in kinda of a dirty little strip mall, across from UNLV.  Upon arrival, we were a little hesitant to go in but decided what the hell.  It was a small, casual place with Italian grocery items here and there, meats and cheeses hanging from the ceiling over the deli counters but you immediately get the feeling these folk know what they're doing.  The guy who took our order is the same guy who took it today.  He's the owner's son and understood our indecision.  We ordered a couple different items (antipasto, Stromboli, fresh homemade mozzarella, etc. are sold by the pound so you can get just enough to taste if you want to try several different items) and every last dish was fantastic.  Memorable even.  Their marinara is fresh and tomatoey and is served with most dishes as a dipping sauce.  Our guy checked on us several times to make sure we were enjoying everything.  We finished and had successfully overeaten but more so, we knew we'd be back. Today was the day.  We even skipped breakfast knowing this was our lunch destination.  We ordered enough antipasto to taste, a big enough sliver of the Stromboli to each try a little, garlic knots with marinara (holy omg ), a pepperoni and salami calzone to split and a small cannoli.  I'm pretty sure they add a little creamy ricotta with their homemade mozzarella to the calzone and what a unexpected treat.  But that marinara.  I swear it's half of why everything is so delicious.  We again successfully over-ate but don't regret it a bit.   The fact that this place is family owned, 1000% authentic & delicious and these guys are so friendly with those accents....it just wins every time.  We'll be back every trip!
It is Sunday and he we are again . In short. WOW. This is much more than pizza. Tonight it is homemade cheese Ravioli with red sauce. Try it.You will like it.

This is a real italian deli, kind of hard to find now a days. Me being sicilian I really appreciate it. I had a hot pastrami, and it was probably the biggest and best pastrami sandwich I've ever had. It had like 2 inches+ of meat and I could barely fit the sandwich in my mouth! I thought I would never say this, but it was almost too much meat. I couldn't even finish it, and I'm a big guy. Will definitely be back.

So a few years ago my brother tells me this story about how a few high rollers from New York wanted their pool cabana catered by a local deli.  To make a long story short these guys wanted some of the best and authentic New York style deli and Italian food in Las Vegas.    So we figure lets go check this place out. I'm proud to say that after about 5 years this is still one of my favorite places to eat in Las Vegas.  And that's not even with me getting to the food.  Julia and her family are the nicest, kindest,  sweetest people on this earth.  It doesn't matter if it's been a day, a week,  or a few months,  they take the time to chat with you.  Ask how the family has been and always have a smile on their faces. That awesome attitude translates into the food.  Fresh sauces made daily,  authentic New York style pizza,  garlic knots to die for,  and those rice balls.  When I first started going to Cugino's they weren't regularly available,  you had to ask or pre order them.  I always get the larger rice balls with the meat inside.  If you are eating in store ask them to heat it up and put some sauce and cheese on top. Everything from a basic plate of spaghetti to the linguini and clams is always top notch,  hot and amazingly fresh.

My boyfriend and I had an amazingly delicious lunch here!  We will definitely be back for more!  We had the eggplant parmesan sandwich and an Italian sub with the fresh hand sliced meats and homemade cheese..so delicious!  We got a couple of cannoli's to go for dessert.  Great place to go for lunch, get a homemade cannoli and an espresso then some groceries for home!  Awesome family run Italian deli and restaurant.

I came in from out of town on business and had a craving for some good pizza. I stumbled across Cugino's on yelp and said why not. When I went in it wasn't what I expected it was better. A small deli, grocer and pizza joint. My friends and I ordered the Cugino special Sicilian style pizza. Wait was a little long but it was worth it. The pizza was amazing. Crispy crust and delicious toppings. And the cheese, the cheese just kept going and going. After dinner we had the tiramisu and the cannoli's. Again they nailed it. The tiramisu was made in house along with the cannoli 's. I haven't had these deserts in years since my grandparents passed and it brought back memories of what I have been missing. And to top it off the family running the place were extremely friendly and kind. It's and Italian family and they make you feel like it like your apart of it.

Subway should be ashamed of themselves, calling what they make sandwiches i had the a cold sub for about 7 bucks, huge!!! with lots of meat, could only eat half of one half of the sandwich it was so large.  I would come back for the sandwiches alone, but will try something else next time..   Service very helpful, friendly

Is simply the best in town!  The Donny special with marinated eggplant is the way to go.  Love this place and the family who owns it & runs it.  If someone introduces you to this place, you are lucky...

Great place! Was in with a group of 9 - seating was tight, but we were able to find a spot during lunch. Excellent food. our group of 9 had 9 different items and everyone was very happy with food, and speed of service. First time here, didn't see the daily specials, but they are listed to the left of counter where you order. Everything is made to order - so don't be in a hurry. Two dollar signs for lunch $$ right at about $12 /person.
This place is great! Home cooking, fresh authentic Italian Deli! Recently went there and my wife ordered the Pastrami sandwich, Just take a look and judge for your self!

The picture of the homemade mozz drew me in. Boy, was I sad. It was a $7 ball of tasteless solid white rubber. This is not the "fresh homemade mozzarella" any legit Italian would be caught dead selling. I'm embarrassed for you, Cugino. Either learn to do it right (and sell it only while fresh) or don't do it at all. Absolute waste of money.
The Godfather sandwich is probably the best sandwich I've ever had. Thick mozzarella, fried eggplant, and peppers so mild and tasty, it's amazing.

Holy crap this place is good! Their pizza is the closest thing to the best pizza I had (which is all the way in Connecticut). They are super friendly and their service is incredible. This is one of those places I'm willing to drive 25 miles to just foe the pizza!

This sandwich is  and this place is old school AF. Traditional roast beef and cheese on a roll that was baked today by someone who obviously cares about the quality of what they are serving and the sandwich was made by one of the brothers who I'm sure is an owner operator of this local gem. Any asshole can get a $5 footling made a disgruntled employee who's still pissed off that Jared made as much as he did only to blow it in underage hookers or you can aspire to not be an asshole and come a real sandwich made by the people who's only goal is to make sure you're happy enough when you leave that you'll come back again. Support local business and get one hell of a sandwich at the same time. The pizza looks AF too btw

My workplace caters from here and it's the best Italian food that I know of in Vegas. Granted I haven't tried any of the fancy places on the strip, this place is as real as it gets for me. It's tucked away, it's not what you expect when you walk in (I expected to see a full blown restaurant) but this place is great! Italian dressing for the salad is amazing! Highly recommended for pasta lovers!

This was my first visit to Cugino's and this place is amazing! As soon as I walked in the aroma of fresh garlic knots and pizzas being baked lured me in. I  Ordered a dozen canollis and I was expecting to get them right from the case but little did I know they were going to make them fresh on the spot. I am extremely impressed I got them made to order. I will definitely be back tomorrow to order another item from there menu and every day after until I leave to go back to California. Cugino's is going to be on my number one list of places to visit every time I come back to visit Las Vegas. This was a great find I found on yelp thanks to all the pictures and comments. Thanks to all fellow yelpers! If you are looking for a old school Italian deli this is your best bet in Las Vegas!!

The pizza was over prices and greasy and the staff was extremely rude. Placing the order on the phone, the guy talked down to me about how I made my original order (I said through yelp he corrected me on what the system is called like I know!) and when they came to deliver the lady called and was screaming at us like a manic like she had been there for hours. She called that one time. I would never recommend this place.
I like there tomato basil pizza but I also order there cannoli. The price of a very small one cannoli is way to expensive for $1.75.

I want to thank you all for making my chosen parents so comfortable and happy this past weekend. He comes from Coney Island, she comes from Brooklyn, and the high point of their entire Las Vegas trip was talking to you guys about the food, and tasting your wonderful dishes. We ate at high end, high dollar restaurants all week. But the best food we had all week was the food we had each afternoon (3 times, and packed a cooler to take home) with Cugino's. Thank you for all you do....

Just happened to look for good NY pizza while here for the week for a conference & was extremely satisfied.  We came back twice.  Great sauce & cheese tasted fresh.  Garlic knots were great, not overly garlicky, just right.  We also got cookies to go & were a hit.  Peanut butter dipped in chocolate...  Yummy!!!  But the best part was the cheesecake.  OMG, it tasted like my Italian grandmother made it, if I had an Italian grandmother.  It was the best New York cheesecake I ever had.  It was so good plain, it didn't need strawberries or whip cream, perfect plain.  Will dream about tonight.

I wanted to give this place 5 stars but I can't. I'd like to start off by saying their Reuben Melt that I ordered was really good but i was really excited for their tiramisu which ended up being a huge disappointment.   I think this place is genuinely Italian so I assumed their tiramisu would be awesome instead, it came to me not even completely thawed, still a little frozen and tasted disgusting.  I've been to Asian dessert places where their tiramisu is great which is what got me started on the hunt for a great piece of tiramisu.   I guess I'm just really bummed that the one thing I was looking forward to didn't meet my expectations even at the lowest level. :(

If you love italian food and have not experienced cuginos you are missing some great food.  I have tried everything on the menu and have never been disappointed.    Everything is made to order so don't be in a hurry.  By far the best pizza pasta sandwiches etc in vegas.  Homemade sausage mozzerella rioctta now even italian chicken sausage
Cugino's is the best., food is fresh, very clean.

Very rude and short when I called to make an order.  The menu prices aren't what they actually charge when you call and place the order, some how the prices jumped $20 and when I asked the person on the phone where the additional charge came from he became frustrated and said "the price is the price."
Everything's imported from NYC and Italy, even the water for the pizza dough. This family run gem is rooted in NYC and has branched out. This is some of the best quality food I've found in Vegas.

Great food, a true Italian Deli. I ordered a chicken Parmesan sandwich which came out to about $7.99. The size was a bit disappointing for the price. But the food was good, my friend and I both ate for about $25. Overall, the food was good but maybe not the type of place I'd spend twenty bucks to eat.   The ambiance was nice, we were there late afternoon and it wasn't too busy. The inside of the place really gives you a traditional feel. The place does look a bit dated but I think that just adds to the old deli feel of the place.   Overall a good mom & pa restaurant. Support your locals!

I bought 3 for work and they were quick about it. I drove in to pick up and it's a cool old school place. They do deliver btw. I would love to try more here from what I saw there, and pictures on yelp, everything looks good.  Large pizzas are pricey. I paid 64 for 3 large, good thing work paid for it. We had 1 veggie, 1 Margarita and 1 special. All were really good, not quite a 5 star, but still good, among the best so far I've had living in vegas, most of my other pizza experiences here have been ranged from VERY disappointing to just so so.

Thank you yelp! Another great find! I can see this becoming a go-to type of dinner place for me and my husband. The owners/staff are friendly, funny and kind. They really made us feel welcomed!  We were craving pizza; but we're on a budget so this is where we ended up!  It's a deli/restaurant where you can also get your Italian supplies, like pastas not carried at traders or Vons.  What we got: 1. A 10 inch Vegetarian pizza $9.99: 9/10. Thin crust, crispy, with mushrooms, olives, tomatoes, olives, onions and bell peppers. I would hold the bell peppers cause they taste canned. Everything else. Very fresh.  2. Spaghetti and meatballs 10.99. 9/10. Comes with breadsticks and a salad. Plus 4 homemade meat balls. Will request for more sauce next time  3. Large canoli $3: creamy and crisp. Very good 7/10.   Will be back!

I'm not Italian. I'm definitely not from the east coast. I have never seen The Godfather or The Sopranos. But I believe this place offers great Italian food. And by reading other reviews, I am not alone in this assessment.   I love this place. I love that several of the customers and the owners act like they're family. I love the deli and the various Italian products. I love that when I was feeling under the weather and craving soup, they had pasta fagioli (and other soups, too) Do you know how hard it is to find a big  bowl of hearty soup around UNLV? Their caprese salad was a bit pricey at first glance ($8.99) but they give you a lot of fresh sliced mozzarella with basil and garlic. Again, where else am I going to get caprese salad within reasonable walking distance from campus? I am sad I didn't come sooner.

OMG..... This place is amazing from top to bottom!!!! I found it on Yelp and I was not disappointed.... When I walked in it was like being transported straight to New York .... The atmosphere is authentic New York deli ....all the guys behind the counter and even a couple customers had heavy NY accents...the guys working there were very nice to boot... I ordered an eggplant parmigiana sandwich macaroni salad and a cannoli ...the sandwich was possibly the best I've ever had perfect amount of sauce, usually I need extra but I didn't even have to use it ... It was very flavorful... And the bread was quality...and the sandwich stayed together wich is rare with a saucy sandwich ... Next was the macaroni salad ... Wich was very good and was very similar to lnl BBQ.... I haven't ate the cannoli yet because I had no room ... But I'm sure it's amazing as well!!!!!    Overall excellent and thoroughly satisfied .... I will definitely be returning

Man, I feel badly about giving this place three stars. I mean, look at the other reviews! People seem to really like this place! So why do I, someone who loves pasta, just give it a three? Well, here we go...  When I first walked into this place, I thought "Oh, man, this place looks legit!" They sell tons of Italian products here, different kinds of meat, and has a ton of Italian-like memorabilia on the walls... kinda like what Applebee's would look like if it were decorated by Rocky Balboa. But, I didn't come here to look at this stuff. I came here to eat. Everything else is incidental.  I ordered the most basic thing on their menu that still qualifies as Italian: spaghetti with sausage. I should note that the servings come with bread and a salad, though neither are something to shout about: the lettuce wasn't 100% crisp, the ranch dressing wasn't really cold, and they were served on the kind of plastic plates I buy my baby cousin. Already I was getting less and less enthused.   About ten minutes after they brought out the salad came the pasta. Man, it smelled good! Its the kind of the smell that you have to kind of appreciate for a second before digging in! Unfortunately, the scent of the food was better than the food. The noodles were somewhat overcooked, it seemed, and were thinner than I like (though I do not take off points for that, as that's a personal preference of mine). The sauce was good, kinda... good like upscale pasta sauce I buy at Vons, but not good like an Italian person who knows their business made it. The sausage was good, though not spicy like I was expecting (and asked for).   On the plus side, the portions were fairly generous and prices were not too steep. The guy at the counter was nicer to us after a few minutes, though he was never really mean... more like he was tired because it was late.   All in all, I'll probably come here. A lot of the reviews here are really positive, and maybe my experience is an isolated one. But if I come back here again and this place is still a three, it'll be on my list of places to come when you're hungry and aren't feeling too picky.
Some of the best Italian food I have ever had and amazing Pizza! If you have the chance do not skip eating here!

Blair will not approve of this review :) For the high-carb lover...*blush* you can trek over to Cugino's.  This is a family-owned Italian grocery and restaurant with pastas, antipasti, homemade pizza, Boars Head meats, deli sandwiches, eggplant parmesan, you name it. I have a particular fondness for their bread.  They look like mini loaves of baguette, and they are served warm.  Holy (@$)*% once I ordered three to go and thought I would share them with coworkers but I ate them all walking back to my office!!!  They also have yummy garlic knots! Today was a particularly stressful day - I was up til 3AM typing a paper, then got up early for work of course and felt like I deserved something yummy for lunch.  Cugino's has arancini - fried risotto balls stuffed with cheese rolled in seasoned breadcrumbs, served hot with marinara sauce.  WHOA, right?!  I added a mini baguette thingy and wa-la!  Carbilicious! These are super delicious, very different from the truffled ones at Ferraro's (those are more refined of course, and smaller).  I had 2 of these and that was plenty.  yum yum yum they only make a certain amount per day so I better not tell you any more of my noshing secrets :)  Oh yeah and the whole meal cost me under $4.

Wow, what can I say? Wow, Wow, How Now Brown Cow.  I've only tried the Americano 1 and the cheese pizza and the mocha latte. I'm only 24 but is it too early to say that that was the best Turkey Sub I've ever had in my life?  The cheese pizza was good, legit.  The Americano was so good, I stole my little sisters leftover and ate it the next morning for breakfast.  Definitely a 9 out of 10. I think the Turkey would have been better if it was Lobster.  Better than Passion of the Christ.  BETTER than Lethal Weapon 4.
