We started out with arancini (rice balls) and a sampler platter that was good so we were excited about our chicken pizza that was coming. Unfortunately the chicken on the pizza was breaded. Like pieces of chicken fingers that were cut up and put on the pizza. Either we missed that fact or it's not on the menu - but we do not suggest getting the chicken pizza at all ever. The service was good and the food was hot and fresh- but that pizza killed it for us.

In a strip mall across from UNLV, this casual family-owned shop is a great local eatery with easy parking. The garlic bread knots come with great marinara sauce. The pizza is huge with a nice crust, and they don't skimp on cheese & toppings. The chicken milanese is great. Lightly breaded, not oily, served on a salad with side of penne marinara and bread sticks. The food is served with orange trays, paper plates, and metal utensils, but don't let that fool you, the quality is there.

Great food, I recommend Donnie's Special ... their Cesar salad is better than most. A little odd walking into a store type environment, but the food is good and the name Deli should clue you in to this fact. I regret not also ordering their Ruben. That looks so savory.

We don't have a Little Italy in Vegas, but Cugino's takes up the slack. It's like Tiny Italy.  I first heard about the place at a whiskey drinking session. A friend picked up some meats and cheeses from this deli that I had never heard of but vowed to one day visit. Then Lisa L gets ROTD. I decided it was high time.  I went for lunch last Friday. Walking in there, I felt like I was in New York. The place is so Italian, right down to the incredibly friendly people working there. I decided to get a Meatball Parm and some slices of prosciutto. Man. That sandwich was off the hook! The prosciutto was also great, but I went cheap by getting the domestic ($13 a pound). Next time, I'll try the imported ($20 a pound). I was amazed at how full I was after the Meatball Parm and five slices of prosciutto. Maybe because the sandwich came with a 20oz soda.  I wish I knew about this place when I was going to UNLV. Or maybe they weren't there yet. In any case, Cugino's is definitely getting added to my lunch rotation.

The best in the Las Vegas. I dream about the pastrami sandwich from here. fresh marble rye. Also try the italian tripe soup. all the mozzarella is made fresh by mom. This is the super secret spot in Vegas.

Cugino's Deli and Pizza delivers the deliciousness of New York pizza and eggplant parmesan subs to Maryland. That is  Maryland Parkway in Las Vegas, Nevada.      Born and raised in the New York metropolitan area, I grew up with sicilian pizza and eggplant parmesan subs that we call heros in New York. Thanks to businesses such as Cugino's Deli and Pizza, I get to relive the remarkable taste of New York pizza and eggplant parmesan subs.      Cugino's is located in the Runnin Rebel Shopping Center directly across the street from the UNLV Student Union. College students are amongst the many people that patronize this New York transplanted deli pizza restaurant.     The one thing that UNLV cannot teach is a zest for trying new places. This Yelp's job. When I was searching to find a new pizza place, Yelp led me to Cugino's. Subsequently I dined there two times in the last couple of weeks. On the first visit, I enjoyed their $5.99 two slice sicilian pizza special with a fountain beverage then on the second visit I savored an egg plant parmesan hero on toasted bread.      When I stepped into Cugino's, the inside put me in a New York State of Mind. If you have seen Greenberg's Deli in NY-NY, it trails behind this deli. When I looked straight, my eyes took in a display case that included deli staples such as Boar's Head. When I looked to the right my eyes saw the counter, deli groceries, and an additional dining room. When I looked to the left my eyes took in a TV, New York memorbelia including the NY Met's logo, and a refrigerator featuring Dr. Brown's soda. When I looked down, I saw my food on the table. I will discuss the in the following two paragraphs.       When I bit into the sicilian pizza, it was a historical personal Las Vegas dining moment. From the time that I moved here in September 2004 and the preceding Las Vegas vacations, never do I recall eating sicilian pizza. Sicilian is a square pizza that is usually thick. Anyway, since this is the leading sicilian pizza that I recall eating in Las Vegas it truly is the best that I had in this city. Comparing it to New York sicilian pizza is a different ball game. If I compared it to New York sicilian pizza, it is good. After leaving Cugino's and walking toward Coffee Bean, I was determined to return to here try their eggplant parmesan sub.      My determination paid off when I tried their eggplant parmesan sub on toasted bread. The eggplant parmesan sub on toasted bread was out of this world delicious. The $9 and change that I exchanged for the sub was money well-spent. With the fountain drink (only one refill allowed), it came to around $13. In similar style to my previous visit, I paid at the counter, the man filled my soda cup, I waited at the table taking in the New York deli scene, then a few minutes in the future he brought the food to my table. In my opinion, Cugino's did a better job with the eggplant parmesan sub than the sicilian pizza. The eggplant parmesan sub gives New York pizzerias a run for their money. Writing this makes me hungry as I think about the thick juicy eggplant enveloped with mouth watering mozzarella cheese topped off with red sauce between warm toasted bread. Kudos to Cugino's for capturing the taste of a New York eggplant parmesan sub.      I really appreciate that in recent years the taste of New York eggplant parmesan subs and pizza is following me to Las Vegas as more pizzerias and Italian restaurants open and Yelp opens my mind to the established restaurants. The upshot is that I appreciate Cugino's Deli and Pizza.

Thank you pizza Gods, for bringing me this delicious slice of pie.    The reviews don't lie - this place is LEGIT!!   I'm not usually big on Italian food, but a good slice of pie?  That's a different story.  Everything about their pizza is fresh - the crust was the perfect thickness and texture (crunch on the outside, soft in the middle,  just the right amount of (homemade) cheese, and perfectly cooked toppings.  I'm usually a one-slice kind of girl, but I couldn't stop eating this pizza.  Oh - and the garlic knots?  I bought three (two for the b/f, one for me)...and I ate two of them myself before I even got the pizza home.  GO HERE.  It will not disappoint!
Nice welcoming place when you want real Italian food in Vegas without all the glitz.

Great experience. Good food, great service. Family owned and operated.  Hey, if Italians are eating here, so am I. We had the spaghetti and meatballs, fried ravioli and small rice ball. My wife and I were stuffed and are definitely coming back to try pizza and other items.

Finally tried Donnies Special sandwich & boy it was delicious-just as good as the Yelpers say! I highly recommend trying it!  Everything else was tasty & authentic, as always.. their bolognese sauce is out of this world!  Cugino's simply never let's us down!

Best Reuben in town!!!! That's my favorite sandwich, so I've tried several around Las Vegas.  I think I only had one visit where something wasn't right about the sandwich.  Maybe the bread was over toasted or something.  But, even a sandwich can have an off day,... so it's worth trying again!  =)  I made frequent visits here while attending UNLV.  Great garlic knots,  pizzas and pastas!  There's always daily specials too!  The people are always nice.  Genuine and makes sure that you're taken care of.  :)

I am a bit torn on this place- the food was really tremendous. Large portions. However, the delivery driver was rude and they messed up my order and were downright unapologetic.   I enjoyed the Rueben very much. The garlic knots were great. The kids enjoyed the pizza. However, they shorted me one order of bread knots on the delivery. when I called the restaurant, the accused me of lying. They then tried to blame the delivery driver. The driver then blamed the restaurant. Bad customer service.

LOVE...I am in love...with the yummies at Cugino!!!  Cheese Pizza...Thin crust with chewy yet crispy & STRETCHY house made mozzarella cheese...We fought our 6 year old daughter for the last piece!!!  Oh well, she will survive "wink."  Meatball with Penn pasta...yum...the star is the SAUCE.  We can drink the stuff.    Sausage, Pepper and Onion Sandwich...Every ingredients were perfect! Grilled sausages, (not overcooked in sauce like some places).   Recommendation:  add mozzarella cheese and ask for sauce on the side to dip.    Lastly... for dessert Cannoli...love the crispy shell.  The ricotta cream was very good.  Too bad I've been spoiled by New York's Veniero & Le Bella Ferrara...YET Cugino is WAYYYYYY friendlier!  BTW, I would give them a sixth star for being a "Mets" fan!

A taste of Brooklyn right in Las Vegas! Franco and family are the real deal. Fresh mozzarella made daily, that's almost impossible to find nowadays folks. Prosciutto and mozzarella hero off-the-charts. Homemade sausage delicious.Amazing pizza. This family knows the best and they ship in Pastosa Ravioli and Manhattan Special from Brooklyn. In this world of big-box shopping/corporate restaurants this place is a breathe of fresh air, go in and talk to the friendly staff, talk to the Pop, talk to the Mom or talk to the son. Let them feed you and make you happy, that's what they dedicated their life to!!!

I'm tempted to give this place 5 full stars, but I'll reserve that review after a full sampling of the menu. So far, ridiculously good!  I've been there twice in the last same number of days. I had their Lasagna Bolognese yesterday, and their Spaghetti with Marinara sauce today. The Lasagna with their home-made ricotta was gigantic, piping-hot and straight out of the oven, and wonderfully seasoned for my taste (which is light on salt and right on spices). Their Spaghetti was on the money with slightly tart marinara that tasted fresh, and a portion size that could easily satisfy two patrons with a shared appetizer.   The place seems family owned, and you'll find a splattering of Italian regulars that chat it up with the lady at the counter. This place is good. Everything from their Italian dressing, to simple breadsticks, and pizza that my dining partners had -- I gotta try more pizza for sure -- all of it is just good.   The restaurant/deli has a wide selection of fresh deli meats and cheeses, home-made mozzarella and ricotta, and appealing-looking sandwiches that are very reasonably priced, and I suspect, will be delicious when I try. This place is 4.5 right now! Try it, like it, repeat.

Great little italian gem. It felt like I was tasting food on the east coast.   Great quality food, good seating for groups (of course college kids), and big portions (good quality sandwiches that will last you and great on the wallet).  Try the Pastrami sandwiches for lunch. Its a must long with some garlic knots!...Pizza is not that bad either
Yum! Had the Italian #1 and rice ball. Good atmosphere and family owned business, nice people.

im from new york, and now i live in california and im tired of going to places that say they have the best new york pizza and dont!, but this place has every right to say they have the best new york style pizza, i started to weep when i took the first bite!! to be honest it was kinda the best new york pizza ive ever had, atleast the top 5! i dream about your pizza!!!! living here in west hollywood california is no fun when i get a pizza craving and cant quench my craving for that delicious pizza!!! can you mail it?????

Love it here! Las Vegas pizza but with New York taste and even greater people, I felt like home the instant I walked in and felt even better by the time I left   Love it here, can't wait to bring everyone I know

This is a HUGE FIND in Las Vegas where delicious pizza seems to be a mystery.  The storefront is in a little strip mall by UNLV and is 100% worth going trying.  We ordered a white pizza and a pepperoni pizza, an antipasto salad and they gave us an extra little order of the bulk antipasto to try.    The pizza was INCREDIBLE!!!!!  And for $30 for all of it we were pleasantly surprised.  I would recommend this to anyone and will be going back to try some of their other items - I saw their meatballs and they looked incredible too.    Try this place!!!!!!!!
had their meatball parmigiana, stuffed completely, toasty, perfect....Employees were extremely nice and helpful in my decision

I can see why this is 4.5 star's! Pizza and calzone whata great combination! I love them both! If your in doubt, don't be this will be my new pizza place!! The sauce is not to bold and the right amount of spices and cheese!

Every time I visit Las Vegas, I always have to make a stop at Cugino's.  The people are friendly, the atmosphere is nice, and most importantly the pizza is great.  However, last time I took my mom and she ordered the Eggplant parmigiana and I don't think it's a do over.  It just didn't impress me and it was $12. I usually get the large cheese pizza and it's excellent.  I visited NYC for NYE and was able to try NY style pizza in New York.  I ate pizza every day while I was there.  This place definitely comes close and I won't have to fly all the way to NYC to get great pies.  I wish that Cugino's would have some garlic and onion powders so we could put on our pizza though in addition to the Parmesan Cheese and peppers.  Also, the workers here are always so friendly!  We went close to closing (8pm) and they welcomed us with open arms.  We also ordered an order of garlic knots (6pc in an order) and he brought out an extra order of knots for us! Granted, it was close to closing and they were probably going to throw it away anyways, but still, it made us happy!  Definitely a fan of Cugino's!

While the food is always amazing, the service is never consistent.  My standards aren't exactly high for a counter service pizza/ sandwich joint but a smile, thank you or an apology when they forget your slice of pizza goes a long way.  You won't be disappointed with the food but don't  expect a friendly family feel.
You must also try the Donny's Special.  It's not on the menu, but it's quite delicious!

Best pizza period. Best Reuben sanwich I have ever had. Calamari was delicious.  Couple of small complaints.Dining area kinda small and a little too hot in there. One the employees was kinda of grumpy) But I would not hesitate to go back.

I'm originally from Queens, NY, and NY pizza is my idea of what good pizza is all about  Cugino's achieves pizza greatness  The crust is thin, but manages to be crispy AND chewy in all the right ways, the sauce is great, tastes homemade, and the cheese is delicious  We order one large cheese pizza, and take some back to the hotel after we have a couple of slices  It's the closest thing to NY pizza for me. I live in So. Cal, and there's one or two good places, but Cugino's is better  We start every Las Vegas trip with a stop at Cugino's

I really don't understand the reviews on this place. My entire crew of nine was underwhelmed by the food we ordered. I got the Cuginos Special Sandwich. There was plenty of prosciutti on it, but it was the saltiest prosciutto I'd ever had. The bread and balsamic dressing wasn't anything special, and the mozzarella lacked the creamy flavor I love about good mozzarella.  That not so good sandwich was $9.00, and to top it off customer service was lacking.   Try this deli if you want, but definitely don't drag all of your coworkers here off of hwy 15 based on these other yelp reviews.

My Eastside Familia, and go to place for Pizza, Subs, Pasta and cannoli's  Lots of other good things to try.  They make a Reuben that's so big we usually have to split it between us for under 10 dollars!  Consistently good food and service

I ordered a cheese and pepperoni pizza from this place,because I saw it had quite a few awesome reviews so I thought I'd try it out. This pizza is absolutely amazing! I think this is going to be my new favorite spot, I know pepperoni pizza is pretty hard to mess up but you'd be surprised lol. As a local I'd have to say this is definitely one of the better pizza places that I've gone to!

This is one of the best pizza shops that's I have eaten at while visiting Las Vegas. The food is fresh and made to order. Even their deserts are delicious.  But I had to subtract 2 stars because they do not offer Military and Law Enforcement discounts. Also, they do not greet you once you enter their restaurant.

I think I should also mention that Cugino's best item is their homemade Mozzarella.  Many of you may be wondering why Italian's love Mozzarella so much, it's so average at most places you get it.  But once you have real Mozzarella, you immediately understand.  Cugino's makes it fresh everyday, many times several times a day.  It is creamy, salty, and has the perfect texture for mozzarella.  You can slice this stuff and eat it raw, and you will finish it within a couple minutes.  If you've never tried it, go get it now!

We had the nicest time in Vegas until we tried to leave... and got stuck for a night. We found a decent hotel and it was a short 25 minute walk to Cugino's. We both were very happy we did. The garlic knots were small, but delicious! Salad was good. ClamWin pizza was amazing. The side of meatballs and sauce was yummy, but a lil bit cold.  The food was above average. The service was the most pleasant part of our honeymoon trip. Very friendly faces. Thanks guys!

I love this place! I accidentally stumbled upon it a few years ago when I met my friend who was a student at UNLV for lunch. We didn't know where to go and decided to go here.  It is a great NYC style deli that I'm so happy I found. The must have items that I order every time are their stuffed peppers and their cannoli's. The peppers are stuffed with bread stuffing and soaked in italian dressing. They are both to die for and taste so good!   I usually get the chicken parm sub but this time I split the linguini with tomato basil sauce with my mom. It was a perfect portion for us to split since we both don't usually eat large portions. It was yummy but since I'm not a huge fan of cut up tomatoes I would have preferred a marinara sauce. I would recommend trying the chicken parm sub over the pasta. It's one of the best subs I've ever had.  At the deli they also serve other hot and cold subs, pasta, and deli items. You can also buy boxed pasta and other Italian food items. We tried their raviolis they sold in the past and they were really good!   They also sell italian rainbow cookies that they make and those are amazing! A little pricey though (12.99 a lb...) But worth it every once in a while for a splurge!   If you are a big Italian food fan you need to check out Cuginos. You will not be disappointed!

Don't understand all the hype. I won't even waste more money on a second chance.  I ordered for the first time and hubby and I thought it was all gross. Cuginos special pizza was soggy and tasteless. Sauce bland. Fried gnocci tasted like whatever was fried in oil before it. Large meat sauce would be called size small everywhere else and barely any meat in it. Rice ball parmingiana was the only thing I was able to eat as I dumped the rest. I didn't enjoy it really, it was more of a I paid $40 and am hungry thing. The sauce isn't that good so it killed the rest. was too mushy couldn't tell it was a rice ball really more of a mush ball.  No thanks, I wouldn't eat here again even if it was free.

Came with the family and ordered fried zucchini, 2 philly cheese steaks and a sausage and peppers/onions sandwich.  All were very good.  They have also serve Pelligrino by the large bottle so were given a few cups to share.  Located in a strip mall right across the street from UNLV.  Fairly large and they have a large TV so you can watch football while eating.  A steady stream of customers in and out.  Prices were a little steep as just a sandwich was $8.99, but they do offer daily specials, which I didn't notice the board until after ordering.  Solid choice though.

My husband is very picky about pizza/sauce, but he approves!  The garlic knots were so tasty! The marinara sauce that it came with had a kick to it... YUM!  We also ordered a chicken parm sandwich and a two slice cheese pizza combo (with soda). The prices and portions were awesome! You can tell that the bread on the sandwich was made fresh. The sauce and crust on the cheese pizza were perfectly made.   The cannoli was unique - there was a hint of cinnamon to it.  Can't wait to return to try the other items on the menu!

If you're looking for authentic Italian food, this is the spot! The baked ziti was superb and their Italian Subs are a fresh option. The vibe is what really made this place feel like home (Long Island). Will for sure be coming back!
Great tiramisu and homemade mozzarella. The pizza sucked. The Italian # 2 sandwich is about the best Italian sandwich in town. A nice Italian deli and place to grab a lunch.

Very authentic East Coast Italian food. Homemade sausage, mozzarella and excellent sandwiches. I'm going to try the pizza next and I'm already looking forward to it. The staff was excellent and the service was great. Best of all it's only about 1 mile from where I work. I'll definitely be back.

This place was incredible.  The wife found it, so respect to her.  I had Donnie's Special, a huge chicken cutlet on a perfect roll with peppers, onions, lettuce, balsamic vinegar, and mozzarella cheese.  The cheese was the real deal.  Thick mozzarella.  I did a lot of thinking, because I didn't want to be hyperbolic, but I am pretty sure this is the best sandwich I've eaten in Las Vegas, it's between the Donnie and catfish sloppy joe at RM Seafood at the very least.  The bun was crusty at Cugino's, but held everything together well.  And, this is a LARGE sandwich, side of chips not necessary.  The balsamic was an awesome addition to the sandwich.  Finally, very thinly sliced onions, always a good addition.  My wife had the Cugino's special, which is basically the same as the Donnie's, but with prosciutto.  It frankly had so much prosciutto on it, I wondered how they made a profit.  Another enormous sandwich.  I look forward to eating here again very soon to try everything.  But, I don't know how I can go here and not get Donnie's Special.

Went to this place yesterday for lunch after searching for a decent Italian place on Yelp.  What a great decision.  Had the Sausage and Pepper sandwich and my wife had the Turkey sandwich with dressing (Thanksgiving dinner sandwich).  They were both excellent.  Will definitely not be the last time we go to this place.   Just wish it was closer to our house!
The service here is terrible. Wait for fresh pizza takes too long if youre working in the area...youre left with the dried cold reheated pizza thats available otherwise

I can honestly say, that I've had the best "Italian" named Italian sandwich, in my X3 years of life.  Granted, it's official name was "Italian #2" but, I'm sure I'd like #1 too.  My #2 had Salami, Cappicolo and Provolone, very simple right?  It was one flavorful sandwich, with a bang.  The ingredients, meats and cheese were fresh as you could taste the flavors of everything.  I especially loved the Cappicolo, which provided such a kick to the sandwich.  I've eaten Cappicolo before but, it was more like cRappicolo because it never tasted anything like this!  The s/o ordered one of their Canolli's.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Mh84_j7YmRrAcm0DWV4bUw?select=ub8c8QJ5J1U2B-hbfpYvLA  It was delish and cheap!  I love everything about Cugino's; their shop, the food, the overall feel, the smell of the shop, not sure what it is but Italian deli's have "that smell" and lastly, the family that runs it is pretty nice.  Cugino's, among the million other things about Vegas, sure makes me wish I lived there, well maybe more towards Henderson. :)  In the meantime, my jealousy shall continue.
They don't seem to have the beef patties anymore. Boo! Still a solid choice for when I'm on that side of town.

Had the meat ravioli and a side of sausage. Amazing food. Wife got penne with vodka sauce and grilled chicken. She requested we come back again which is rare for her. I will gladly oblige the next time we're in town. Diamond in the rough off the strip.

Despite the high rating, I just wasn't that impressed with this place.  I wanted to like it, I really did.  I loved the ambiance and the fact that the staff spoke Italian to each other.  I didn't even mind waiting 20 minutes for a pre-made peice of pizza and steak sandwich...  That much... :-)  All that being said, the pizza was not that good.  In fact it was mediocre at best.  I would prefer something from the mall.  It wasn't Dominos bad, but it wasn't Gino's in Chicago good by any means.  The dough was really tasteless and the rest wasn't that good either.  The sandwich was ok, but I would expect more.
What a wonderful discovery!!  Absolutely loved everything that we had there!  Definitely stopping there every trip to Vegas!!

Seriously where has this place been all my life? I have seen it before passed it so many times and I'm literally thinking to myself what is wrong with you?! Only reason I knew of this place is because the boyfriend had bookmarked it a while ago. I checked it out on yelp saw pictures, read some reviews and that's all I needed. I will admit some places on yelp are all hype but that's something I like to figure out myself. Not this place. Noooo no my friends. This place is the real deal.   Upon seeing it from the outside you wouldn't think it's an actual restraunt with the blinds barely opened. It just looks like a little Italian market. When you go in you see some booths in the middle and cases of San Marzano tomatoes on the side. They have shelves of Italian pastas, sauces and other Italian ingredients. Then my friends is the display case. Italian cheeses, meats, desserts and oh my goodness Italian heaven.   My boyfriend was in the mood for pasta so he ordered the spaghetti and meatballs and I ordered the Italian with Capicola. Not sure what number that is. We sat down and the food came right out.   Spaghetti & meatballs - as tender as the meatballs were they had to be cooking a while & the sauce. Oh man. Real authentic red sauce. Deeeelish.   Italian - they are not playing with this sandwich. Piled high with Salami & capacola topped with thick slices of provolone , lettuce, tomato, onion, oil & vinegar. It's served on freshly baked french bread which I think is important and made the sandwich stand out even more. This was so good. You know it's a good sandwich when you have more meat to bread ratio and that I don't mind at all. Next time I would just ask for a little bit less of the vinegar. Otherwise It was so good. That bread. Oh man that bread.   I can't wait to bring my family here. Yes it's small but when you come here you feel like family. The people who run this place are very helpful and friendly. I can't wait to come back and try the pizza and the rice balls and the meatball sandwich. Omigahhhhh I want to try everything ! Lol I  will definitely be back to try something this place is the bees knees ! Believe the hype. It's real.

My go to place for pizza...I am originally from NJ and when I need pizza this is where I go.  A great family operation hailing from System Island NY.  You get house made sausage and a full deli and small supermarket for your Italian food needs

A favorite of mine that is often forgotten about... I stopped in for lunch yesterday and grabbed a couple of sicilian slices (square slices for those unfamiliar) and a rice ball. Two things that are often hard to find in Vegas.... at least of this quality. I couldn't wait to eat my pizza so ate a slice in the car on the way back to the office and it was glorious. Brings me back to the good old days back in NY.  If you haven't had a sicilian pizza, you are missing out and this is one of the best in town. They go a little heavier on the cheese than I like but that is typical for sicilian pies. I prefer mine with less cheese and more sauce. After all, anyone can get good cheese... not everyone can make a good sauce.  The rice ball was great as always... walking into this deli is like transporting right to Brooklyn for me. If this place was just a bit closer to work (or home) I would probably be there a few times a week.
Such amazing pizza! Quality and taste we great! Service was exceptional. Had the meat lovers pizza and canolis they were delicious! Definitely going back for my next pizza craving!

The best place to get pizza in Las Vegas I've been coming here for eight years now I've had lots of pizza places in Las Vegas sum are good sum are OK but nothing gets me more excited then this place!! I love it here I love the staff I love the pizza I love the specials I love the decoration I wish I lived next-door to this place what do I recommend honestly everything from sandwiches to the pizza

Yum!  My fianc and I ended up at Cugino's randomly after using the "shake" function on my Urbanspoon app... fun times!  Anyway, when we walked in, we were greeted with an epic-sized crowd for the lunch rush.  That's always a good sign.  My fianc ordered the meatball sub and a slice of pizza, and I had the pasta fagioli and a chef salad.  The sub was really good - the cheese was so... melty and the sauce was delish.  My soup was a little under seasoned, but a little salt fixed that right up.  It was a good meal in a great atmosphere.  We will be back.

My hubby was hungry for Italian food. Looked on Yelp and this was the highest rating and decided to try it out. Ordered at the counter and food was brought to our table. Delicious, amazing food and a lot of it. We ordered the spaghetti and meatballs, chicken parmigana, and penne a la vodka. Some of our entrees came with salad and breadsticks. Our total came to $50 and is usually more than we like to spend on a meal but would definately come back. I would order the penne a la vodka again, for sure!!

This place lives up to it's highly rated billing.  My wife says it's a classic Italian NY deli and the food is awesome.  I had the grilled chicken sandwich with broccoli rabe (leaves) and it's very tasty.  The chicken breast is very moist and soaked in all of the flavors.  What a good deal at $9.99.  My mother in law had the linguine with clams, which was cooked al dente.  Not bad, a classic dish, big portion.  Another good deal at $14.99.  My wife had the pastrami sandwich, very lean meat but still moist and perfectly seasoned with a good peppery taste.  You won't ask "where is the beef" as the sandwich is huge.  Ordered the garlic knots and rice balls as sides, as if we needed to eat more.  Both were excellent!  Goes well with the classic marinara sauce they provide.  A great find, as I'm getting tired of the eating places on the Strip, getting too pricey.

A few friends were discussing how dismal so many pizza places are here in Vegas. As the topic shifted to places that are worth a try, one friend recommended Cugino's near UNLV. My wife and I stopped in about a month ago was was VERY pleased with the pizza they served. We just stopped in again today and was equally pleased. I have lived here for 8 years and this is serioulsy one of the best pizzas I have found in the valley. If I remember correctly they make their own sausage. The crust is fantastic, hand made, a nice crispness, even the smell alone screams quality. We have also had the bread knots and the toasted/fried ravioli. I havent seen toasted ravioli on a menu since I have moved here. Everything has been delicious.  We are looking forward to exploring other aspects of the menu, including some things we are not familiar with, but must be more popular on the east coast, including rice balls, and Jamaican beef patties. They also sell various sauces, olives, homemade sausage n' cookies, and other Italian goodies for the kitchen. Pizzalicious!

Loved the family atmosphere and home cooked food.  The owners moved from NY to Las Vegas years ago and brought their yummy Italian recipes with them.  The lasagna, pizza, and pre-packaged tiramisu were great.  Only a short drive from the strip and well worth the cheaper home cooked food.
Great. All the way around, great. We love getting carryout. Sandwiches, fried sides, all travels great along with the pizza.

I used to come here all the time and it was digestible. This place is inconsistent lately, sometimes ok and usually bad--it has taken a nose dive recently. Please get better! Your meatballs were tough and tasteless except for excessive garlic and your pasta is soft and gross, gravy is sugary and acidic...must be lousy or cheap canned tomatoes. Prices are high for the junk food you serve--so bad. Your servers are rude, especially to women and children, kind of strange, maybe I need to be Vegas gorgeous with no kids, or servers think I won't tip? The place looks dirty! Really filthy. I saw a big black thing pass me in my booth and it could have been a cockroach. I would not be surprised if you get closed down. I recommend that everyone find a better place!

Large portion, the food was hot, and prepared on time for pick-up but I am just disappointed. The fettuccini alfredo was bland. Not creamy and just no real flavor. I just knew it was going to be da bomb after reading the reviews. My friend got the spaghetti and he says it's really good but mine wasn't :(. In my 20's my neighbor Ms. Iannucelli would cook and it spoiled me. Maybe nothing will ever compare.

This was a great place!. My husband and I love Italian foods and this was really awesome!  We chose to go here following fellow reviewers and it was the best choice we've made in a while.  My favorite was their fresh homemade mozzarella, OMG A+++  And the sweet sausage was the bomb to say the least.  We will definitely be buying all our items from here, especially anytime we make our large Italian dinners for special occasions!  Awesome job guys thank you!

This is much better than most sub shops or Italian places here in the city. But if you are used to old school East Coast Italian you won't be too enthralled either. The actual menu has more offerings than the lighted board on the wall , just an FYI.  The veal was real veal not some cheap patty, but it was a little tough. The calamari is a little expensive for what you get.  The sauce was fine,  Very casual place, must be nice for people who live nearby because you can order online and get deli meats here etc too.  The service was friendly in a slightly terse kind of way. The pizza looked good may try one day.

I'm from Jersey and I gotta admit that this place is bomb. They might even be better than some deli's back East, in fact. I've never been disappointed with anything: from the chicken parm to the rice balls, even the pizza is awesome. They even have Pastosa ravioli!!!  Feels exactly like a spot back home, too, which is awesome.  Love me some Cugino's...

I decided to try Cugino's Italian Deli on Thursday of last week. Since then, I have been eating there every single day! Talk about addicting.. right?   I have a soft spot for everything and anything Italian, so this place was absolute perfection in my eyes. It's a family owned deli and the people who work there are great! They remember their customers and make conversation with them to make sure the food is to their liking.   So far I have tried the Calamari, Frutta Di Mare, and the Spaghetti and meatballs.   -The spaghetti and meatballs was the first thing I tried from Cugino's and let me tell you it definitely hooked me. The pasta was cooked to a perfect texture and the meatballs were quite tasty.   -The Calamari was served in a generous portion and was cooked exactly the way I like it. The breading was well seasoned and tasted great with the marinara sauce. Definitely a favorite of mine.  - The Frutta Di Mare was a mix of clam meat, mussel meat, tiny shrimp, and calamari in a zesty red sauce over a bed of linguine. The seafood was plentiful and wasn't too overpowering, which I enjoyed.   I think this place is definitely a must try here in Vegas. If you haven't tried Cugino's already, you are missing out.
First time here, found them on yelp on my way to a class at UNLV. GREAT pizza and a great special, 2 slices of cheese pizza and a drink for $5

Still no luck finding good pizza in Vegas  We had a large pepperoni, onion and pepper pizza. It was burnt on the bottom and covered in runny grease on top. The sauce was ok.  We also had some cannolis and they were fantastic. Two stars for that! The place is full of yummy smells and lots of prepared foods. I'll be going back for some of that.
Amazing!! Authentic italian food! We tried the pastrami melt and chicken sandwich and a side of potato wedges and it was really good! I highly recommend coming here!

Thank god for this place. I'm from Baltimore and I've been trying to find a place that fills the Little Italy sized hole in my heart since I left. Well I finally found it! We got a slice of pizza, a pastrami sandwich, and a cheesesteak sub. The pizza is real New York style pizza. The best pizza I've had since I left the eat coast. The philly cheese steak was tasty and full of steak. Pastrami was real Jewish deli style pastrami. All delicious. And the cannoli was yummy too. I will definitely be coming back here any time I get nostalgic about the east coast. Thank you Cuginos for making my heart a little warmer!
The food is just OK, prices are a little high and the people who run the place  Are rude and very unconcerned.

Everything was so amazing. Italian ices were just like back east. My penne alla vodka was the best I've ever had and my mom loved her spaghetti. She said the meatballs tasted just like her grandma's. I can't wait to come back!

Let me first say that the people running this place were very friendly. I had the white pizza during my visit and it was mediocre at best. Overloaded with Gorgonzola.. My lady and I only ate a few pieces and the pizza was just not tasty. We also had the Garlic knots. Those were just ok as well. We were somewhat disappointed but credited the bad food experience with the fact that they were about 30 mins from closing. Probably won't try again, but 5 stars for service.
Great place great food, have eaten here many times and never been dissatisfied, great employees and appears to be family operated. If I could give more than 5 stars I would, they deserve it.

What a SPECTACULAR find!!! Not only was the Italian dishes authentic and scrumptious but the owner and all his sons were super friendly and warm and made us feel like family!!we came to Las Vegas because we were thrown out of Florida early, although we had planned a National Parks trip already to fly to Vegas..hurricane IRMA forced us out early. we found the place by accident and I cook Italian food from scratch at home and every dish we ate there was done perfectly. "altente"  just like we like on the pasta and they had Broccoli  Rabe and did it just perfectly WHAT A FIND!!!! We ended up eating there three times prior to our journey to the parks and came back and ended our trip going back to say goodbye as the guys hugged us. You walk up and order your food and then when you sit down, they bring it to you with a warm smile or chat. The bread was fantastic and they also have stuffed rigatoni!!! their sauce is delicious and pizza was out of this world!!! What a warm Italian kitchen feel...... thanks "Dom" and bros and family!!! We love ya!
Great food. Donnie's Sub is my absolute favorite. The chicken parm sub is pretty amazing as well. Love the cannoli here as well. You also get a discount as a UNLV student!

This place was pretty sweet. I got the pastrami on rye and whoa they pack that thing down with a ton of meat. Definitely a good deal. I also tried the cheese pizza. It very new york style; lots of grease, lots of cheese lol. All in all it was a great place to eat. Make sure you get there early cuz it gets packed.

Ever since Ciao Ciao on Durango closed I've been in search of a comparable clam pizza.  After reading some reviews from my fellow Yelpers I decided to give this place a try.  I have to admit, I was pleasantly surprised by the quality and taste of the clam pizza.  I recommend the white sauce.  Also tried the standard cheese slices and they were great as well.  They also have a large selection of Italian deli products to go and a full menu of sandwiches.
I love this place, the marinated eggplant and mushrooms are delightful, I haven't try anything that is not worth coming back for! One of the best Italians in town.

I really wanted to give this review all 5 stars cause the food was actually very good! But, we did get it delivered by BiteSquad. Although we did get it delivered when we received it, it was like someone dropped our pizza and was just like "screw it" and still have it to us!!   This was our first time ever trying this restaurants food. So it was very disappointing. My husband still ate the pizza he just rearranged the toppings. I also had the shrimp Alfredo. Which half of the shrimp in my entree weren't cooked all the way. I ended up picking out the rest of the shrimp and ate the pasta which was still good. But sadly the pizza incident just ruined it. Don't know if we will eat here again. If we do possibly not delivery cause they just may drop your pizza.
This Italian deli/restaurant always impresses me.  Reminds me of New York. Not fancy. Just really good food. Always. Nuff said!

In the past I've stopped by here to get individual slices of pizza, unimpressed by the  quality. But today, I opted for the spaghetti and meatballs. They were delicious! I highly recommend this dish. Perfectly al dente, sweet and savory meatballs, perfectly flavored tomato sauce.

Items Selected: Garlic Knots Fried Gnocchi Neapolitan Rice Ball Margarita Sicilian - Fresh Mozzarella, Tomato Sauce, Fresh Basil White Pizza - Ricotta, Romano, Mozzarella, Italian Spices Ricotta Canolli  Located in a small complex just steps off the UNLV campus and part of my regular workday walking route Cugino's Italian Deli had long been on my "to do" list; a Saturday afternoon visit with two friends proving the rumors of pricy yet good East Coast Italian classics to be quite accurate.  Small in size and curt in customer service it was with admitted indecision that our group approached the Cugino's counter and ordering on-the-fly a six-part meal emerged, the $66 meal presented in four courses with plenty of leftovers and mostly impressive results.  Undoubtedly a red sauce joint despite a multitude of housemade salads and sandwiches it was with fried pillows of ricotta gnocchi that the meal began and with each creamy morsel crispy on the exterior but virtually oilless I was immediately impressed - a trend continued in the tender rice ball buried in house-pulled mozzarella and tangy marinara.  Obviously prone to over-ordering, particularly in small groups, our trio next doubled down on a pair of pies and while the thin white pie proved somewhat bland to my tastes with a mundane crust tinged with semolina the Sicilian dazzled as fresh mozzarella formed soft puddles amidst aromatic tomato sauce bright with acid and appropriately devoid of sugar.  Breezing through a plate of golden garlic knots aggressively seasoned with its namesake herb and kissed with butter before finishing the meal with pre-filled canolli already experiencing some sog it was with a bit of disappointment that I was informed neither house-made rainbow cookies nor tiramisu were available outside the freezer but with stomachs full and leftovers boxed as conversation flowed it would be hard to say I regretted much...except perhaps neglecting the tripe soup or eponymous Cugino's Special sandwich, both on the short 'there's always next time' list, though a repeat trek to similar-but-better Montesano's will most certainly come first.

Well that was the best garlic bread, salad, and spaghetti meatballs I've had in my entire life. Of you come to Las Vegas, and you love Italian food, you must go to this place. Top notch deli with an undeniable Sopranos feel.
They have the best pizza & sandwiches! Everything is homemade.. their cheese, bread, and even meats! I love this place (:
Eggplant parm - to die for :) Hole in the wall, hard to find in the back of a shopping center, but worth finding. Great Italian food.

You have to try their rice balls. They are available in a vegetarian or carnivore option. I prefer the vegetarian. This is melt in your mouth deliciousness! The rice is mixed with mozzarella cheese, it is lightly friend and the insides either have meat or marinara and peas.  The sandwiches are always top notch. The pizza is always hot and fresh. Do yourself a favor, if you are near UNLV treat yourself to Cugino's and tell your friends.  The people that run this place are New York Italians. They are warm and friendly.  They also have a lot of hard to find Italian offerings. The best gnocchi you can find is sold there. Love this place!
Have been a regular here since 2012. Every time I go in they know what I'm getting. Awesome family owned establishment.

Before there was Yelp, the reliance on word of mouth was prevalent. I must have talked to all the wrong people because four years of university and everyone I asked persuaded me not to step foot into this place. Now I know all of them were selfish bastards who are trying to keep this place all to themselves.   This Italian deli and restaurant is so diverse that even people with dietary restrictions would be able to dine with few problems. I met a friend after work for dinner. I wish I had taken some pictures, but I was ravenous by the time it all came out. The food appears at a slower pace at Cugino's. Do not write them off. It would be a major loss. We split everything to ensure a large variety. The Goodfella Sandwich is filled with grilled and marinated bell peppers, eggplants, and zucchini. These veggies absorb the aromatic balsamic vinegar well. Fresh mozzarella, lettuce, tomatoes, and onions also come on the crusty roll. I wish they had peppers spicier than a jalapeno or pepperoncini, but it was fantastic. The Garlic Knots and Linguini in Clam Sauce were great, but not as magnificent as the sandwich. We ended our meal with a cannoli. It was not blow your socks off, but anything would pale in comparison to the meal we just experienced.   Now I will go and spread the word of Cugino's like those before me should have. I will not selfishly cling to this shop. Instead, I want everyone to enjoy them as much as I did.

This a perfect neighborhood Deli, great food, real nice deli case and the staff make you feel like your eating at the kitchen table.  You need to try Cugino's next time you need a pizza pie or sandwiches!

I just happened to be near the UNLV and stop by this Deli, what a FIND! The rice Neapolitan rice balls are Awesome. The stuffed cherry peppers are screaming good, marinated mushrooms & artichokes were great! The anti-pasta salad was to die for. I also took a pizza home, OMG it was Awesome! If you like garlic knots that have a strong garlic taste like they should in my mind you will love them! What a Great Find. I will be stopping back in and make the drive just to eat here! Everything I tried was Fresh Fresh, Fresh Great Food, Great Owners I will be back many times

What can I say except "BEST ITALIAN DELI ANYWHERE"   My fiance and I are huge sandwich lovers...I am a huge Italian deli lover...it is hard to find one that deserves a 5 star rating but Cuginos 100% does. Not only is it the best sandwich, we get Italian #1 and #2 and share but the staff, who is all family...are AMAZINGLY wonderful people. It is a great place to enjoy the best sandwich and to be around a family that you can truly tell enjoy what they do.  They use boars head meats and cheeses for their sandwiches...the best bread, soft on the inside and harder on the outside, but not heavy like a lot of torpedo bread... and the cookies are yum yum yummy!  They also have a great selection of Italian groceries to purchase...so you can take it home and cook for yourself!  Thank you Cuginos for a great sandwich every single time we come!!
I had the Rigatoni Bolognese and it was very good. The antipasto salad was not that great. Their Italian salad dressing tasted like it was from a pre made bottle.
Oh yeah this is a great Italian deli :)

Visited Vegas last weekend and after going to the mob museum I had to get a hoagie somewhere.  This place hit the spot.  Very delicious and at a reasonable price.  Be sure to check this place out you will not be disappointed.

Yelp, I'd like to applaud you for not letting me down. I bow to each of you, fellow Yelpers, for you steered me right tonight.  You see, tonight I got home from work and was just too exhausted to do much of anything. So, I settled on delivery and headed over to Yelp to guide the way.   I ended up ordering a Sicilian Rice Ball, the Donnie's Special Sandwich, and the Garlic Knots.   Delivery: I ordered using the site Eat24, which was easy enough. Because of their handy dandy little timer, I was able to see that my delivery took about an hour and ten minutes. I'm right up the road, so I'm not sure if they were just busy tonight or what. I didn't really mind the wait, since I'm just lounging at home--- but if you are rushed, keep that time window in mind.  Let's start with the knots: they're delicious. Flakey on the inside, crisp on the outside. VERY garlicky (which is a huge plus in this Italian girl's world). I feel like they might be slightly improved with a little cheese or something, but I'm not mad at all. My order came with six knots and a thing of marinara--- which was actually a nice sauce, for the record.   The rice ball is. . . well, I don't totally know what I was expecting, but it's big (like, half a softball?). Cooked well, slightly crisp on the outside, mushy in all the best ways on the inside, good flavor.  The meat and pea situation in the middle is really great. Goes really well with the marinara.   The sandwich is the stand out though. Like, the sandwich will be the reason I'll order from here again, no doubt. The bread is flakey, the chicken is huge and cooked well, the peppers are flavorful but not overly sweet, the balsamic is just the right flavor. . . and the mozzarella? Amazing.   Actually, I was saving the other half of the sandwich for lunch tomorrow, but now I think I'm going to grab that other half. Thanks again, Yelpers!

What a cool spot - which I would of NEVER found if it wasn't for Yelp.  Walking in it's hard to make out what this place is exactly. They have a makeshift market selling pasta, sauces and other staples on racks off to the left. On the right they have a deli/restaurant counter where you can order traditional Italian eats.  The folks here weren't the nicest....they just took orders, and didn't care to much to smile or make conversation. They were also in a bit of a fight with one of the tables - I made out that they were family and were arguing about something in the kitchen.....pretty unprofessional. But, on to the food.  I got the Italian sandwich. It comes with salami, mortadella and provolone cheese with a zesty dressing, some tomatoes and lettuce. Super fresh - and a pretty big portion. The wife got 2 slices of Sicilian pizza (along with a soda for just $6 - it was the special of the day!) Haven't had Sicilian pizza in a super long time and this was great. Thick, cheesy and the sauce was delicious. Great deal.  Overall it's a no thrills place to grab a bite. We came here straight from the airport, super hungry and left satisfied.

I used to think that I visit Las Vegas for the glitz, glamour and fun ... and while I'm here, I have to find places to eat.  Now, I will be coming to Las Vegas to eat at Cugino's Italian Deli ... and the rest of Las Vegas' attractions will have to wait.  Yes, it's that good.  If you're expecting a $$$$ experience you can take your butt to the strip. At Cugino's ... it's more like coming home and seeing the family.  It's comfortable and you feel like they've prepared the food how they'd serve it to their own family.  It's like sitting around the table at home.  The flavors here are authentic and the service is friendly.  You can tell by the number of locals that are clearly returning customers, that this place is doing everything right.  My wife and I ate here for dinner.  She's a big fan of thin crust cheese pizza and is very picky about it ... she ranks Cugino's among the best 5 she's ever had.  She says that the perfect cheese pizza must be perfectly balanced between crust, sauce and cheese and she found it delicious.  I couldn't make up my mind, so I had the #2 Italiano sandwich AND a Meatball Parm sandwich (granted, I only was able to eat half of each).  But, WOW!  I'm hooked.  The Papa Cugino came by to each table and gave each of us a sample of what seemed to be an egg, ham, and cheese bread cut like a biscotti.  I forgot to ask what this was, but it was delicious too!  In a town full of self-proclaimed "best this" and "best that" ... we found a place that doesn't have to toot it's own horn ... their customers keep coming back.  In my review book, that means a lot.  When I'm in town, Cugino's has my dedicated business for their excellent tasting food and the heart and soul they put into their business.
Excellent baked ziti, sandwiches and salid. Great find. The outside doesn't look like much but this place has excellent food. Well worth the drive.
Yep, a true east coast deli, great pizza, good sandwiches, fast service at a good price.

This place is wicked awesome!! I grew up in NY and the food is amazing and spot on if your looking for real NY Italian fare. My wife and I come there when we want great Italian food prepared from scratch and almost everything on their menu is made there from traditional family recipes. It's like a hidden jewel in the rough of crappy fake Italian restaurants here in Las Vegas.

This place reminds me of home (Rochester, NY). I have been looking for a place that has a decent sub and I found it. The bread is amazing. The quality of the food is great. I will definitely be back. Highly recommended.

What a hidden gem!! Seemingly I'm not the only one who highly recommends this Italian deli. We decided to stop here for lunch while at UNLV, and glad we chose this over the diner nearby. My very picky son decided to try and split a chicken Parm sub with me, and as we ate it I told him, this is about as good as you're gonna get. It was delicious, and so was the Pastrami that my wife got.   The feel is East Coast, and the food tastes like you want. Sauce, Roll, chicken was all the perfect sub. It was so good my son had to take one to go. UNLV should bring potential east coast students here to inspire their decision to come to Las Vegas.

I was in Las Vegas for work and I wanted a quick take out Italian meal. I ordered the Fettuccine Alfredo and mozzarella sticks from the online option on Yelp. I arrived and picked up the food and noticed the shop was kind a cool "old school Italian deli style" The guy behind the counter was nice and gave me my food and I was off to the hotel.  When I opened the M.Sticks they appeared to be your garden variety frozen cheese sticks. I tasted them and confirmed there was nothing special here. The marinara sauce was tasty and really salvaged the cheese sticks for me.  Next I opened the Fettuccine Alfredo the portion was huge and it looked good but when I tasted it it had little or no flavor. It was like eating a frozen dinner. Fettuccine Alfredo is one of my guilty pleasures but this was not worth the calories.  Sorry I will not be going back here.

After being disappointed by online reviews we tried this place, it was very good, the prices are competitive, the place is clean and proportions are just right.  We had the meatball and the sausage sandwiches. The sausage was really good, the meatballs were ok, too much. The sauce was perfect, made with quality tomatoes, but on this sandwiches the cheese was king, just delicious; stringy and creamy.  Also got the 5lb can of Cento San Marzano Tomatoes for only $12.99. We'll be back. Grazie!

WOW...this is the best place in town, I recommend and escort all my friends, family and acquaintances to this place...I can eat here all day and no heart burn, the best and freshest food in town, AS WELL AS THE FRIENDLIEST SERVICE AROUND....they actually care..... I travel all the way across town to eat here...YOU SHOULD TRY IT you won't be sorry!!!! Tell Freddy, Julia and the boys HI while you're there.
As a former New Yorker and an honorary Italian, this food is BOMB. Best Italian food in Vegas. Wish I could give it more than 5 stars!

ONE OF THE BEST  ITALIAN SPOTS IN TOWN IF NOT THE BEST ?I'm originally from New York so I'm super picky with Italian food but if you want some good food come here ! I've dabbled around on the menu and I haven't been disappointed by anything yet ... I have yet to try the pasta and that's next on the list ! Also if you're dining in they have true authentic Italian snacks ,  pastas  and groceries available for purchase ... along with a deli ! I got some imported prosciutto that was super tasty . If you're a fan of Italian food , I suggest coming here or ordering from here

I asked around who people thought had the best pizza, and this place was mentioned the most. I decided to order a pie for delivery. When the pie arrived, I immediately needed to have a look at the crust because it is crucial to good pizza. The crust is similar to a Brooklyn, New York style. Nice and crispy on the bottom with the remainder pleasantly chewy. The sauce wasn't lathered too think, nor was it too sweet or too tangy. When you have the opportunity, do yourself a favor and give this place a shot. You won't be disappointed. Excellent pizza!

Oh my. This place is next level good. I've only had their sandwiches but that's because I can't get past them. The Italian 1 is the perfect italian sub. And dont let me get started on the pastrami melt...they stack it 2" thick with cheese on both sides and mustard on marbled rye. Definitely up to snuff with a deli in NY.

Classic east coast Italian deli right down to the hanging meat and cheese (plastic for effect) and the friendly staff of few words. All family working, from photos on the wall. During peak times this place fills up fast, but they do a great job of keeping things moving. We got the Cugino's special pizza, held onion and peppers. It was great east coast style. Says the sausage was made in house?? It was link style, I prefer crumble, good but not great. My son got the regular slice of cheese, pretty large slices. The try highlight was the Rice Ball - deep fried full of mozzarella with an incredible side of marinara. It was a delight. Finished with the cannoli- it was ok.  Definitely give this place a try. Get off the strip and get some real reasonably priced Italian.  Also the sandos all looked fantastic. Next time !

Fantastic pastrami melt, the pizza has a crispy crust and the slices are pretty big. The only thing that did not blow my socks off were the garlic knots.   If your looking for a good hole on the wall Italian joint then try this place out.
Found it on yelp was staying at a room near the area. And wanted pizza saw joes pizza but decided to give this a run.   Found out it was excellent and will forever go back.  Great place
Such great, fast and authentic Italian food. The pizza is especially tasty; it reminds me of east coast pizza, yum! Also they offer UNLV student discount!

A home away from home? Yup, that's exactly what this place is! You can buy home-made Italian food,  desserts, breads, meats, and much more!   I enjoyed the Chicken Parm Hot Sandwich and it was amazing! You could share it between two people. (I was only able to eat half). Chicken parmesan is a popular dish but this has to be hands down the best I've tasted.   For dessert I had a Cannoli, and the filling was finger licking good.   Everything was so fresh and truly makes you feel like your eating a home-made meal!   The location is hidden behind the Chipotle across from UNLV, so don't let the looks fool you!

I'm staying at the Westgate Resort.  I researched pizza places that delivered to this hotel and this was one of several.  So I placed my order online, requesting delivery service.  Not having any doubt at all that the pizza would be delivered to my room.  I've stayed at hotels before and have never had a problem with deliveries to my room. So the delivery person called me about 20 min later saying she's leaving the restaurant now and I'll have to meet her at outside.  I'm at a hotel, thus the reason I ordered delivery.  I don't want to get dressed and wait for the elevator and go through the whole hotel to go outside and get my order and then carry my pizza plus two other full bags back through the hotel and wait in line for 10 minutes for the elevator and take it up to my room.  That is the whole point of delivery! And, I tipped!  I wouldn't have tipped had I known they weren't going to bring it up to my room! The delivery driver told me she couldn't bring it up to my room, hotel rules.  So I get presentable, go down 17 floors, find the guest services desk, ask them where the East entrance is, walk through the hotel to find the correct entrance, and go outside and get my pizza.  During the elevator ride up, there's a guy carrying a pizza.  I think, well he's smarter than I am, he probably just got pizza from inside the hotel and is taking it up to his room.  So imagine my surprise when I get off the elevator, and see that he gets off at my same floor, and walks down my same  hallway, and knocks on the door next to my room and hands off the pizza to my neighbors!  I asked him what delivery company he was from (Milano's) for future reference. To make it worse, there are no plates and napkins in my bags - I'm in a hotel! Do you think I have my own plates and napkins?!  AND, the pizza was supposed to have green bell peppers, but instead came with red.  I called the restaurant and asked to speak to a manager.  I was told the manager was not in and they didn't know when he/she would be available because they're very busy.   So, long story short, if you're staying at the Westgate in Vegas, or any hotel, make sure you confirm with the restaurant that they will be delivering to your room.

Dudes....the food was amazing.  I ordered through a delivery service so I could eat in my hotel room (harrahs)....we got a lot of food.  It was all very warm when we got it....garlic knots awesome....rice ball was friggin'great...the chicken wings were still warm and crispy (never occurs when I get takeout)...the chicken cheesesteak was meh...and the pizza was great.  All very flavorful.  I will be back next time I fly out.
As authentic as you can get. I travel a lot and the only other comparable Italian deli is Bay Cities in Santa Monica, california

I was kind of nervous of bringing my sister who isn't such a foodie. The minute we stepped in she complimented how cool the place was. I was completely taken in by the scenery it's so lovely and quaint. As always we ordered a huge meal consisting of pineapple pepperoni pizza, penne pasta a la vodka, chicken wings, and seasoned fries. The salad and breadsticks that came with the pasta were a nice addition. The pasta was surprisingly delicious it was the best part of the meal. The pizza was pretty okay and the wings could have been better. The meal was pretty excellent regardless and I had an amazing time! I will definitely go again!!

I heard alot of hype about this place from city life and from yelp and i went yesterday maybe i just expected too much from it going in. The place has lots of cool stuff to buy like frozen Gnocci, specialty breads sodas and oils.Sliced meats and cheeses.I orderd the chicken parm and my honey orderd the "Dons special" wich is chicken cutlet and peppers and fresh mozzarella.The chicken parm was just like any old chicken parm sandwich nothin special.Alittle soggy because we got it to go my BF DOn special was better because of the fresh cheese, but he scraped all the soggy lettuce off (again prob soggy cus we got it to go) I will go back because there are other things on the menu id like to try.I will make sure to review again hopefully it will be as good as everyone says.
Delicious chicken pizza w/ flavorful sauce. Wings were also good.   Service was not all that great.

Being Italian and from NY (and that's central NY, not the city) I am incredibly picky about my ingredients. I was disappointed for a long time with my options in Vegas until I was told to try Cugino's.   Holy Cannoli!  Thank god for Cugino's! I usually stock up every few weeks leaving with a large box of freshly made mozzarella, hot sausage, bread dough, sauce, Jamaica cakes, cavatelli, raviolis, and hot cherry peppers (which are hard to find).  Everyone is always friendly & helpful at this family run deli. They even carry my box of goodies to my car.   Eat in or take out options, Pizza is great too!

Cugino's is a lot like a place that I visit back home in Austin in that it's an Italian market with various deli products and groceries as well as a counter with an Italian menu to order from.  Unlike the place in Austin, though, Cugino's is decidedly un-trendy.  It's in a strip shopping center near the UNLV campus.  And unlike other trendier options, Cugino's tends towards East Coast Italian-American dining as opposed to more "authentic" options.  I had a slice of their regular cheese pizza and a slice of their Sicilian thick crust.  Both were good, but the Sicilian stole the show, if for nothing else than the extra sauce.  It's a great option for a very quick lunch away from the tourist areas of Vegas -- and at a fair price.

This place is legit!!! My first time after hearing about it from friends.  I am definitely returning and OFTEN.  The flavor was intense for me and authentic.  I split some food with friends and had half of the pastrami sandwich and a slice of pizza which was very yummy! Of course, I couldn't leave without trying their spumoni which topped it all...bits of chocolate and pistachios mixed within the flavors. Prices were very reasonable. Wanting my next date night there :)
Friendly place with awesome pizza. To bad they wont deliver to chicago - we'll definitely be back whenever were in town!

Cugino's is a hidden gem in the middle of Las Vegas.  We've been coming here for just 2 years but we make it a point to try to stop here before leaving back to California.  The food is good and its cheap eats.  The restaurant is located in a strip mall, behind UNLV with a Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf and a Chipotle at the street front.  When you walk inside, the wall is decorated with photos of famous Italians, Italian food items are lined along the wall and shelves, and New York team logos are plastered throughout the store.  On this visit, we needed something quick before going to the KA show at the MGM.  Aside from hot and cold sandwiches, this place also serves pizza and pasta, and offers affordable daily specials which won't break the bank (and that's important in Las Vegas!).  We started off our dinner with their garlic cheese bread.  Its a simple starter with garlic and melted cheese on a thick Italian roll.  For our entrees Stephen and his dad ordered the spaghetti and meatball special, which came with 4 meatballs. Stephen's mom and I had the meatball Parmesan sandwich special. It was loaded with lots of cheese, and I could have easily shared one.  The portions are generous, and you won't leave hungry. Its a great place for a starving UNLV student. As I said, the place won't break the bank.  The total for all 4 of us came to $45 with tax, and we left in a food coma.

Went tonight for dinner.  Had the most amazing cheese pizza....crunchy on the bottom, hot gooey sauce, and the most amazing cheese!  Me n' the hubs both ate dinner for a whopping total of $10.80.  What a deal! You can't even eat dinner for that at McDonalds.   There were a lot of old folks in there and everybody was talking to each other (I guess they're regulars) and that's always a good sign.  I enjoyed it.  I'll definitely be back.

What cha talkin bout??  This place rocks...I think family business or appears as such. Great food..they close too early but Hey not complaining.  I just need better time mgmt. haha  Yummy am headed that way today.

Cuginos is a great place to stop for some good italian food. I usually do just the Pizza slice combo which is two slices of pizza and drink for 5 bucks. The pizza is pretty spot on every time. I have had better in Vegas, but its right up there in my top 5 or so. They also make great salads and sandwiches. The staff is always friendly to us when we go in. If you go in, ask Donnie if you can try a piece of their fresh homemade mozzarella. Its the best Mozzarella i have honestly ever had.

We visited on our last trip and ordered the eggplant parmigiana sandwich, rice balls, and cannoli. It tasted as good as Brooklyn's Red Rose restaurant. We will definitely visit here often when we move to Las Vegas in a few months. Salute/cheers

It was Saturday afternoon and I wanted to try something new. I am a sucker for sandwiches, so I settled on Cugino's after a quick search on Yelp. The first thing I noticed was the sticker on the door advertising Boar's heads meats and when we walked in they were speaking Italian, double win! This place is part deli, part Italian grocery store, and part restaurant. Although, I did find the plastic meats and cheeses hanging over the deli counter a bit tacky.   I was initially going to try their pizza, but it looked like it had been sitting all day. So after a quick look at the menu, we settled on the pastrami melt and spaghetti and meatballs. The pastrami sandwich was gigantic! It was also pretty delicious, although I am not sure I could eat a whole one simply because it was so rich. The pastrami, melted cheese, and secret sauce made the sandwich fantastic. I am not a huge fan of rye bread, but I did end up stealing half of the sandwich from my husband. The spaghetti and meatballs were good, nothing spectacular, but good. The sauce definitely made the dish, it was simple but also had a depth of flavor. The meatballs were good, but nothing special. The spaghetti was OK, but could have been better. There was little bread stick on the side and let me tell you it was fabulous. It was crispy on the outside but nice and soft on the inside. So delicious and unexpected! Overall, I would like to try more of what they offer, but I think that sandwiches are definitely the way to go here.

Best pizza I've ever eaten!! Family owned and very friendly. I was in a trip with extended family from Indonesia and the 2 teenagers practically bagged to come nback within 48 hrs. Their tomato and basil pizza was too die for.
Seriously, I see someone's Nonna in the kitchen. Authentic neighborhood deli like you'd find in NYC--only with full menu.

Molto bene!  Prego!  With overflowing gratitude to my co-worker and Yelp Lt. General Supreme Goddess Jaime who HIGHLY  encouraged I forgo a boring Subway lunch for something a little more exciting.  With only 30 minutes for lunch, a person has to really ponder the worthiness of the extra 3-4 miles each way.  In her most nonchalant way, she mentioned she loved her meatball sub SO MUCH that when she inadvertently dropped a meatball on the floor it was almost good enough to pick up and eat.  My kind of foodie!  The General also recommended I call ahead but I opted to use their online ordering service via  eat24.com.  (Cugino's has their own website, but when you want to pre-order to are redirected to a Cugino/eat24.com website.)  The online ordering process was a breeze.  I am a web guy and I really appreciate that.  The ONLY reason I only rated Cugino's with 4-stars was it was my understanding when I provided my CC to eat24.com I had already pre-paid for my food.  So, when I arrived to pick up my food I was surprised when the nice lady asked for my CC.  I understand now why they do it that way....If I actually never pick up my food, I could request my CC company nullify the charges.  Major props to Jaime as when I picked up my food at 12:05pm, there were at least 10-12 people in line.  So, I was able to smile and breeze right by.  The few times I get to feel superior in this world is when you order food correctly and leave the average joe's (hi Terri.....lol) in the dust.  Brought the food back to the office and I was not disappointed.  In fact, if I had dropped a meatball on the floor in our workplace kitchen, I WOULD HAVE PICKED IT UP and eaten it.  LOL  As you can tell my photo, the side salad was pretty huge.  A great lunch value for $11.  I would highly recommend this place, I would become Yelp friends with Jaime (cuz, she knows her stuff), and I would order ahead online.

This is a 'real deal' New York Italian deli. I simply love their Brooklyn pizza and eat it weekly. It was the lunch special that got me hooked on this place. The Reuben, Pastrami and Meatball Sandwiches are killer! I highly recommend this ma and pa shop!

Excellent. It's an Italian deli, pizza, and grocery in one. The bread for sandwiches is fantastic and their pizza is just the style served in Rome (pan style pizza vs. thin neapolitan style for the uninitiated).  Great staff. Next to UNLV and relatively near the strip.
So happy we found this place. Real italian food at great prices. The rigatoni Bolognese is delicious.

What a find while on vacation. I found Cuginos on Yelp and we have been here 3 times already. We  will visit one more time before we depart.  This is very casual, home cooked dining at it's best. We love having a few good lunches away from the strip and tourist traps. Their Sicilian rice balls are the best you will ever have. They are moist, not greasy and filled with a delicious meat/ mozzarella  center. Their fried gnocchi are also worth a try along with the pasta fagioli soup.  They have many specials and offer eat in or take out. I learned that they are transplanted New Yorkers (Staten Island) which explains the familiarity we felt. Our frequent visits in such a short period of time speak for themselves.  Don't miss out.

This review is long over due, I came here last year during my 3 weeks vacation. This place is way overrated when I ordered my food the owner was non stop coughing. When I got my food the owner was still coughing all over my food. I ordered the following  Pepperoni Pizza 2/5 nothing special & nothing stood out  Chicken Parmesan Sandwhich 2/5 same thing here nothing stood out  Service 2/5 having the owner coughing when I got my food was not good  After I ate the food I too started coughing I don't know if it's the air or the owner coughing has to do with it. I don't know how this place got such high ratings I'd had better pizza & chicken parmesan else where. After my experience I would not be coming back anytime soon.
Not very good. Heavy on salt. Not worth the price at all. Employees are also rude, they are unhelpful, and extremely sweaty. Also the area inside the restaurant seems dirty and dusty.

Got the white pizza, garlic knots, and a cannoli when I went here. The pizza was a thin crust and had amazing flavor. The garlic knots were not as big as I had hoped but I will say the flavor was spot on and the size of them actually worked out because I wasn't too full to eat my other things. The cannoli was delicious and was perfectly crunchy and not chewy. It was expensive but I would say it's worth it. If you want amazing pizza I would recommend this place. Also the shop has many authentic Italian goods to buy.

Great authentic Italian deli! I had the Cugino's special. It was a great sandwich. The rest of the party had the chicken parm sandwich and another the Italian. Wish I would have tried it earlier because of its proximity to UNLV, but will still go eventhough I am no longer a student. Can't go wrong with these authentic New Yorkers!
Fresh  marinara sauce.  Best Meatball sub I have ever had.  Great authentic Italian restaurant.  Really good food.

Came here for husband's pizza craving.  We ordered the small eggplant pizza for him, which he liked enough that he inhaled the entire thing almost by himself.  I thought it was just fine.  It was my first time trying eggplant, and I didn't know what to expect.  I do not consider this NY style pizza.  Yeah the crust is thin, but it's almost got a cracker feel to it.  Better than Secret Pizza in the Cosmo.  Ingredient quality and freshness unquestionable.  I also ordered the garlic knot (nothing special), cheese arancini (nice to try, won't order again), and the fried ravioli (yes!).  I think I'll be coming back to try the pasta or a sandwich.    Overall, this place is reasonably priced and sells quality food.  I lurv Italian delis, and so wish we had one back home.
Lunch delivery emergency! Cugino's to the rescue. Phew!   This is a chicken parm sandwich that knows how to treat a lady RIGHT.

Cugino's is right across the street from my work and it is delicious! My friend and I went in for lunch today. I ordered the Cugino's Special Sandwich and it was delicious! The mozzarella was by far the best I've ever had. We also had the garlic knots and an order of fries. The place is pretty small so it gets packed during lunch time, but they take call ahead orders if you're short on time.

Born and raised in Brooklyn NY and this place is legit.  There were 5 of us and the food was impeccable.  It brought back memories from when I lived in Brooklyn.  The sauce was so good after I finished off a Chicken Parm.  dinner (which was delicious) I ate almost all the bread cleaning my plate.  I will be going back for more.

This is one of my favorite pizza joints in Vegas! Perfect for the average college student, conveniently located across the street of UNLV with amazing (and decently priced!) food.   My two favorite things here are the cheese pizza and the ranch. The cheese pizza fulfills everything I want in a New York style pizza: pizza sauce perfectly seasoned, melted cheese that clings to the piece when you take a bite, and all on top of a thin crust with lots of grease (yes you read that right). The kind of pizza slice that you have to fold in half to eat.. That's my shit. As for the ranch, they charge 50 cents for a small side, but let me tell you, it's worth it. They put raw garlic in it, and I sure love me some garlic.   They have some pretty good specials too (my favorite go-to is the two slices of cheese pizza with a drink for $6.99) and their customer service is always super friendly.  I also gotta say I love the ambiance of this place, from the shelves stacked with Italian brands of pasta and tomato sauces to the walls covered with Italian or New York decor, and especially the family that runs the place.  I wouldn't recommend, however, the white sauce with pasta or the salad. The salad is bagged ice berg lettuce and bottled dressing. As for the white sauce, it tasted like a jar of Ragu alfredo sauce.  Just stick with the pizza, trust me on this.

Love this place and I can't find anything wrong with this classic Italian deli.  Counter service with a very expansive menu and a small store where one can purchase many Itallian goodies.  I've had several sandwiches and each is excellent.  I prefer the Itallian #2 when in the mood for a cold sandwich.  Pizza looks good and so does everything else.  Loved the Cannoli and the next time in I'm going for the stromboli.  Get your Italian deli fix here!

Who thought a REAL NY joint could be found in Las Vegas. We did the buffets for a day or so and then we found this place. As a native NYer living in the SW I thought the good pizza, sausage, peppers  and onions and eggplant Parmesan was 3000 miles away...Wrong! They can be found right here. In a week we did everything on the menu and never looked back. Great food at less than casino prices. Try it, you'll like it.

Food was authentic as Italian food gets. Lots of meats and cheeses to create your own charcuterie plate. Pizza was delicious. Tiramisu was amarretto-y! :) spumoni had chucks of cherries and chocolate bits. Soo good. Found our Vegas Italian spot.

Came here last week and it was truly awesome! Had those garlic knots and never tasted anything remotely close to them, they were that great!   Enjoyed the atmosphere and ambiance, truly seemed like a neighborhood hangout!   Ordered a pizza, the one with six slices, and it was also great! Not my favorite but a close runner up! Had sausage and pepperoni on it and was very pleased!  Next time an in Vegas this will be on my short list.

Nothing fancy -- in fact, it's a small deli in a dark, sort of creepy strip mall -- but it's the real deal for East Coast-style pizza and sandwiches.  The Sicilian is the kind you find in New York/New Jersey and usually not too many other places, with a thick, crunchy crust and a particular flavor that nails the NY style.  And they have cannolis and other Italian treats, and the staff is friendly (they have the NY accents, but not the NY brusque manner).  There's no decor to speak of -- just New York stuff on the walls, unadorned Formica tables, a TV with a ball game on -- but the food's on target.
My new favorite Italian restaurant! Delicious!  We had the large pepperoni pizza the crust was crunchy very flavorful. Will be back soon!
